story:
Short Summary

Hi! I’m Katia, my mission is to share my passion for wholesome and natural food - the way it should be - with the world! I have traveled and lived the corporate life in big cities such as Paris and NYC, but growing up, I spent every summer on a farm in Greece. From picking fresh eggs, to harvesting grapes to make wine, to milking sheep to make feta cheese, these are the memories that make up my childhood. Learning about the importance of freshness, appreciating homegrown produce, respecting nature are the values I grew up with. 

The nostalgia of pureness and authenticity is what led me to embark on this journey and start Greece in the Box!

My mission is to help you enrich your meals with simple authentic ingredients. Greek food is special because it is wholesome and non-processed. Traditional farming practices have been kept for generations and the thousands of small farmers and producers in Greece understand the value of quality vs. quantity. I am also an avid believer that wellness should not come at a price and that proper nutrition and natural ingredients should be easily accessible to everyone!

The Mediterranean Diet is no secret! It is the best in the world thanks to a combination of eating habits and sourcing, but you don’t have to live in the Mediterranean in order to enjoy its benefits, Greece in the Box is bringing it directly to your table!

Our Funding Goal 

Our funding goal is $20,000. Your support will allow us to create a sustainable delivery system in order to automate processes for monthly deliveries, setup a logistics center in Northern Europe in order to be closer to our customers, setup our online subscription site, expand to all-natural non-food related products such as beauty products, soaps, facial creams, baby products, and most importantly to spread the Mediterranean way of living.

Our Unique Perks

Our perks are unique, 100% natural products from all over Greece. Your daily meals will be enriched through authentic and deep flavors with ingredients that enhance your health and wellness. You most probably won't be able to find them anywhere outside of Greece. And if you do, they certainly won't be cheap!

Are you a Greece lover? Planning a trip to Greece this summer? Another exciting perk is that we are offering unique culinary tours in Greece! Live like a Greek for a day or a week! From Athens to the Greek islands, we are planning hands-on experiences on combining food with travel.

If we Don't Reach our Goal 

In the unfortunate case we do not reach our entire goal, we will still be able to meet our fulfillment requirements as our crowdfunding campaign does not depend on collective funding in order to deliver the end product.

We will of course have a shortfall on our general investment, but this will also be the determining factor on whether we will be able to proceed with establishing a delivery service or not.

 

The Impact

CHANGE. This is the impact we want to make to the food industry and to consumer habits. We want to change the industry and allow for pure and natural local products to become easily accessible at a fair price! We believe it is our duty.

Authentic sourcing, supporting traditional farming practices, food freshness, seasonality, and small-farm economics are at the heart of our work.

While the Mediterranean cuisine is globally renowned for its health properties and distinct flavors – the way locals eat and appreciate food, which makes all the difference, is not as widespread. Eating healthy can be simple, delicious and affordable! We want to be leading global advocates of the Mediterranean Diet and it’s health properties.

Our Impact reflects our values:

  1. Quality: Our number one priority is to always provide the best products Greece has to offer. Sourcing from the best!
  2. Partnership: We believe that strong partnerships in any kind of work is key to success. Our partners are part of our team. We aim to empower hard working and small family-run businesses in order to create a sustainable means for Greek farming and artisanal production to grow and prosper.

 

Risks & Challenges

Box Safety:

We have conducted months of testing on box deliveries. Since most of the products in the box are in glass jars or bottles, our main priority is that all of the products arrive safe and intact. Testing has allowed us to be very careful with our wrapping while keeping an elegant look, we believe we have found the solution and that all boxes will arrive safe and sound.

Fulfillment:

Should this Indiegogo campaign be a massive success, we will need to get smart about how we are sourcing; we do not want to cut corners on quality. We have partnered with some great farms and producers, have worked with them in great detail, and are confident we will be able to fulfill all demands.

Shipping Risks:

We have partnered with one the world’s leading shipping/currier companies and have good confidence they can deliver your Greece in the Box on time and intact, even if we are sending out thousands of boxes.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t order a box or visit Greece? We appreciate any action of support. Help us by spreading the word to your family and friends!

story:
Pioneer Food Truck & Catering Co. is a collaboration between myself; Jean-Luc Matecat, and my fiancee Lindsay Taylor. Together we've set out to open a food truck that embodies our love of exciting dishes from around the world, the incredible foods found here in our home state of Vermont, and finally our dedication to having the best customer service that we possibly can. We recognize that is ALL about making the customers happy and coming back, and thats what we've set out to do with Pioneer.

       I've been in the restaurant business for over twenty years from Dishwasher to Executive Chef, and Lindsay matches my passion for food with her dedication to customer service, and front of house talent. We will bring our individual experiences, and shared entrepreneurial spirit to our business. This funding will allow us to accomplish the remaining projects that we need to finish, in order to be open on schedule for this season. We've come so far, and this would help provide that final push! We have a fundraising goal of 5,000 dollars that would cover the three remaining expenses required for us to open, these will be outlined below. We've done an exceptional job of keeping expenses low during the opening of our business.  By supporting this last fundraising stage of our opening,  you will help our vision transcend from a longtime dream into reality. We'll launch the food truck from our home here in Mallett's Bay, where we also have started our micro farm that will supply the truck with primarily herbs, flowers, and a few fun vegetables! 

       Our Campaign will sell a combination of Perks, with a goal of raising $5000 dollars. These Perks come in the form of "Pioneer Coppers". These Coppers are available in a variety of denominations, with the deal getting better and better with higher increments. The "Vermont Coppers" are a playful nod to Vermonts first official State Currency first used in 1785. Each "VT Copper" will have a value of $1USD, and can be used to purchase any food, or merchandise from Pioneer Food Truck. This will allow us to not only raise money but, also bring patrons to the truck where they can sample our food. This will hopefully create return customers, and help spread the word of what we're doing. These Perks are a great incentive because in addition to helping us open up, all of you supporters can get some really delicious food, for a great deal!

      These funds raised from this Campaign will be applied to 3 major areas:  1-Purchase the vinyl graphics necessary to complete our rebranding of the truck. 2-Cover legal fees for state, and city vending requirements. 3-Purchase our opening inventory of food, and paper goods to begin vending immediately. To elaborate, first off the lettering & graphics will allow the truck to be spotted and identified easily. This is essential for the development of our brand, and will help attract customers and increase sales. Secondly the vending/operating fees will allow us access to premium spots and events throughout our community, which will greatly improve our revenue stream. Lastly the capital for opening inventory would allow us to launch %100 stocked, and fully prepared to start fully prepared to serve as many meals as possible from day one.

Using our combined experience, and strong work ethic we've striven to eliminate as many of the challenges in our path as possible, and now turn to our community to help us with our final strides to open. We couldn't do it without the support of patrons, friends, and family and we want to thank you all from the bottom of our hearts. Even if you aren't purchasing Coppers a simple share of this page will help. We so look forward to cooking for you very soon, Happy Trails!

Each "VT Copper" will have a value of $1USD, and can be used to purchase any food, or merchandise from Pioneer Food Truck. This will allow us to not only raise money but, also bring patrons to the truck where they can sample our food. This will hopefully create return customers, and help spread the word of what we're doing. These Perks are a great incentive because in addition to helping us open up, all of you supporters can get some really delicious food, for a great deal!
      These funds raised from this Campaign will be applied to 3 major areas:  1-Purchase the vinyl graphics necessary to complete our rebranding of the truck. 2-Cover legal fees for state, and city vending requirements. 3-Purchase our opening inventory of food, and paper goods to begin vending immediately. To elaborate, first off the lettering & graphics will allow the truck to be spotted and identified easily. This is essential for the development of our brand, and will help attract customers and increase sales. Secondly the vending/operating fees will allow us access to premium spots and events throughout our community, which will greatly improve our revenue stream. Lastly the capital for opening inventory would allow us to launch %100 stocked, and fully prepared to start fully prepared to serve as many meals as possible from day one.
Using our combined experience, and strong work ethic we've striven to eliminate as many of the challenges in our path as possible, and now turn to our community to help us with our final strides to open. We couldn't do it without the support of patrons, friends, and family and we want to thank you all from the bottom of our hearts. Even if you aren't purchasing Coppers a simple share of this page will help. We so look forward to cooking for you very soon, Happy Trails!

story:
"The doctor of the future will no longer treat the human frame with drugs, but rather will cure and prevent disease with nutrition.” ~Thomas Edison.

MEET SHO

I am a serious advocate for the real food movement. Cooking nourishing meals, practicing nutrition, and understanding the ways that food impacts our overall health, is my passion.

Growing up my diet consisted of processed foods, plenty of sugar, and very little nutrients. Due to this diet, I was ill most of my life. The first 25 years involved way too many antibiotics, nasal spray, and other over the counter meds. I was always sick with cold, flu, strep throat, and intense joint pain. Then I moved towards healthier food, and noticed an increase in vitality and a decrease in pain. I realized just how many other people must be going through the same thing, and I wanted to share this important information with the world. 

This newly found vitality triggered my desire to move toward optimal wellness, so I signed up for nutrition school. My nutrition education taught me the importance of eating a diet consisting of REAL FOOD.  This is the very fuel that makes our body run optimally, and now I'm over 40 and I feel epic.

I studied at Bauman College where I received a comprehensive education about clinical nutrition, food politics, sustainability, and the knowledge that we are truly what we eat.

I have been a guest speaker at various food conferences, radio shows, rallies, worked in a functional medicine clinic, and taught educational workshops and classes in New York and San Francisco in an effort to enlighten the public on how real food can transform their health.

While my journey as a nutritionist has been fulfilling, I am ready to take my dedication and passion to the next level to become a therapeutic personal chef. That is why I'm here, to reach out for help in achieving my goals. Through this process I will share my knowledge and inspiration through my incentives which are based on many years of nutrition experience. 

"Cooking is an art, but all art requires knowing something about the techniques and materials” Nathan Myhrvold

THE IMPACT

My passion for food is more than a desire to cook satisfying meals. I believe that everyone should have access to healthy, wholesome food. I have researched and experimented with a wide variety of ingredients and recipes. Currently, I educate people on eating consciously and how a diet of real food can transform their lives. Many people don't realize that healthy eating can be super simple, but first you need to make the  connection between food and your health. That is where I come in.

With the added skills I will gain from this program, I plan to educate, inspire, and feed an even wider audience far more effectively.

THE SCHOOL

Bauman College emphasizes local, organic, seasonal food. The program lasts five months, plus a six week independent Culinary Externship.

Natural Chef Curriculum:

  • Culinary Nutrition and Kitchen Basics
  • Food Foundations
  • World Cuisine
  • Midterm
  • Farm to Table
  • Therapeutic Applications
  • Client Services
  • Culinary Showcase
  • Final Presentations
  • Culinary In-House Skill Hours
  • Culinary Externship

"The Natural Chef Training Program is committed to the development of nutrition-based, therapeutic chefs who are artists in food preparation and presentation. Coursework emphasizes nutritional and therapeutic cooking as well as a mastery of all necessary kitchen skills, including knife skills and ServSafe® requirements for safety and sanitation. In addition to culinary skills, instruction in business development, marketing, and large scale food production will help prepare students for a wide variety of careers upon graduation.

In-house Culinary Skill Hours further hone students' culinary prowess, while an independent Culinary Externship allows students to have hands-on experience in the area of their choice: as a personal chef or caterer, in a natural food restaurant, for a community kitchen, at a retreat center, in a cooking class, and more."

http://www.baumancollege.org/programs/natural-chef

What I Need & What You Get:

Here's the breakdown:

  • $10,000 would cover over half of the tuition. If I reach more than the expected goal, (dare to dream!) then I would use it for books and the remaining tuition. 
  • The perks are based on my years of experience as a nutritionist and are designed to serve your health and busy schedules.
  • If I don't raise the full 10k I will still move forward in enrollment and continue to work hard to fund the rest of the tuition. I am driven to make this happen!

WHY YOU SHOULD SUPPORT ME...

  • I love food but I don't care for the food industry. Food has lost it’s way. We live in an age where fast food and toxic foods dominate our shelves and bodies. I’m not out to make war with the food industry...but I’m making effort to reduce its dominance, one group at a time.
  • I will gain confidence in not only my abilities as a chef, but as someone with the tools to help heal and support a wide range of clients.
  • Natural Chefs are in great demand as our society realizes and needs guidance toward healthy food, nourishment and lifestyle.
  • This program is the launching pad for a future using food as a therapeutic source to be combined with my nutrition expertise.
  • This program will provide me with the tools to build a  deeper health-centered career.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

Some people can’t contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help. So even if you love my idea but lack the resources to pledge to its success, you can still help. Sharing on social media and with friends and family who would benefit from the perks would be greatly appreciated.

story:
Short Summary

We want to do something different. We want to make an amazing nitro cold brew coffee and bring it to the Vallejo and surrounding communities in a fun way. That’s why we started Up Bay Coffee Pedalers, a literal bicycle built for brew.

Our idea is to bring nitro cold brew coffee to the people as a way to connect, live, and enjoy coffee together wherever we are in the moment.

We started by working with local roasters to develop custom blends for our cold brew base. Cold brew is the process of steeping coffee slowly, over a period of 18-24 hours in cold, filtered water. Cold brewing extracts a deep, flavorful coffee concentrate that is lower in acidity, less bitter, and smoother than traditional hot brewing. By adding nitrogen to the coffee, it creates a creamier, full-bodied mouth feel that has enough sweetness that brings out the bean’s individual character and adds sweetness, so there’s no need to add cream or sugar.

Our unique brews will be small-batch handcrafted and will highlight the incredible roasters we have in the Bay Area.

Here's what they're already saying about our cold brew!

 "Distinct flavor. No Bitterness. Enjoyable!"  " I'm a fan!"  "Great flavor" "More extraction, fuller and richer.""Super smooth and strong." "I liked the finish. No bitter aftertaste." "Incredibly smooth. Less acidic." "Delicious!" "Really loved the cold brew." "Wanted more." " I loved it. It is very smooth, there is no acidity or bitterness. In fact I would drink it without cream or milk. Thank you, UP Bay Coffee, I am your fan!"

Serving our nitro cold brew from a bike is not only a way to be more agile and mobile, but is a carbon neutral, environmentally sustainable form of transportation and an innovative way to connect with the community and get to know neighbors. 

We will be designing and building our customized brew bike from the ground up using recycled materials, which will not only be more cost effective but also environmentally friendly, and versatile.

We will be stationed at various farmers markets and at special events in Vallejo and surrounding cities, like Benicia Main Street's Farmers' Market every Thursday 4-8pm beginning April 27.

You can also find us at:
Jen Tough Art Gallery at 336 Georgia Street in Vallejo every Saturday 9-2 and 5-7pm  
Dillon Bread Company's Artisan Kitchen PopUp twice a month, 451 Ryder St., Vallejo.

And, once we have the bike finished, we will be looking into places to pedal around on regular basis. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our cold brew is tested and ready. We have the product, we just need funding to help us get pedaling. Money raised will also go toward building our bike, purchasing equipment so we can scale up production, and offset other start-up costs. We need to outfit our custom bike with two 5 gallon kegs, a nitro tank, and dual nitro taps. In addition, we will need to make modifications to the cargo box to make sure it’s insulated, sealed, and meets the stringent California Health Codes.  We will be working closely with the health department every step of the way.

Along with the bicycle funds will be used for:

  • Commercial kitchen rental
  • Various and myriad licenses, permits, insurance, and inspections
  • Continued Research and development - testing beans from various roasters, and creating more signature recipes.
  • ​Test marketing to show proof of concept. Banks love that!
  • Basic inventory setup. We need cups, ya'll!
    ​

Here's a sampling of the cost breakdown:

LICENSES/PERMITS/FEES
Food Processing Permit $400 - Goal Reached!
PCFMA Application Fee $200 - Goal Reached!
Benicia Application Fee $169 - Goal Reached!
Solano County Temporary Food Facility Permit $149 - Goal Reached!
Vallejo Stall Fees $1600/season (April - October)
Benicia Stall Fees $1008/Season (April - October)
$1,000,000 liability insurance $1,000
Commercial Kitchen Rental $900

BIKE BUILDING
Bike parts, ANSI-approved panels, sealing and insulation $2100
Bike Review w/ Solano County Health Department $130 - Goal Reached!
Solano County Health Department - addt'l review fee $113 - Goal Reached!


EQUIPMENT
Commercial coffee grinder $900
Cold Brew System $699.95
Second Nitrogen tank $75 - Goal Reached!

In exchange for your support, we have some wonderful Up Bay Coffee Pedaler Perks from t-shirts and logo-engraved glasses to handmade wood coasters and coffee keg parties!

The Timeline
Our goal is to be up and pedaling by spring!

February - Our commercial kitchen lease begins and we start testing recipes and doing pop-ups.
March - Fundraising. Business licenses. Submit schematics for our bicycle to health department.
March/April – Building the bike. Schedule initial inspection and begin modifications.
April/May - Final inspection from health department.
May/June - Launch Up Bay Coffee Pedalers as a mobile coffee business!

The Impact
Our mission to work with a variety of local artisan roasters will highlight the quality of beans being roasted in the Bay Area.

Using a bike means we will get out in the streets, meet our neighbors, and be part of our community in a unique way.

Our custom bike will allow us to bring our nitrogen cold brew to the people, wherever they are.

Risks & Challenges
Starting any new business is a risk. Some of the hurdles we have to overcome will be health inspection and permits. We have our schematics ready, along with Quinn's modifications for approval. Once we secure funding, we can get started on the physical bike and head back to the health department for final inspection and more modifications if needed.

With our passion for coffee, Quinn's background in making and my background in project management, we have the tools, knowledge, and skill to build this company. 

We appreciate your support! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about our campaign to all of your coffee-loving, bike-loving, community-loving friends, family, and co-workers! 

Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram @coffeepedalers.
Tell your boss about us for their next office party. 
Consider us for your next event, festival, or opening.

Most of all, please share this campaign, far and wide. 
Many, many thanks.

See you on the streets!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Gisele, I've been an entrepreneur owning and operating local businesses to serve my home town of Erie, PA since 1999. I'm excited to share with you my vision for unique, internationally inspired coffees and teas, as well as locally crafted liquor, wine and beer set in a cozy, casual, and entertaining space. Located in the historic Federal Hill district of downtown, I've chosen to make my roots here to be an integral part of the revitalization efforts of this eclectic neighborhood and to be a mainstay in the community as a gathering place for great commentary, discussion, poetry, art, and acoustic entertainment.

With your help we can bring much needed diversification to Erie's social venue scene. A place where families feel welcome and friends can connect without compromising on either/or...you know: either find a sitter and get wine, or bring the kids and get coffee; either listen to music and can't talk to each other, or able to talk but not with music and beer. I believe we should be able to enjoy ANY beverage at ANYtime with ANYbody we want, while enjoying live, local talent. Help me make this dream a reality!  

What We Need & What You Get

We need $10,000 to finish updating our historic space to house our progressive little cafe, which includes: electrical and plumbing work, fire safety and ADA modifications, furnace and A/C upgrades. Many local businesses are already coming to our aid, offering discounted services and cost saving resources to utilize our fund raising as effectively and extensively as possible!

The perks I'm offering are as fun and unique as our cafe will be! I'm offering a variety of options that will appeal to everyone, regardless if you are passionate about coffee, tea, espresso, wine, beer, liquors, incredible pastries or merchandise. There is something for everybody to enjoy at the Tipsy Bean!

I believe we will be overwhelmed by the support of our community, but if in the unlikely event that we do not reach our $$ goal you can be assured we will still open and have you enjoying those perks next month. We have our list of needs and necessities prioritized so that it allows for us to use the funds that do come to have us open in November and complete the updating work while in operation.

 

The Impact

Erie is in the process of recreating it's identity and making strides to be a start-up friendly, tech savvy, locally sourced and supported community making solutions for international challenges. These are exciting times for homesteaders and transplants alike, but to entice people to stay or relocate here to continue the progressiveness we need to become the city that is also known for it's great social environment, inclusivity, diversity and dedication to artistic expression.

The Tipsy Bean is a major component, in a strategic location, that will help create this shift for our city's identity. I want to utilize my experience in leading cooperative efforts by being at the forefront of collaborating with other local cafe's (and other supporting industry businesses) to establish diverse social and experiential opportunities for residents.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

The past year has been riddled with challenges, most of which I have tried to overcome on my own. Issues with re-zoning and repurposing have caused the greatest strife, specifically having purchased equipment I'm unable to use, requiring purchase of more equipment, as well as the difficulty in satisfying modern fire, safety, and ADA regulations in a 125 yr old building which sent the blue prints back to the drawing board 3 times.

I'm so close I can smell the coffee brewing! I just need a little help to cross the finish line! 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you know someone who can assist in sourcing an affordable HVAC replacement, or you have a great connection for signage and marketing materials???  I would love your assistance in any capacity even if you can't do a monetary one.

You definitely know people who would benefit from, and thoroughly enjoy spending time at the Tipsy Bean, so please share my story and campaign with them! Email your contact lists, invite your social media connections, friends, family, neighbors, co-workers, random strangers and passer-byers!!! Use the easy share tools here or just copy and paste the link. However you can support is greatly appreciated! =)

You definitely know people who would benefit from, and thoroughly enjoy spending time at the Tipsy Bean, so please share my story and campaign with them! Email your contact lists, invite your social media connections, friends, family, neighbors, co-workers, random strangers and passer-byers!!! Use the easy share tools here or just copy and paste the link. However you can support is greatly appreciated! =)

story:
Transitioning out of the military was one of the hardest things I have ever done. Dealing with PTSD in a new environment proved to be difficult and I felt out of place. I wanted to find that sense of brotherhood again, but I dealt with a generational gap everywhere I went. My college classmates were a decade younger than I was, and we had nothing in common. The American Legion and VFW's were filled with service members old enough to be my parents; I was lost. One thing I knew was I wanted to open a brewery and now had even more motivation. Opening Charlie Foxtrot Brewing is my way of trying to help others not feel like I did during my transition. Offering a place where that brotherhood is experienced by everyone. Charlie Foxtrot is about more than just beer, it is about people and what we can do to help each other.  

Short Summary

Charlie Foxtrot Brewing is a veteran owned brewery coming to North Port, Florida. Founders Nicolas York and Timothy Price met while deployed to Afghanistan in 2012. Nicolas was an infantryman and Timothy was the medic assigned to the platoon. Their experiences are what drives the mission for Charlie Foxtrot Brewing, raising awareness and funds for non-profits that work with the mental issues service members deal with. Currently 22 veterans commit suicide every day, through personal experience we have identified that the transition out of the military is a huge factor in these numbers.

Our goal is to create an environment that brings a sense of community to everyone, once you walk in the door you are family. The brotherhood that creates a bond between people so deep they are willing to do anything for each other, knowing someone always has your six. Even though we have a strong military focus we want to ensure everyone feels this way. Knowing that mental health issues affect more than just service members and needs to be a topic people feel comfortable talking about.

This campaign will allow us to obtain that goal and start to change the attitude towards mental health issues. While bringing a fun, community-based brewery for you to gather with us. Your contributions will allow us to open our doors and start to create that sense of community.

What We Need & What You Get

Charlie Foxtrot Brewing is raising $70,000 through this campaign. $60,000 is the amount needed to secure the loan which will be used for equipment, furnishings, kegs, tap handles, and initial ingredients. The additional $10,000 will go towards service fees, perk purchases, and perk shipping. If unable to reach our goal funds will be used to fulfill perks and the remaining will go towards the $60,000 needed to secure the loan.

We are offering two types of perks for you to choose from, 11 personal perk levels and 3 business sponsorship levels.

Perks range from The Private to The General, which is a way for you to honor someone special in your life who also loves beer. We will share their story during tours of the brewery (if you would like) and have the 250-word plaque pointed out. This is another way for us to create that sense of community.

Share your love for Charlie Foxtrot Brewing by showing off your merchandise! You can even have a private party with your choice of keg!

The Impact

Charlie Foxtrot Brewing has partnered with The 22 Project in Delray, Florida to help support their mission of healing veterans. Not only are they providing medical treatment to veterans, but they are advocating on the behalf of veterans to the Veterans Affairs Administration. Helping push for alternative treatments and better treatment. We have created the 22 Troop Lager which will have 22% of profits donated to the organization to help them treat more veterans.

So far, we have had 7 beer recipes tested and completed to perfection for your enjoyment. We have won business pitch competitions with the Florida Veterans Program that has allowed us to get to where we are now. We are looking forward to being a part of the North Port community and getting involved with local organizations we can help support. We have already started to work on collaborations with 5 local businesses and are excited for even more collaborations.

Risks & Challenges

Like any small business there are always risks and challenges to get started and be successful. As the world is being affected by the Coronavirus pandemic, we have all been impacted. Even though we are not open, we too have been impacted as construction times have been pushed back and financial backers have had to reallocate their funds. So that is why we are trying to gain your support and help inspire the community with brighter things to come!

We have started to work with the city of North Port on the regulations and requirements for us to open the brewery. We have had great support so far and expect that to continue as we submit special exemption requests and apply for federal licenses. We are determined to open in North Port and have felt immense appreciation so far from every community member we have spoken too. If opening gets pushed back, we will continue to do everything to open in North Port.  We are determined to bring Good Deeds, Great Beer, and Fun Times to this city!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to financially support there are several ways you can still help us! Please share this with everyone you know. Follow us on Facebook and Instagram @CharlieFoxtrotBrewing and check out our website www.charliefoxtrotbrewing.com

Just mentioning us to someone you know is a great support!

We look forward to meeting everyone and sharing a drink with you!

story:
Who Are You Guys? 

We are so glad you asked!  Tiered & Petite is the sweet marriage of soft, delicious "Tiered" cakes and scrumptious individual "Petite" desserts. To guild the lily, we make our own ice cream, white chocolate fondant, and handcraft exquisite petits fours. (#SoYummy)! 

We are:

  • Minority Business Enterprise (MBE) certified
  • Female-Owned and Operated
  • A Licensed and Insured Limited Liability Corporation (LLC) 
  • MD & DC Food Handler's Licensed and Certified
  • A Trusted Catering Vendor for PG Parks' Elegant Settings Venues
  • Busy bees who buzz around the DC metro area delivering smiles for a living!

Baseline: We are a bunch of cool creatives specializing in delivering smiles in the form of handmade, nostalgic, Southern styled confections - all freshly made from scratch! 

To see our latest creations and check out our client kudos, click here. Visit our website here!

What's the Deal?

Welp, this whole crowdfunding campaign got started when clients suggested we offer our yummy products on a daily basis in a permanent place (outside of our normal dessert catering for weddings, showers, and galas).  We thought, hmmm … What an awesome idea! 

So, with the generous support from IndieGoGo, we will create an awesome, comfy space where the food is superb, the music is your jam, and everyone who pops in is having a good time. 

Here's What We Need

We are soooo blessed and humbled by our fun-rocking, faithful and committed entourage of Washingtonians who continually support, encourage and love up on us. (#WeSoLuvd!).

We have been working around the clock to get the ball rolling. At this point, we have 30 days to secure funding to lease this beautiful NE, DC location we're interested in.  So, here's the thing: so far, we've raised most of what's needed for production and operations, BUT we need your help to raise enough to cover:

  • The lease deposit
  • The 1st year's permits and licenses
  • Staffing
  • Necessary equipment and supplies to begin creating yummy goodies

 

Your gracious monetary (and/or physical) contribution will allow us to:

  • Offer a safe environment for kids, grandparents, and you to chill, smile and eat (student & senior discount applicable!)
  • Bake all-natural, high quality, unique baked goods, and savory delights
  • Employ other talents seeking to enhance, hone and flourish their skills
  • Donate our products to select annual charity events
  • Offer complementary house-made doggie treats for your fuzzy baby
  • Provide our very, very best to all loved ones who walk through our door!!!

Here's What You Get

Are you getting excited? Cuz it's time for the PERKulator! 

We have designed a beautiful array of perks exclusive to IndieGoGo for its contributors. *Be sure to click each perk (on the right) to view its description*. How ever much you choose to contribute will enable you to be part of our family! And just like family, we are committed to providing you:

  • Honest to goodness homemade delish products like momma used to make
  • Respectful, courteous and pleasant service with a great big smile
  • Comfort in knowing each confection and savory items are lovingly made from scratch
  • Unique, creative and outstanding products exclusive to our brand 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are immensely grateful and appreciative of your support! Although monetary contributions will get us up and running, there are a few other ways to offer your support and still get behind our vision - for free! Here are a few options:

  • Create a buzz. Spread the word on FB and IG to your dessert enthusiast buddies 
  • Donate your time for events. Volunteers are superheroes!
  • Donate your skills for our events. Your pro bono superpower is much appreciated!  (i.e., photography, radio air time, visual artist, painter, DJ's, etc.)
  • Follow us. Keep up with our creations & kudos on our IG here.  Visit our website here!

Thank You So Kindly!

We at Tiered & Petite sincerely and humbly thank you for your support, patronage, contribution, encouragement, and prayers. It's only because of you that we are able to move from our private Baltimore commercial kitchen to a local brick-and-mortar to offer our products on a daily basis.

You are always welcome to contact us should you have any specific questions, concerns, comments or advice. Feel free to direct contact us here.  Visit our website here!

It is a true honor to work with you, for you and alongside you.  See you soon at our opening!

Cotton, Owner/Baker/Dishwasher/Hugger 

www.TieredandPetite.com | 240.467.3977

story:
A drink for you

Stress and fatigue are enemies we fight daily. Healthy Boost Chentos aims to: improve your focus, breathing, blood circulation and your muscles cool down.
Please, find below a bit more about us and this campaign:

  • Davide is a professional chef with international experience. He is passionate about sports and black belt in judo. Thanks to his working experience, not just as restaurant and private chef but as sport dietary consultant too, he knows what food can help our body. When he thought about Healthy Boost Chentos, he didn't want to give sugar and/or stimulating drugs to stay awake, instead he thought a recipe, from extraction to taste, that can bring a long term benefits.
  • Davide and his team in Chentos need your help to start the production and distribution of this natural boosting drink.
  • We have the formula, the manufacturing plan, the will. Now we need backers to be able to share this drink with the world. Your contribution is not just important, it is essential to make this happen. 
  • This natural drink is fun too.... the concentrate can be diluted with any type of drinkable liquid, keeping its many benefit.

 

Stay Foolish Stay Healthy

  

What We Need & What You Get

All the funding will go in the drink production. We need to be able to produce massive quantity of the product. We will arrange our own laboratory or using an existing certified one depending on the total amount raised during the campaign. Then we will need to bottle the infuse and have reliable distribution chain. Any aspects, except for the formula, need to be build. We will need a minimum of six months to deliver the product at the end of the campaign.

You are important to us, this is why we have created discounted and rewarding perks. We care for our backers, the shipping costs are a big issue when it comes to heavy quantities, so we have put in place a special refunding way. Since bigger is the quantity we have to ship in a certain country kess will be the related costs, then we will provide you, if we are able to save costs in the shipping, product vouchers equal to the savings so that you can have back what you, eventually, overpaid for the shipping.

If we should not reach the £15000 goal, then we will refund the money. Chentos final goal is to share this drink with the world and we need your help. Trust is important to us, let's celebrate together a healthier day.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Chentos has not yet bottled the formula, the bottles and doser container you see in the advertising are probably not the ones you will receive. Our challenge is to find, in Europe, a company that bottles the drink without exceed the dedicated budget. Please, feel free to suggest manufacturing companies that can help us to overcome this risk. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please help sharing this campaign and its videos.

We need your help to make aware as many people as possible about this natural drink. Please share this video with your family and friends.

 

Many Thanks for Your Support

story: Misty Morning Bakery was born when our son told us that he was gluten intolerant and the gluten-free products on the market were about as tasty as the packaging. We knew very little about the gluten free market, so we began looking at what was available. He was right! Surely someone could do better! That someone is us. We started researching gluten free baking, the ingredients used, and what ingredients contained gluten and had to be strictly avoided. We baked a lot of bad bread at first but learned with each mistake. At a small business seminar, we met our first customer. That led to our first restaurant account and the rest is history. We started with a few baking pans and 4 hours a week at a commissary kitchen. As word of mouth spread, we started getting calls from other restaurants, coffee shops, and stores. Many business owners told us that after asking around to find who had the best gluten free products in Austin our name was consistently at the top of the list. We built our business little by little by selling some products and buying more equipment. That worked for several years. But now, as we approach 50 accounts, our product line has greatly expanded to include sweets and other delectable delights and we have reached the limit of what we can produce in our current kitchen. Fortunately, we have found a new kitchen where we will have twice the space and unlimited access. The problem is that this new kitchen does not come with the basic appliances we need. That’s where you come in. We need to buy a double convection oven, commercial refrigerator and freezer, stainless steel work tables, and shelving. With your help, we will be able to keep expanding our customer base and serve even more delicious products to the gluten free community and beyond. We have signed the lease and desperately need your help to have the necessary equipment in time to be ready for our giant leap into the future. So, tell your friends, family, co-workers about us and let’s make this happen! Every contribution at any level helps, and every contribution is greatly appreciated. We can’t thank you enough!

story:
Take a Bbite to change the world!

We develop high Protein Snacks using Insects and helping Women and families in rural areas of Costa Rica

You can be the Hero

Take a Tasty Bbite to create the change you want see

 

 

A journey to save the world, a Bbite by Bbite.

 

The traditional snacks and foods available endangers the planet. Nowadays, the food industry faces many challenges, including food scarcity, food waste, unsustainable production models and greenhouse emissions. 

According to the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations, 1/3 of food produced for human consumption is lost and wasted globally, which amounts to about 1.3 billion tons per year.

Meanwhile, according to the UN, the human population is expected to increase from 7.2 to 9.6 billion by 2050. Global demand for livestock products is expected to double by 2050 while total global cultivated land area has not changed since 1991. Livestock products are an important agricultural commodity for global food security because they provide 17% of global kilocalorie consumption and 33% of global protein consumption.

With rising incomes in the developing world, demand for animal products will continue to surge; 74 percent for meat, 58 percent for dairy products and 500 percent for eggs. Meeting increasing demand is a major sustainability challenge. It is considered to be needed 3 planets to be able to feed all human kind.

In simple words, what we are eating is killing us and it is killing our only planet!

 

How are we making things better?

 

At Bbite we meet increasing demand for protein by producing high quality crickets as food with the help of families in rural areas of Costa Rica. This approach allows us to produce tasty high protein snacks without exploiting natural resources, and at the same time helping the most vulnerable members of society.

In the farming process we use no electricity, we generate no waste, and we leave no one behind.

 

Bbite insects are farmed in a sustainable way that does not endanger the planet.

The production of insects-based foods vs traditional sources of protein requires:

 

  • 2000 times less water
  • 12 times less food
  • 100 times less CO2

 

And, as mentioned, through producing Bbite foods we are helping the most vulnerable members of society. We provide them with a knowledge and toolkit required to farm insects, which secures a stable level of household income. And we have the support from international entities to be able to take this families out of poverty.

Through Bbite, we aim to create healthy and sustainable insect-based food using innovative production systems that allows us to avoid waste and implement upcycling techniques. Continually, we are working towards developing the fair-trade supply chain of the future, focusing on creating purposeful solutions. 

What this means is that, get to more customers, and as more products you buy, our social impact to this families grows.

We have 50 families ready to receive your help, but we want to reach over 300 next year!

 

To do that effectively, we need your help and support.

 

Imagine creating a change by just buying a bag of tasty Cricket Crackers, Brownie Bbites, or a Pancake Mix! Our products are healthy, sustainable, tasty, nutritious, and, of course, impactful!

Stop! you don't need to imagine the products any more, be one of the first supporters, and we will get the product to you faster!

You can help us by just taking Bbite Snack. We would also appreciate a donation. Your support truly means the world to us, and to the women and families we help. Our success is their success and that's the impact you can be making!

 

What you get? Delicious and Purposeful Snacks

 

With our Bbite products, you are not only enjoying a healthy, sustainable and delicious product, but at the same time You get to Be the Hero of this journey towards creating more value for your health, for the environment and for the people.

 

Brownie Bbites: "From guilty pleasure to Healthy Pleasure"

Have you ever felt guilty for eating something that is very delicious but at the same time you know that it is bad for your body? Well, with Brownie Bbites you will no longer have to worry, this is the key: Vitamin B12, Vitamin B2, Antioxidants, 27% Protein, great for post workout recovery!

 

Cricket Crackers: "unbelievably tasty!"

You don't know what product to buy for a party and surprise your friends? Then you should try our Cricket Crackers, a fun way to consume protein while saving the world. Without a doubt a great way to surprise your friends!  

Vitamin B12 and B2, Antioxidants, 20% Protein, and low in sugar!

 

Cricket Pancake Mix: "Breakfast of Champions"

You don't have time to cook and prefer to buy pre-cooked food? Our Cricket Pancake Mix is the perfect product for you, a healthy and tasty way to cook without spending a lot of time and also avoiding the harmful ingredients of pre-cooked food.

Vitamin B12 and B2, Antioxidants, 14% Protein and easy to make!

 

The Guilt Free Bite, Be healthy, Be Sustainable, Be Tasty

 

 

What do we raise money for?

 

To develop our products, we need to raise £15,000. With your help, we will be able to establish operations in the UK and continue developing new food solutions with insects.  Accelerate the insect revolution and help us introduce Bbite to the world!

In exchange for your help, we will make sure to deliver our tasty range of products: Cricket Crackers, Brownie Bbites, and Pancake Mix. All of them are rich with insects, and trust our partners and the lucky ones who already try them, you want to know what the taste is like! (Spoiler alert: it’s DELICIOUS).

 

 

A little more about us, maybe?

 

We are the team of dedicated people who’ve had plenty of experience developing insect-based solutions, and delivering on people’s expectations.

Alejandro, the CEO and co-founder of Bbite, has more than 10 years of entrepreneurial experience related to insects-driven business.

On the other hand, Daniela, as the COO and co-founder, has been qualified as a nutritionist who focuses specifically on insect-based foods. Perfect combination? We think so too!

There are many ways you can help us. Rethinking your current lifestyle and food choices, ordering tasty Bbite products, sharing our crowdfunding campaign with friends… There won’t be enough words to describe our gratitude if you decide to go with at least one of them!

If you want to stay updated on our progress, please make sure to follow us on social media. We would also appreciate it, if you could share the news about us with your social network.

If you have any questions, please check the FAQ section, otherwise, feel free to reach us anytime!

 

Yours truly,

 

Bbite Team

Alejandro, Daniela, Fernanda, Camila, Luis, Isabela, Daniel
story_txt:
Take a Bbite to change the world!We develop high Protein Snacks using Insects and helping Women and families in rural areas of Costa RicaYou can be the HeroTake a Tasty Bbite to create the change you want see  A journey to save the world, a Bbite by Bbite. The traditional snacks and foods available endangers the planet. Nowadays, the food industry faces many challenges, including food scarcity, food waste, unsustainable production models and greenhouse emissions. According to the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations, 1/3 of food produced for human consumption is lost and wasted globally, which amounts to about 1.3 billion tons per year.Meanwhile, according to the UN, the human population is expected to increase from 7.2 to 9.6 billion by 2050. Global demand for livestock products is expected to double by 2050 while total global cultivated land area has not changed since 1991. Livestock products are an important agricultural commodity for global food security because they provide 17% of global kilocalorie consumption and 33% of global protein consumption.With rising incomes in the developing world, demand for animal products will continue to surge; 74 percent for meat, 58 percent for dairy products and 500 percent for eggs. Meeting increasing demand is a major sustainability challenge. It is considered to be needed 3 planets to be able to feed all human kind.In simple words, what we are eating is killing us and it is killing our only planet! How are we making things better? At Bbite we meet increasing demand for protein by producing high quality crickets as food with the help of families in rural areas of Costa Rica. This approach allows us to produce tasty high protein snacks without exploiting natural resources, and at the same time helping the most vulnerable members of society.In the farming process we use no electricity, we generate no waste, and we leave no one behind. Bbite insects are farmed in a sustainable way that does not endanger the planet.The production of insects-based foods vs traditional sources of protein requires: 
2000 times less water
12 times less food
100 times less CO2
 And, as mentioned, through producing Bbite foods we are helping the most vulnerable members of society. We provide them with a knowledge and toolkit required to farm insects, which secures a stable level of household income. And we have the support from international entities to be able to take this families out of poverty.Through Bbite, we aim to create healthy and sustainable insect-based food using innovative production systems that allows us to avoid waste and implement upcycling techniques. Continually, we are working towards developing the fair-trade supply chain of the future, focusing on creating purposeful solutions. What this means is that, get to more customers, and as more products you buy, our social impact to this families grows.We have 50 families ready to receive your help, but we want to reach over 300 next year! To do that effectively, we need your help and support.  Imagine creating a change by just buying a bag of tasty Cricket Crackers, Brownie Bbites, or a Pancake Mix! Our products are healthy, sustainable, tasty, nutritious, and, of course, impactful!Stop! you don't need to imagine the products any more, be one of the first supporters, and we will get the product to you faster!You can help us by just taking Bbite Snack. We would also appreciate a donation. Your support truly means the world to us, and to the women and families we help. Our success is their success and that's the impact you can be making! What you get? Delicious and Purposeful Snacks With our Bbite products, you are not only enjoying a healthy, sustainable and delicious product, but at the same time You get to Be the Hero of this journey towards creating more value for your health, for the environment and for the people. Brownie Bbites: "From guilty pleasure to Healthy Pleasure"Have you ever felt guilty for eating something that is very delicious but at the same time you know that it is bad for your body? Then you should try our Cricket Crackers, a fun way to consume protein while saving the world. Without a doubt a great way to surprise your friends!  Vitamin B12 and B2, Antioxidants, 20% Protein, and low in sugar! Cricket Pancake Mix: "Breakfast of Champions"You don't have time to cook and prefer to buy pre-cooked food? Our Cricket Pancake Mix is the perfect product for you, a healthy and tasty way to cook without spending a lot of time and also avoiding the harmful ingredients of pre-cooked food.Vitamin B12 and B2, Antioxidants, 14% Protein and easy to make! The Guilt Free Bite, Be healthy, Be Sustainable, Be Tasty  What do we raise money for? To develop our products, we need to raise £15,000. (Spoiler alert: it’s DELICIOUS).  A little more about us, maybe? We are the team of dedicated people who’ve had plenty of experience developing insect-based solutions, and delivering on people’s expectations.Alejandro, the CEO and co-founder of Bbite, has more than 10 years of entrepreneurial experience related to insects-driven business.On the other hand, Daniela, as the COO and co-founder, has been qualified as a nutritionist who focuses specifically on insect-based foods. story:
Short Summary

We are a Christian interracial couple and United States Navy veterans.  We have a dog named Roxy, a beautiful one year old boy and a little girl on the way! We are attempting to raise funds in order to help our business take off and soar. Food has and always will be a passion in our household. We believe food has a way of bringing people together and is especially helpful when having difficult conversations; which is partly why we exist.This past year has taken a lot from all of us but one of the few things that remain is the love of food and the cultures we all share with each other. This is the legacy that we'd love to leave for our children one day. We all make a difference in this world one way or another and we believe this is our way. We firmly believe that our food can help change the world by bringing people together to share a meal. With your help, we can accomplish our mission of changing the world one meal at a time.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This is our $50,000 Plan:

$5000- TITHE (this will be different depending on how much help we receive, but we will give to our church 10% of what we are offered and it goes to surrounding charities)
$10,000- RENT/UTILITIES
$1,500-COMMERCIAL DEEP FRYER
$600- COUNTERTOP DEEP FRYER
$1,000-DEEP FREEZER
$10,000-FOOD TRAILER
$15,000-PICKUP TRUCK
$600-ADOBE CREATIVE SUITE (DIGITAL LOGOS, PROMOS, FLYERS ETC)
$1000-POPUP EQUIPMENT(CANOPY, TABLES, CHAFING SET, ETC)
$100-BUSINESS CARDS
$200-POWER SUPPLY
$2500-OPERATING/BUSINESS CHECKING
$2500- BUSINESS SAVING

AND if we don't meet our entire goal, removing the pick-up truck, rent and utilities it would set us up at around $25,000. AND if we don't meet that and keep our business in-house (we currently operate our business from home), for now until we get more clientele, removing also the food trailer, commercial deep fryer, and decreasing our business savings plan, it would have us closer to $10,500. AND if we still cannot make that, we could leave out the popup equipment, the adobe creative suite and the business cards (get half instead), it would have us at around $8,500. We are hoping to have at least this amount to get us going. All we ask is for the opportunity to start. 

The Impact

Our project/product is food hand-crafted to perfection. Big Chuck’s offers a variety of roller options wrapped in vegan egg roll wraps that include breakfast, lunch and dinner options. We will also have sides to go with the rollers if our customers choose; our famous Mac and Cheese and/or coleslaw. We have checked, and no one surrounding our local areas are doing what we do, nor do they have our award-winning mac and cheese that is a popular favorite here in the South. We prepare our food fast, and have face-to-face interaction with our customers (masks on of course and 6-ft apart). Our reviews on Facebook and Instagram from our customers boast of the same high quality great tasting meal time and time again. We have tested this food all around Charlotte and surrounding areas in church functions, workplaces and neighbors as well as family and friends across the U.S. who all agree with our reviews. In our testing, we discovered what worked and what didn't and went back to the drawing board until we found exactly what was needed or needing to be removed. We believe that "everything done in life should be done well, especially food" and it shows. Our line currently includes the following options:

 

ROLLERS:

BREAKFAST:
EGG, CHEESE, AND CHOICE OF MEAT; BACON, CHICKEN, SAUSAGE, SHRIMP

LUNCH/DINNER OPTIONS:
BBQ
BUFFALO/BUFFALO RANCH
TERIYAKI
PEPPERONI PIZZA
CHICKEN AND BROCCOLI ALFREDO
CHICKEN BACON RANCH
GARLIC PARM

DESSERT:
STRAWBERRY AND CREAM CHEESE, APPLE PIE, GUAVA AND CREAM CHEESE, PUMPKIN PIE, PEACH COBBLER

MAC N CHEESE 

COLESLAW

 

 

Risks & Challenges

We know we definitely aren't the only ones going through it during this pandemic, so we know the challenges that we will face and are currently facing is a solid dependence on our clientele with which we depend on their business, and they need to be able to have money themselves in order to pay for our services. So in what ways could anyone overcome these kinds of hurdles? We turn to you to help get the word out about us and what we offer. We believe our food speaks for itself, which is why we already have a good clientele-base, however because of these trying times, there is a domino effect that affects us all when it comes to income coming in. But more people who know about us, means more people who are likely to try our product, and share the word more. There is power in numbers, and we need more of it!

Aside from the revolving door of the pandemic, we know there are also other factors that could play out, for example our equipment needing to be fixed. We do have a mechanic/maintenance employee who knows how to fix anything that could break, so there are no real troubling hurdles there. 

When our business gets going, the ratio of buying our materials to selling our product is not one we have ANY concern about. We buy in bulk and save so much more as we sell, sell, sell! We have a plan for savings for any emergencies we may run into, we have established every possible scenario that we could encounter and have a back up plan. We are very intentional about starting what we are aiming to do and we intend to punch hard, drive fast, and dig deep. We are ready. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know there are some people who just can't contribute, especially during these trying times everywhere across the world, but that doesn't mean you can't help! We would just ask that you'd help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! AND please don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools! Share on every platform you can think of, because every little bit helps. We thank you and are so incredibly grateful to you all for seeing our business worth of praise and attention!

story:
Hi! We are the Zabel's - Jeremy and Nicole. 

We have been presented with the opportunity to reopen the Skyroom at Lampson Field! After decades of working in various aspects of the hospitality industry we are thrilled to bring our experience to the community we grew up in and love while honoring the memory of the greatest restauranteur we have ever know, our very own "Red Jet", Nancy Zabel. She gave us so many of the characteristics we now consider our greatest values : work ethic, commitment to our local community, and always, ALWAYS doing the right thing for our family, our business, our customers and our environment.  

We can't wait to open and operate RED’S @ the Skyroom, a full service, family run bar & grill at Lampson Field’s iconic Skyroom Restaurant.

Jeremy Zabel is a prominent local chef with a diverse culinary background. He began his career as a dishwasher at the age of 14 at his family’s restaurant and by the time he was 18 he had made his way to lead cook. Jeremy worked as head chef for 5 years at Park Place where his passion for sourcing local ingredients began. He was offered the Executive Chef position at the Saw Shop in Kelseyville in 2006. After a 10-year tenure with the Saw Shop, Jeremy made the move to Napa and worked as the Executive Chef at Hog Island Oyster Company.

Partner and wife, Nicole Zabel has 19 years of experience in the hospitality industry. Her experience includes serving in full-service restaurants, diners, and cafes in both Northern and Southern California, event planning and execution, and managing full-service hotels including the Andaz in Napa and Hyatt House in Emeryville.

Nicole and Jeremy have a long history of working closely together at several local full-service restaurants, You know us from the Saw Shop, Park Place, and The Yard. We love working together and can't wait to show you our passion at RED'S! 

We are creating a modern take on a nostalgic airport restaurant, featuring updated versions of classic comfort food while utilizing local, sustainable and seasonal ingredients. We will feature seasonal, local produce and proteins, responsibly sourced seafood local wines, craft beers and imaginative cocktails!

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially however, we would appreciate you making some noise about our campaign and sharing our story! 

 

Thank you, 

Jer and Nicole

story:
Hugs for Hospitality

 

We'll get through this together

#keepredditchsmiling

#hugsforhospitality

Above all, maintain an intense love for each other, since love covers a multitude of sins. Be hospitable to one another without complaining. (1 Peter 4:8-9)

If you’ve visited the team at The Orangery you will know that they welcome you with the kindest of hearts, warmest of welcomes and hospitality in abundance.  Through their hard work they have provided this community with a place to gather for great conversations, food, cocktails and family events…anyone remember the real Santa that visited us at Xmas…anyone remember the Summer music festival or the many family events you may have attended?? 

Almost seems like the smiles of joy on the hundreds of children and family gatherings we have hosted since we took over the 1000-year-old dilapidated building on July 25th 2016 are a distant memory.

This unprecedented situation will put local family businesses like The Orangery under a tornado of financial pressure. We would be very grateful if you would consider helping to support our team and their families (our team of 19 have 22 little one’s mouths to feed) by placing a deposit for a wedding or a future event with the purchase of an Orangery gift voucher or three, buying a virtual hug, buying a cocktail masterclass for a future date with friends or having your own personal cocktail menu designed to help us continue to run our business through these difficult times.  A £20 voucher from just 1% of the Redditch population will help to keep many of our team in their job through these troubling times...and a massive bonus is you’ll have something pretty awesome to look forward to when we get back to normality.

100% of the revenue created by this campaign will go to the salaries of our team – pinky promise as my 6-year-old daughter says…

 

How You Can Help

Perks such as merchandise and private cocktail classes.

Funds will be distributed among The Orangery team.

 

The Unknown

We can't be sure when things will get back to normal.  But with your help we can get through this. Even one week will have devastating effect on people that live paycheck to paycheck.  Best case is  sometime in April, but obviously it changes hour by hour, day by day.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Share the heck out of our campaign!

And that's all there is to it.

 

BIG LOVE – KEEP CALM & HELP OTHERS

We at The Orangery have pledged to keep our team safe, support them financially, advise them on how best to manage through this and above all pay what we can. We know you may are struggling as well but any small support for others will help.  Let's get through this the best we can.  Stay safe and be well.

 

Peace, Tapas & Cocktails

Lindsey, Adam & Theresa

The Orangery

story:
How it All Started 

During my first visit to Mexico in 2017, upon seeing chocolate being made right in front of my eyes in the same place it has been made for over 2000 years; I immediately made up my mind to begin learning everything I could about chocolate.

In 2018 my journey started. I began studying and experimenting with techniques in chocolate making. With friends and family as delighted test subjects I was able to fine tune each stage of crafting incredible chocolate. As my technique continued to improve, I began receiving specific requests for fun, interesting, and often times wild flavors. Dark chocolate, strawberries and balsamic vinegar reduction; dark chocolate, banana and vanilla bean; white chocolate, key lime pie; milk chocolate, orange caramel with chile pepper; milk chocolate, chocolate chip toffee cookie. I decided from then on, that I would stop trying to guess what people like, and instead let them tell me what they like. 

Chocolate crafted just the way you want. Every. Little. Detail.

The process begins with your idea. We help evolve it into a finished bar by listening, asking questions, and, offering our expert advice and suggestions. Many people find it surprising that making a chocolate bar has many unseen variables. These require expertise and experience to get just the right results. Sourcing the cacao direct from the farm, roasting, refining and conching(a long process of agitating the chocolate to achieve the ideal flavor) are all challenges to master and each an opportunity for excellence. 

Funds Allocation

Proceeds from this campaign will directly fund a  website, specialized equipment that will save time and enable us to handle larger quantities and expand our business.

-New and larger roaster 

-Multiple Grinders

-Tempering Machine

-Website

Since we have all the equipment necessary to fulfill  small orders, should we not meet our goal we will be able to fulfill all orders. The money raised will go towards new and more efficient equipment in the future

Quality and Integrity Without Compromise         

Before ever beginning the journey into chocolate making, I was passionate about good chocolate. Having such a love for chocolate, I was able to appreciate all the difference that quality makes in the end product. A large part of making great chocolate is using the best ingredients without compromise. Each lot of cacao is quality checked by us before ever leaving the farm.

 

Produced in Mexico Means Greater Positive Impact for the Local Community

 

Not only will your pledge help us grow as the world's only custom chocolate maker,  we also pay a fair price for our cacao which greatly helps farming communities. We know that chocolate greatly relies on manual labor, therefore intrinsic to great chocolate are happy and well-paid employees who do their work lovingly and with care.

 

Tell us your unique idea. We make it a reality.

 

It's simple. Tell us your unique idea. Select your chocolate, and percentage cocoa content(applicable to dark and dark milk)

  • Dark
  • Milk
  • White
  • Dark Milk
 

.

Choosing a Bar Shape

 

 

 

The wider, flatter bar is ideal for non gooey,creamy, decadent bars, but can have a little filling. The long, thinner bar is ideal for the more gooey, creamy, decadent bars. 

 

If at any step you are unsure, let us know and we will guide you in creating the perfect bar. For example If you know that you want something with apple, but don't know how exactly. We would suggest adding cinnamon and nutmeg, buttery pie crust bits and apple pieces for a delicious apple pie bar. Or maybe instead, apple infused caramel with peanuts for a decadent take on the classic caramel dipped apples. The variations are limitless. It all depends on what sounds best to you, and of course the final decision is yours.

 

The 5 Steps to Your Custom Bar

 

Share the Love

Indiegogo makes it so easy to share, so if you know anyone who you think might be interested, we would love if you passed them our link.

**We make chocolate, you ARE 100% guaranteed your order once it is placed**

Risks & Challenges

 

-The most crucial risk we face would be potentially not having enough personnel at the very beginning. Care will be taken to begin searching for capable candidates before the campaign has even ended.

How it All Started 
During my first visit to Mexico in 2017, upon seeing chocolate being made right in front of my eyes in the same place it has been made for over 2000 years; I immediately made up my mind to begin learning everything I could about chocolate.
In 2018 my journey started. I began studying and experimenting with techniques in chocolate making. With friends and family as delighted test subjects I was able to fine tune each stage of crafting incredible chocolate. As my technique continued to improve, I began receiving specific requests for fun, interesting, and often times wild flavors. Dark chocolate, strawberries and balsamic vinegar reduction; dark chocolate, banana and vanilla bean; white chocolate, key lime pie; milk chocolate, orange caramel with chile pepper; milk chocolate, chocolate chip toffee cookie. I decided from then on, that I would stop trying to guess what people like, and instead let them tell me what they like.

story:
* All bottles in this campaign are 720 ml Sakura by Haru bottles. Please see the FAQ for details about shipping.

Did you know that between 2010-2019, one in five Japanese sake breweries disappeared.

Not because their sake was bad. Many of these have history dating back centuries, back to when Japan was a feudal society.

But why then? After all, don’t they sell for a pretty good price, especially outside of Japan?

As sake lovers - we did our research. And the number one answer was …

“We can’t earn”

F&B outlets pressure middlemen, middlemen pressure each other and the last middlemen pressure the breweries. 99.6% of breweries are SMEs which can produce the best sake in the world, but don’t have much bargaining power.

In fact, the more meticulous the brewery, the better the sake. But subsequently, the smaller the production amount and the brewery has an even harder time resisting pressure to slash prices.

Right now, you’re going to see an inflated price tag anyway. That amount you’re paying? Out of that on the average bottle the brewery may get a few dollars. For brewing an alcohol that is probably the most labor intensive in the world and which demands exceeding meticulousness.

There must be a better way

Many of the breweries are soldiering on out of love for the craft but we think that they should earn.

They must for sake to live on.

This is why we, a team of Sake lovers, are working with the Takenoi brewery (武の井酒造), to create a custom line of sake brewed for the Singaporean taste.

No middlemen, delivered straight to you without a restaurant gouging you. Obama brewery is also getting a far more reasonable price for their work and profit sharing.

This sake isn't coming at an unreasonable price either. More details below but this is an ultra-premium brew at a very reasonable price in Singapore.

Survey of other Junmai Daiginjos available in Singapore
Swipe / scroll if you cannot see the full table below.

  Sakura by Haru Brand A Brand B Brand C
Volume 720ml 720ml 720ml 720ml
Polish Rate
(Lower = Purer)		 29% 35% 35% 35%
Rice Yamada-Nishiki Yamada-Nishiki Yamada-Nishiki Yamada-Nishiki
Price $198.00 or less $188.90 $258.00 $309.00

Read on for more details - if this is a success then we can work with more breweries on similar project. We hope that you join us on Haru’s mission to preserve sake and make sake sustainable.

And Kampai!

About the Sake

The quality of a sake is determined heavily by the quality of the rice and water used in making it and the mastery of the artisans involved.

Ingredients

Careful choice has been placed in all elements of the sake. In particular:

  • The water is from an underground river under the Yatsugatake mountain range (八ヶ岳山麓). This water source is certified as one of the top 100 water sources in Japan (名水百選) 
  • The rice used will be the Special Grade (特等) Yamada-nishiki (山田錦)
  • The yeast used is derived from the Sakura flower.
  • As an added bonus gold leaf reminiscent of floating sakura petals will be added to the alcohol.

Artistry

  • Takenoi is one of the only 30 breweries among the 1400 which are able to use flower-based yeasts in their fermentation.
  • The brewmaster himself aside from being the 6th generation in a long line of sake-brewers also studied sake-brewing academically in his university times.
  • Our sake is classified as a Junmai Daiginjo (純米大吟醸), which is generally considered to be the top grade of sake available with well less than 2% of all sake falling into this category.
  • Our sake has an extremely high polish rate of 29%, where 71% of the rice grain is milled away, leaving only the purest core which is responsible for producing superior aroma and taste.

What We Need & What You Get

Your contributions (thank you!) will be going to the process of bringing the alcohol to Singapore including:

  • The costs of producing the alcohol
  • Costs for preparing the necessary food safety documentation etc.
  • Shipping the alcohol to Singapore
  • Alcohol taxes in Singapore
  • Storage and other logistics in Singapore

In return, we will bring to you directly the number of bottles you ordered and other rewards depending on how much you have contributed. The per bottle price that you are contributing here will be lower than how much it goes to retail for.

Don't forget that this sake makes for a good present, and can be used for corporate events too!

Delivery

We expect to make the sake available by April 2021. Due to Indiegogo rules, we are committing to physically delivering the sake to you. Alternatively, you can also pick it up from us.

The Impact

Success with Takenoi will give us an example to approach more breweries in Japan, and bring more commissioned hidden sake gems to Singapore.

Many of these traditional breweries are facing an uphill battle to survive. First, they are unable to compete with larger breweries that have decided to focus on quantity, and profit margins. Second, in many cases, they lack market volume as they do not have the ability to bring their sake overseas without assistance. Due to this, traditional sake brewing is a dying craft in Japan, with many traditional techniques responsible for producing superior sake on the verge of being lost.

By making this project a success, we want to show that there are people (like you and us) in the world who do appreciate good sake. By doing so, we will prove that in this day and age, tradition remains important, and that the craft that goes into making sake should be preserved.

Sake brewing is a craft that deserves to be passed down, and we hope to play our part in this.

Risks & Challenges

As of now, production is on track but unexpected events (such as a typhoon) can disrupt production.

The situation with COVID-19 may cause issues, although shipping between Japan and Singapore remains stable, and on schedule.

In the case of disruption from any of the above events, we will inform backers of any changes in batch size or delays. If necessary, we will issue the appropriate refunds.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you're not sure whether you can immediately contribute, you can help us still!

  • Sharing through social media, especially with your friends who enjoy sake;
  • Subscribing to our mailing list for more updates and news

will help us!

If you are an F&B outlet who wants to know more, feel free to contact us at  contact@harusake.com too.

Anyway, we wish to thank all of our supporters in advance! As it customary in Japan when drinking, let us wish everyone a very happy KAMPAI (乾杯)!

About Obama Shuzo

The Takenoi Brewery was established in 1865. It is located in Hokuto City, in Yamanashi Prefecture.

As of present, six generations of the founding family have dedicated their lives to the pursuit of the perfection of their craft. The staff at the Takenoi Brewery feels great satisfaction at being able to work in conjunction with nature to bring smiles to those who drink the sake they go to painstaking extents to perfect.

The Takenoi Brewery is notable for being one of 30 breweries, out of more than 1400 breweries in Japan, to be approved to use yeast derived from roses in the production of its sake. It is set further apart from the competition by being the only brewery that uses rose-derived yeast sake of the junmai daiginjo class.

This is represented in its definitive, top-range sake: Saykoh (青煌). Sake made in this manner have a characteristic freshness and crispness that is all but impossible to imitate.The Master Brewer of the Takenoi Brewery is Shimizu Koichiro (清水紘一郎).

He has literally dedicated his entire life to sake, having been born and raised in Takenoi, and working in it now. He studied sake brewing at the Tokyo University of Agriculture, and spent 3 years working in other breweries before returning to Takenoi. Saykoh is his brainchild, and he is deservedly proud of it.The brewery produces approximately 90,000 liters of sake annually.
