story:
Short Summary

 

  • Hello my name is Denis Gekara and I am the entrepreneur behind Wild Kenyan Hot Sauce. After graduating from Fairmont State University with my general degree in business it was a challenge to get a job, so I opened a small restaurant in Morgantown West Virginia, and named it the Kenyan Cafe. The purpose was to pay my bills but it grew to a full restaurant. I had minimal experience in managing, so I had to learn on the job. I made a lot of mistakes in six years only grossing around $315k. Shortly after opening, I needed a hot sauce to fit my style of cooking. I wanted to be able to bake with it, for customers to use on the table, and toss my wings in it to serve my customers. I couldn’t find any so I found the materials and made my own! Wild Kenyan hot sauce was born! My customers loved it. I got endless requests from customers who wanted to buy it.

  • I am at the stage where I need to expand and this campaign is a way to propel me forward toward nationally distributing my hot sauce to share it with everyone. I am in Whole Foods Mid Atlantic company with many other small stores in the region. I am an UNFI  national distributor and with their help I am ready to drop my hot anywhere and it will be purchased  across the country. At this level of expansion it can be costly and in need lots of inventory at the start. 

  • With your support it will be possible to sell my hot sauce in major grocery stores nationwide. I also have big dream of expanding internationally.  I promise your contribution will make a big difference to me and please talk it over with your friends and co workers and be a part of the big crowd of my wonderful customers even if you don't usually use hot sauces.

What We Need & What You Get

I need $75,000 to fully fund my initial demand, right now I am mostly doing 10 oz but I have come to appreciate what 5 oz play in introducing my hot lots of homes. Usually my customer who has not tried my hot sauce before buying they first buy 5 oz and later they buy two 10 oz bottles or more. I have lots of repeat customer who explained to me that; the reason why they use my hot is because baught 5 oz first.

  • I will share my hot with you and am sure you will share it with your friends too. It makes a good gift for your family or co worker. Prepare a special meal and share with your family and friends. If you have a restaurant,  gallon size will be ideal,  try it with your wings and see it the customers will bite! In my perks, In will include 64 oz and six 5 oz  or  10 oz  and 3  bottles 10 oz, twelve 5 oz or 10 oz, eight 5 oz , and four of the 5 oz or 10 oz. Please check our perk section.
  • So of the $ 75,000 I will make I have enough inventory of 10 oz to all whole foods in the country with cost of $32,000 and $ 15,000 will go 5 oz, $13,000 for gallon sizes 10 half gallon sizes $ 5,000 transport cost. Your contribution will give us a good start to reach that goal. I will update your how we are doing. Thank you so much for doing this for me! I sincerely appreciate.

The Impact

I hope by the 2nd quarter 2019 I will have started to import papers directly from my village where I grew up. I just want to give education and hope to children who end up being doctors and teachers. I hope to be of help as much as I can. My goal is  to complete a library in my local High School should I be privileged to get this project off the ground.

I started Kenyan Cafe with $ 6,672 and build it to $ 335, 000 annually for 6 years. I can do this! Your contribution will pave the way to getting more customers and wider distribution of the Wild Kenyan Hot Sauce. 

I believe someone has to do something different and that person is me, my hot sauce is different and my goal is to change the way people use hot sauce. I would like to use this opportunity to grow and help even more people than we do now. I believe this can be a 10, 20 million dollar company supporting multiple families. With unlimited opportunity to lift others!

Risks & Challenges

  • If you cannot get a good start as you expand, you will always struggle with cash flow which is vital to expand and allowing all regions to access this amazing product.

  • I have had challenges but I did not quit and now it is not quitting time. I always believe that good things are not easy. Challenges were part of my story  growing up in Kenyan. I think an obstacle means you have do things differently and not quit! If I quit then I have failed to solve a problem. I faced a problem when I could not find the hot sauce which can be used in multiple ways.

    I have knocked on doors and I continue to knock on doors until this is a national brand. When you have a good product customer will always support you and I am encouraged by my Wild Kenyan Hot Sauce!! We have quite a fun base...Love you all!!

Ways You Can Help

  • Please guys get the word out for me and make some noise about your campaign. Just email friends, family, co-workers and let’s come together as team. Sometimes that is all you have to do and it will all change for the better for my project. 

And that's all there is to it.  THANK YOU  ALL ...LET US DO THIS!!

I hope by the 2nd quarter 2019 I will have started to import papers directly from my village where I grew up. I just want to give education and hope to children who end up being doctors and teachers. I hope to be of help as much as I can. My goal is  to complete a library in my local High School should I be privileged to get this project off the ground.
I started Kenyan Cafe with $ 6,672 and build it to $ 335, 000 annually for 6 years. I can do this! Your contribution will pave the way to getting more customers and wider distribution of the Wild Kenyan Hot Sauce. 
I believe someone has to do something different and that person is me, my hot sauce is different and my goal is to change the way people use hot sauce. I would like to use this opportunity to grow and help even more people than we do now. I believe this can be a 10, 20 million dollar company supporting multiple families. With unlimited opportunity to lift others!

Risks & Challenges

If you cannot get a good start as you expand, you will always struggle with cash flow which is vital to expand and allowing all regions to access this amazing product.

I have had challenges but I did not quit and now it is not quitting time. I always believe that good things are not easy. Challenges were part of my story  growing up in Kenyan. I think an obstacle means you have do things differently and not quit! If I quit then I have failed to solve a problem. I faced a problem when I could not find the hot sauce which can be used in multiple ways.
I have knocked on doors and I continue to knock on doors until this is a national brand. When you have a good product customer will always support you and I am encouraged by my Wild Kenyan Hot Sauce!! We have quite a fun base...Love you all!!



Ways You Can Help
Please guys get the word out for me and make some noise about your campaign. Just email friends, family, co-workers and let’s come together as team. Sometimes that is all you have to do and it will all change for the better for my project. 
And that's all there is to it.  THANK YOU  ALL ...LET US DO THIS!!

story:
Strange History

Strange Brew Home-Brew is New England's Largest Retail Home-Brew Store

We have been supplying quality equipment and ingredients to Brewers for 21+ years.

We are in the process of constructing Strange Brewery to provide our award winning Strange Brews to everyone. As we approach the finish line we need your help completing the Taproom so we have a great space to serve these brews.

Join our Mug Club or Growler club for exclusive access to some of our Strangest Brews.

Goals and Rewards

We are finalizing the design for the tasting room now. Your support will enable us to provide a unique brewery experience.

  • Our current space has already been converted from the Lazer Zone entertainment complex into a massive home-brewing supply shop. We have been redesigning the home-brew shop to make room for the Brewery and Tasting Room. 
  • We need to raise $15K to finish the Taproom and Beer Garden build-out.
  • These funds will go towards: 
    • New Bar
    • Seating (for drinkers, and tables for BYO Food)
    • Fence upgrade for the outdoor beer garden
    • Sound System for your entertainment
    • Proper Glassware
    • Dishwasher 
    • New Lighting (for that strange, yet comfortable ambiance)
  • Stretch Goals: (Upgrades if we exceed our $15K raise)
    • Complete the Buildout for existing 7 BBL Brewhouse upgrade
    • Portable stage for entertainment in the lounge area
    • Pinball machines and video games for the "Strange Room"
    • Seating in the lounge area
    • Upgrade seating in the brewery viewing area
    • Barrel Program: to create some even stranger brews
  • REWARDS: Mug Club, Growler Club, Brew your own Strange Brew, and more. Check it out!

Let's get Strange

Strange Brewery is under construction, and beer production has begun.

 

  • Strange Brewery Taproom Opens 8/10/2018!
  • We are currently brewing pilot batches on a 3 Barrel system.
  • Sampling and refining is underway.
  • We can't wait to share a brew with you!
  • Taproom Summer Hours: Friday and Saturday 12-9pm

Risks & Challenges

We have our permits, we have our brewhouse, and Strange Brew is on the way.

  • "Alright, alright, alright" Strange Brewery and Taproom will open, even if we don't meet our funding goals. But it will be a whole lot cooler if we do. Do you like drinking beer while standing around in a boring room, or chain link fenced in parking lot? No Problem. We got that! Want proper glassware, comfortable seating and a comfortable lounge and taproom? That's where you can help out!
  • We have our permits. This was not easy. We spent the past 2+ years dealing with permitting, zoning and building issues. We worked with the town of Marlborough to change the zoning and requirements for operating a brewery in Marlborough. 
  • We have our brewhouse. Actually we have 2 brewhouses! We will be starting on a 3 Barrel System while we finish the build-out for the larger (and vastly more expensive) 7 Barrel System. If we exceed our taproom goals, additional funds wil go towards getting the larger system online sooner.
  • We have the beer! We have spent 21+ years developing our brews and our brand. Thanks to all of our current and former customers who have helped bring us to where we are now. We have done many Strange Brews over the years, including recent collaborations with local favorite Jack's Abby with their Strange Brew, Sucker Punch, and Hoponius Black. We have an incredible group of friends in the local brewing community and look forward to many planned collaborations with our fellow craft brewers. (Supporters will be the first to know about these unique brews)
  • We need your help. And we appreciate your past (and future) support!

Other Ways You Can Help

Short on Cash? (So are we!) No worries. You can still help!

  • Please share our campaign with your friends. (Facebook, Twitter, Indiegogo share tools, etc.)
  • Have skills? Volunteers are welcome!
  • Taste testers needed! Seriously, we have some test batches and value your opinion. Look for Strange Brew at a Brewfest near you. Attend a Brewclub meeting and provide us feedback on our pilot batches. Email us your ideas for a Strange Brew!

 

See you soon. Cheers!

 

Thank you,

Brian Powers and the Strange Brew Crew

 

In the Press:

http://www.milforddailynews.com/news/20180607/s...

story:
Immagina di avere un posto sul web e sui maggiori social network del mondo, dove poter entrare in qualunque momento della tua giornata non solo per cercare un’ispirazione o un’idea per una nuova ricetta, ma che ti faccia vivere un’esperienza completa, dalla ricerca del prodotto fino alla sua trasformazione nel piatto che andrai a servire alle persone che ami. In un mondo sempre più asettico, la mia idea è quella di prenderti per mano e portarti all’interno dell’azienda produttrice, farti conoscere non solo il prodotto che trasformeremo nella mia cucina ma anche i volti e le realtà agricole italiane, per poi accompagnarti passo dopo passo nella realizzazione della ricetta che ho creato attorno a questo specifico prodotto.

Il mio obiettivo è di raggiungere 35.000€, per potermi attrezzare degli strumenti migliori e poter portare avanti la mia idea. Ad ogni offerta corrisponderò un gadget firmato CucinaFilippi, dalle shopping bag al grembiule da cucina, dalla possibilità di essere sponsor del sito web a quella di partecipare in prima persona alle riprese di una video ricetta!

Il mio sogno è quello di aiutare tutti i produttori italiani che non avrebbero la possibilità di farsi conoscere, offrendo la possibilità di avere una vetrina sul mondo, sempre aggiornata alle esigenze tecnologiche che il mondo stesso richiede, e allo stesso tempo ritornare all’essenza della cucina italiana, che è ciò che amo: la ricerca del prodotto migliore e la sua trasformazione nel piatto da condividere a tavola con le persone che amo.

Condividi i miei video e la mia campagna e seguimi su Youtube, Facebook e Instagram per rimanere sempre aggiornato sulle novità!

ENGLISH VERSION

Imagine having a place on the web and on the major social networks of the world, where you can enter at any time of your day not only to look for inspiration or an idea for a new recipe, but to make you live a complete experience, from the research of the product to its transformation into the dish that you will serve the people you love. In an increasingly more aseptic world, my idea is to take you by the hand and take you inside the production company, let you know not only the product that will transform in my kitchen but also the faces and the Italian agricultural realities, to then accompany you step by step in the realization of the recipe I created around this specific product.

My goal is to raise 35.000€ to be able to equip myself with the best tools and to carry on my idea. For each offer I will match a gadget signed by CucinaFilippi, from shopping bags to kitchen aprons, from the possibility of being sponsor of the website to that of participating in the first person in the filming of a video recipe!

My dream is to help all Italian producers who would not be able to make themselves known, offering the opportunity to have a window on the world, always updated to the technological needs that the world requires, and at the same time return to the essence of Italian cuisine, which is what I love: the search for the best product and its transformation into a dish to share at the table with the people I love.

Share my videos and my campaign e follow me on Youtube, Facebook and Instagram to stay tuned with my lasts news!

story:
For English see below; Русская версия ниже

Despre proiectul "Iarba Noastră"

De 12 ani coc pâinea acasă și de patru ani le-o ofer și altora... Sunt Natka Minunatka sau Natalia Matiescu, antreprenoare în devenire, pasionată de frământarea, ornarea şi coacerea pâinii artizanale.

Iuței, Negriței, Sărăței, Mărărei, Chimenței, Crocănței, Colotăcei, Znaki, Crăpăcioasa, Kita, Germană, Pumpernickel, Geamănă, Zengaliskii, Borodinskii... au devenit micile mele cărți de vizită.

Interesul oamenilor pentru produsele mele „Iarba Noastră” și lungile cozi de sâmbătă, din fața tarabei de la piața EcoLocal, m-au convins că trebuie să fac mai mult. Imi doresc un spațiu propriu de gastronomie artizanală unde aroma pâinii prospăt coapte să nu se sfârșească. Mă puteți ajuta să plămădim această brutărie împreună!

De ce am nevoie de ajutor?

Produsele făinoase rămân încă printre primele locuri în consumul zilnic al multora. Cu toții realizăm că pâinea coaptă în cantități industriale are un ritm alert de preparare, iar calitatea acesteia nu face tocmai bine sănătății noastre. Pâinea artizanală pe care o plămădesc se lasă la dospit în voie- unele tipuri de pâine - pâna la 48 de ore. Maiaua pe care o folosesc pentru dospit este un produs viu, care se vrea hrănit, cel puțin, de două ori pe zi. Eu zic că în preajma aluatului trebuie să și locuiești, de aceea...   

Familia mea a făcut primul pas – a cumpărat o încăpere situată pe strada Dâmbului 24 din Chișinău. Este o clădire goală la moment. Am nevoie în jur de 14,000 USD pentru a face reparație, pentru a echipa cu tehnica și sculele necesare noua brutărie. Intenționez să procur un cuptor de capacitate mare. 

Acest proiect nu poate fi realizat cu forțele mele proprii. Dacă ai descoperit măcar un motiv pentru care dorești să contribui, îți mulțumesc și te invit să vezi lista de recompense. 

Cum mă mai poți ajuta? 

Chiar dacă nu ești gata să faci acum o donație, te invit să distribui această campanie printre prietenii tăi. Îți voi fi recunoscătoare pentru că îți pasă. De asemenea, mă poți urmări pe Facebook pentru a vedea cum se derulează proiectul și care sunt alte activități în care sunt implicată.

Culese din presă

Despre Proiectul The Bread Project

Despre visul Nataliei de a deschide o brutărie

Ateliere de frământare a pâinii cu școlarii

English version

About the project "Iarba Noastra"

I have been baking bread for twelve years and for four years I offer my products "Iarba Noastra" to others ... I'm Natka Minunatka or Natalia Matiescu, Moldovan baker passionate about kneading the dough, ornating and baking artisan bread. I am also on the way of becoming an entrepreneur.

People’s affection for  my products and the long queues for my bread on Saturdays at the farmers’ market convinced me that I have to make more. I intend to open my own artizan gastronomy space. It will be a place where the fresh baked bread flavor will not end. Everyone will be able to choose their healthy bread - crushed with the maia, crushed with whole grain flour, crushed at the stone mill, artistically ornate, leavened and carefully roasted.

To make this idea come true I need around 14,000 USD. My crowdfunding project allows you to donate as much as you can,  in a transparent and quick way.

 You could also help me by sharing my campaign message on FB and Instagram. I treasure the opportunity of reaching out to you. Thank you for walking this journey along with me! Let’s knead the bakery together!

Русская версия

О проекте «Iarba Noastră»

Из прессы

Я пеку хлеб вот уже двенадцать лет, последние четыре из которых я предлагаю хлеб узкому кругу знакомых ...

... Меня зовут Наталья Матиеску или Natka Minunatka, увлеченная ремесленным хлебопечением. Длинные очереди за моим хлебом по субботам на фермерском рынке, убедили меня в том, что я должна идти дальше. Хочу открыть маленькую ремесленную пекарню. Это будет место, где свежий хлебный аромат не закончится никогда.

Каждый желающий сможет выбрать по вкусу свой хлеб изготовленный на закваске, с использованием свежей цельнозерновой муки, смолотую на каменных жерновах. Декорированный в ручную и с заботой испеченный будет радовать глаз и нести пользу здоровью. Для осуществления этой идеи, мне нужно около 14 000 долларов США. Мой проект crowdfunding позволяет вам внести столько, сколько сможете, абсолютно прозрачно и быстрым способом. Вы также можете помочь мне, поделившись сообщением о кампании в FB и Instagram. Я благодарна за возможность обратиться к вам. Спасибо, что мы вместе пройдем этот путь!

story:
Who and What is Sawbriar Brewery? 

Hi folks, my name is John Paul, and with my awesome wife, Jessica, we are opening the first Louisiana state-licensed microbrewery in the heart of Cajun Country. We need your help by backing this project to make it a success. 

This is our 2nd attempt at our crowdfund (this time on Indiegogo), with a lower goal, shorter timeline, and better rewards so those that supported us before get the chance to see this happen!

Sawbriar Brewery will be a friendly neighborhood microbrewery and taproom in downtown Lafayette, Louisiana, where we responsibly brew better beer from unique ingredients while celebrating local art and music.

Why Sawbriar?

The name “Sawbriar” reflects our Louisiana roots. The sawbriar is a native plant common around the swampy woods of South Louisiana. They are deeply rooted in the Louisiana soil, tough and stubborn - kind of like us. Despite the thorny exterior, the sawbriar plants are a vital part of their ecosystem, providing food to the native wildlife and, historically, used to soothe the ailments of the local peoples. Like the sawbriar, we want our brewery to be a vital part of the community (and beer has been known to cure what ALES you!)

Our mission is to brew better beer for a better world. We make great beer while focusing on using responsible techniques and local ingredients.  

With your help, our taproom will be your place away from home and work where you can interact with neighbors, make memories, live life, and have fun.

Sawbriar Beer

What kind of beer do we make? We make better beer because you deserve better.​

The advantages of having a taproom where everything made is small batch and nothing distributed are flexibility, spontaneity and craft. We make a large variety of lagers, ales, stouts, porters, and sours. Some are classically inspired and others way out in left hop field. All of our beer uses the freshest local ingredients we can find. There will also be a constant rotation of seasonal surprises. (What can we say, we like to experiment!) 

Some of the many brews you might encounter on our taps include:   

  • Love Bug Lager: 5.4% ABV, 29 IBU, 2.4 SRM · Perfect summer time brew for the hot and humid days of South Louisiana. Cold, clear and crisp, this lager is influenced by the pre-prohibition recipes of Old West settlers. Great for cooling down after cleaning the bugs off the windshield.
  • Cypress Stout: 6% ABV, 15 IBU, 50 SRM · A different take on Irish Extra Stout brewed with local coffee. Cypress stout pours thick and creamy but goes down smoothly with notes of dark chocolate, roasted coffee and oak. Perfect as desert at the end of a meal or a warmup on a cold day.
  • Crawnado Amber Ale: 4.5% ABV, 22 IBU, 8 SRM · Easy drinking amber ale made with Louisiana wheat and sugarcane that makes the perfect all-occasion pint. Great with crawfish, crab boils and hurricane parties.  
  • Mad Monkey IPA: 10% ABV. 90 IBU, 9 SRM · A creation of momentary madness and an aggressive hop schedule, this IPA uses seven different hops from all over the world. It is an exploration of the dark and hazy, juicy and spice. Far from a bitter hop bomb, Mad Monkey is a balanced explosion of flavors and aromas that will drive the sense from the senses.
  • Fightin'ville Brow Ale: 5.7% ABV, 43 IBU, 27 SRM · Slightly sweet, American take on English brown pub ale, made with English and specialty malts, and US hops. Great to quench the thirst with lunch or sipping with friends in the taproom after work. Named in remembrance of the neighborhood surrounding Sawbriar Brewery.  

The Plan 

Sawbriar Brewery will open in late 2018 - this video talks about our first campaign on Kickstarter which didn't make it, but the project is the same concpet. Before we get there, we need your help to finish some things, like the taproom:

  • Next comes the equipment. We have planned for a 7-barrel, steam-fired brewhouse and plenty of fermenters and brite tanks to provide plenty of choices of the freshest beer. 

  • There is a stage dedicated to hosting local musicians, because we know you like to dance! 
  • With a local community partner we are fixing up a derelict warehouse that currently blights the otherwise awesome historic neighborhood of LaPlace, also known as Fightin’ville. 

Still it seems like I forgot something else we needed…

Milestones 

We've done a lot so far!

  • Licensing and permitting is on schedule for opening in late 2018.
  • Our starting recipes are fully developed, and even won a few awards!
  • We have a lease for our building and construction has started. 
  • Some of our equipment is already here, and more is ready to ship. 
  • The final plans are complete, and we just need your backing to finish up. 
  • Right now, we estimate it will take over $200,000 to finish the work on the building. We are asking $10,000 of your support as seed money to get enough of the remaining work done to open.

Cool Swag for Your Support 

We mentioned before that this is a relaunched effort on Indiegogo after our first one only made it halfway on Kickstarter. So we dropped our goal, made pledge levels more affordable, and added more stuff to each level!

Need the softest beer shirt ever made (in Lafayette, no less)? Like seeing your name in awesome places? We have some awesome rewards to match every budget, because everyone deserves better beer!

You Deserve Better

We are asking for your help on Kickstarter because we know you deserve better. Without it, we would have to cut some corners, and that does not make for better beer. Our $10,000 project goal is much less than we have put in personally, and doesn’t cover all that’s left, but it does get the doors open. We've worked hard to get this far; we are 100% local and self-funded – no help from the big beer monopolies (ever) - just a happily married couple of beer nerds trying to live out our dreams.

What makes us different? Nothing. We are probably just like you, working hard as we can every day to make things better where we can. Jessica and John are your average folks –two parents: a teacher and an Army vet. But Lafayette is the best city in the best state in the world. We just want to make better beer for you. Because you deserve better.

Risks and Challenges

With all great ventures there is risk. Here’s what could go wrong & what we can do about it.

  1. You may not like our beer. That’s OK! Like Louisiana weather, our beer is constantly changing. Unlike Louisiana weather, it will change. We use our taproom customer feedback to constantly improve our recipes.
  2. We could run out of money and be personally ruined.  A harsh reality indeed, but with your help and our solid plan, we are sure to make it!
  3.  The laws may change and prohibition return.  We certainly see crazy things in politics lately, but regular voting will keep this from happening. That's also why Sawbriar Brewery is a member of the Louisiana Craft Brewers Guild.
  4. Our schedule may slip. Late 2018 is an estimate subject to final approvals, contractor performance, and a little luck. Brewer John happens to also be an accomplished project manager, so we are pretty good at adjusting to changes and meeting the goal.
  5. Meteors, evil robots, alien takeovers and zombies.  Acts of God are unavoidable, but I guarantee we are praying daily for a favorable outcome. We wouldn’t mind you sending a few prayers our way too. And a map to your bunker. (We promise our beer won’t make you a zombie.)

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the Beer Love! Please tell everyone you can about our brewery and campaign. Indiegogo makes it easy; just use the sharing tools to share us on social media. Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

We are a small Detroit-based, vegan, fast-casual startup restaurant. We will be serving plant-based versions of classic diner food such as burgers, fries, hot dogs, and sandwiches.

We are currently seeking an investment of $15,000 which would cover our initial investment costs. These costs include inventory costs, property acquisition and renovations, ServSafe certification, and our Health Department costs and other government agencies fees. My brother-in-law who owns his own commercial and residential construction business will be doing the renovations. He and his wife will also help with the day-to-day operations of the restaurant.

My name is Dustin Vanderburg. I am the Co-Owner and Head Chef here at Vegan in the Hood LLC. I am currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration with a Major in Hospitality Management. My expected graduation is August 28, 2020. I currently work as a Shift Supervisor Rx for CVS. I also have experience with management at BabiesRUs and ToysRUs. All 3 positions allowed me to manage in a team setting. I have 15 years of retail experience and about 2 years of warehouse experience. I also have an Associate's degree in General Business and an Associate's degree in Multimedia and two certificates in Small Business Management and Entrepreneurship, and Supervision.

My wife, Angela Vanderburg is the other Co-Owner. She has kitchen experience with a local community organization and also has retail experience.

Our current demographic is approximately 2% of Detroiters who are vegan and vegetarian and the unknown percentage of flexitarians and pescatarians here in Detroit. The aforementioned 2% of Detroiters are roughly equivalent to 106,300 people. We hope to reach many of these people with social media and marketing. We are already making a name for the restaurant and have already had calls regarding orders. We are trying to get this project off the ground so we can fulfill future orders that come in.

What We Need & What You Get

We are currently seeking an investment of $15,000 which would cover our initial investment costs. These costs include inventory costs, property acquisition and renovations, ServSafe certification, and our Health Department costs and other government agencies fees.

At the $5 Level, you will get a handwritten thank you note from myself and my wife, collectively the co-owners. This will ship out on or around August 2020.

At the $25 Level, you will get a dish with your name on it. This is a limited prize due to our limited menu of course.

At the $100 Level, you will get an invitation to the Soft opening private food tasting. This prize is limited due to the cost and available space. If we can raise much more than the goal we can offer more of this prize level depending on the number of contributions.

At the $2500 Level, we are offering a Chef's Table after-hours private tasting of my favorite dishes in a 3-course meal setting.

The Impact

If we can reach our goal this will offer a healthy comfort food option to the food desert that is Downtown Detroit. Our mission is to bring a healthy alternative to the fast-food garbage that is served locally. We want to offer comfort food that we and the people around here locally grew up with but in a vegan format. This will also give vegans in the area some of the options they are missing or crave. Detroit is a hotbed for vegan food and we want to offer an alternative to the million and one non-vegan diners and Coney Islands around this area.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is the timeline for the Health Department certification and inspection. Once we tackle that hurdle it is mostly smooth sailing for the most part up until opening. Getting the building we want for a good price and getting the renovation done quickly and cost-effectively is the other major challenge facing us. The Health Department is a necessary evil that we must face and there is not much we can do to remedy that, however, getting funding for this project will help get the building and get the process started. Another major hurdle is advertising. We have already started to make a name for ourselves and have orders coming in even before we are open. This is great but to maintain customers we need a building and to advertise. We have already started on this process thanks to social media. We plan to increase this by reaching out to local news stations and radio personalities once we get closer to open to spread the word even further. We hope to catch the eye of the public like some of our competition. Of course, we also plan to utilize traditional advertising methods as well to increase public awareness of our location. We have selected a high traffic area in which to operate as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know in these uncertain times that not everyone has the funds to help us grow this business. However, you can help us in other ways by sharing this via the share tools above, sharing it on social media and sharing it with other friends via SMS (Text message), and other options like Kik and Snapchat. Thank you all and have a great day.

story:
Nutritional bars are the cornerstone of any snack cabinet. They are nutrient dense, keep your hunger satisfied, and are convenient when on-the-go. However, when we were searching through the bar aisle at the grocery store, we were frustrated that we couldn't find options that weren't sweet. We set out to change that!

Four INCREDIBLY delicious flavors. Each thoughtfully created to invigorate your senses.

Want to start your day with a punch? Our vibrant, citrusy Margarita Lime bar with a refreshing snap of lime will do just that. Or looking for an evening snack that won’t disrupt the quality of your sleep? Our tangy, Smoky BBQ bar is a great way to satiate your pre-bedtime hunger.

BLD Bars are gluten-free and plant-based to provide long-lasting sustainable energy without a crash. 

 

All of our rewards include FREE SHIPPING (lower 48 states only*)

Shipping by October 2021

 

Texture: Crunchy, yet melt-in-your-mouth!

 

Nutritional Info

 

"At BLD Bar it’s our goal to make snacking fun and enjoyable"

 

BLD Bar was founded by an amateur home chef: Anish Vanmali. Using my knowledge of cooking skills and love of fitness & food, I decided to start this company to create more snacking options for my own diet. Our first product launched in fall of 2019 and was successfully delivered to thousands of people who felt the same need. Since then, we have continued to innovate new flavors and improve our product based on valuable customer feedback.

 

We can’t wait to BLD the community with you!

 

Risks and challenges

We GUARANTEE to deliver your product, or we will refund everyone who pre-orders. We are very confident in our timeline, but it's our core belief to never settle for a mediocre product. So we won't be compromising on quality in order to save time. Should any issues arise we promise to keep you updated every step of the way and deliver you the best quality product as soon as possible. With the following risks and challenges taken into consideration, we have estimated our ship date to be October 2021.

story:
Order Yours on Amazon Today!
or at our Wesite

http://www.ZipSealer.com

Worldwide Shipping Available!

 


 

Sealing zipper lock bags will never be easier!! ZipSealer® is going to be your new favorite kitchen tool once you get your hands on one!

(International Patents Pending)

Many people find sealing any kind of zipper locking bag to be difficult and frustrating, including some seniors or people with chronic hand or finger joint pain like Arthritis. You never really know if the seal is completely tight from end to end. Some people even lie the bag down flat on the counter and and use it to push down on when sliding their finger along the zipper. This doesn't really work so well if the bag is bulky and full or has liquid or powder in it. The ZipSealer® makes it incredibly easy to get the tightest seal possible every single time, you will love using it!

Remember... Perks are priced in Canadian Dollars. Any Contribution Made in US Dollars will effectively have a 20% - 25% Discount at Current Exchange Rates!!

 

 Invented By:

     Dave Keehner
"Growing up and later living on and running the family farm taught me a lot about being resourceful and making the most of what you have at hand. If there was ever a problem that needed solving, or something broke down, spending a lot of time and money to have someone else take care of it was rarely an option. You had to be creative to get by and use what you had available to make it work. Usually that meant keeping the solution as simple as possible.... That philosophy is reflected in the simplicity of the ZipSealer®. It's so easy to use and it works GREAT!"
 
1. Hold the bag and pinch one end of the zipper to start.

2. Place the zipper between the ZipSealer® tong ends in the "ZipZone"(between chevrons  >>>|<<<).

3. Gently squeeze the ZipSealer® and slide along keeping the zipper in "ZipZone".

The ZipSealer® was designed and will be manufactured locally by some very talented and experienced people. Keeping things close to home has helped to ensure the highest quality production and a smooth road from concept to marketplace. We have tried to minimize any long distance problems associated when dealing with entities overseas simply for the sake of reducing costs... and usually at the expense of quality. No compromises were made to ensure that the highest standards of design, manufacturing and function were always maintained in creating the ZipSealer®.
 
  • ZipSealer® Fits Easily Into Sandwich Bag Box For Total Convenience. ​
  • Embedded Magnet Keeps the ZipSealer® Always Handy on the Fridge. 
  • Dishwasher Safe.                                                                            

     

    ​How You Can Help Us:

The Production Mold Tooling and Design that is needed to manufacture the ZipSealer® is the most critical element to get right, and biggest hurdle to overcome on the way to market. It is also the costliest, by far! That is what this campaign is all about. We have done our homework to get to where we are now. The patents are pending, the design has been tested, evaluated and revised multiple times, manufacturing is lined up, now it's time to get the ZipSealer® into the hands of people everywhere. 
ZipSealer® is going to get to market with your help and support no matter what happens...
We guarantee it! Claim Your Perks Today!
 

    How We Can Help You:

    ZipSealer® makes a simple, everyday task so much easier for absolutely everybody, you'll see! But it is also a god-send for millions of seniors or those with carpal tunnel syndrome or hand and finger joint pain who find it very difficult, if not impossible to seal zipper lock bags. We are currently working towards getting the endorsement of the Arthritis Society through their "Ease of Use" Program Certification and hope to have it soon. 
     

    The scope of use goes well beyond the domestic kitchen!   

       Commercial packing and shipping operations, food production, even medical and laboratory settings that use zipper bags are all areas where the ZipSealer® will prove to be invaluable through increased efficiency. It will also reduce the risk of any cross contamination since it will lessen the amount of direct contact with the bag. Any environment that requires people to wear rubber, latex, or any other type of glove will certainly benefit greatly by using the ZipSealer® too. 

    Some other suggested uses have been as a tool for: 
    • Squeezing the remaining contents out of a tube of toothpaste, cream, lotion or ointment, or other kinds of tubing. 
    • Making crisp folds with paper quickly and efficiently, perfect for advertising brochures and tri-folds.  
    • Making long lasting hems, creases or pleats in fabric & clothing.
     It can certainly be used for all that too! We are sure as it's popularity grows, people will find even more uses for it.
     

      The Journey so far...

       

       

      The creative road to make the ZipSealer® a reality has been a lot of fun and, at times, somewhat frustrating. I have always believed that wherever persistence and intelligence are applied, anything that can go right, will go right, and anything that is good will get better. During development we spent a great deal of time focusing on what problems there might be with the ZipSealer® and we made sure we came up with the solutions to fix them along the way. These are some of the steps we took and how we got to where we are now...

       

      Making this first working prototype and trying it out was truly an exhilarating moment; taking that seed of in idea and turning it into something real! It worked perfectly, the very first time too! The Thermoplastic was the only thing that I had to order and buy, everything else was already at hand. 
      Once the Patent Applications were filed it was off to a local world class manufacturer. At our first meeting, the plant owner at LD Tool & Die absolutely loved the tool and told me he had to seal at least 10 bags the night before and wished he had one. They set me up with a designer at Wingspan Design who has done a lot of work for Lee Valley Tools, another great local company, and he came up with an initial design.
      Great start but we had to make some changes to this initial design to ensure that it would work as well as it possibly could. This involved rounding off the ends and positioning the rollers as close to the ends as possible so it wouldn't snag on the bag if it was bulging with contents. We also rounded off the roller mounts at the ends so the edges of the bag wouldn't get caught on them when the bag is fed between the rollers. Another change was slimming it down for a better ergonomic fit, no matter what size of hand was using it.
      So we came up with this...
       

      1.0 3D Printed Prototypes:

      From here we found in our focus groups that the natural way people want to instinctively hold the tool, required a change in the alignment of the roller end so that it resembled a "hockey stick" shape. All we had to do was put a bend in it, or so we thought. Extensive testing showed that the angle had to be extremely precise. The whole process was much more complicated than it seemed at first, but we got it done. Making sure the ZipSealer® works as well as it possibly can has always been more important than making it easy to manufacture.
      And we ended up here...

       

      2.0 3D Printed Prototype:

      We feel that we have created something very simple that will help make a lot of peoples lives so much simpler too!

      STRETCH GOALS

      We have come a long way to get to where we are and we have a lot future plans for the ZipSealer® that we'd like to pursue, after we meet our funding goal. You can help us get there by claiming your perks today!

      If we reach:

      • $50,000- Unlocks Commercial Grade ZipSealer® with Steel Rollers and Axles for hundreds of uses per day if needed. Ideal for Distribution, Packing & Shipping Operations.
      • $80,000- Unlocks Medical/ Food/ Laboratory Grade All Stainless Steel Version of the ZipSealer® for Clean or Sterile Environments.
       

      Please Help Us Spread the Word!

      Even if you feel that you may not need a ZipSealer® for yourself, you most certainly know someone who does need one, your parents, your neighbor, your best friend, your co-worker. Please be sure to "Like" and share this page with them, and everybody else on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest etc. so they can get their hands on on a ZipSealer® too!

      Together, we can make it happen!

       

                         Striding Edge Innovations

      "Bridging the gap between EVERY DAY PROBLEMS                and SIMPLE INNOVATIVE SOLUTIONS"
story_txt:
Order Yours on Amazon Today!or at our Wesite
http://www.ZipSealer.com
Worldwide Shipping Available!
 



 
Sealing zipper lock bags will never be easier!! ZipSealer® is going to be your new favorite kitchen tool once you get your hands on one!
(International Patents Pending)
Many people find sealing any kind of zipper locking bag to be difficult and frustrating, including some seniors or people with chronic hand or finger joint pain like Arthritis. You never really know if the seal is completely tight from end to end. Some people even lie the bag down flat on the counter and and use it to push down on when sliding their finger along the zipper. This doesn't really work so well if the bag is bulky and full or has liquid or powder in it. The ZipSealer® makes it incredibly easy to get the tightest seal possible every single time, you will love using it!

Remember... Perks are priced in Canadian Dollars. Any Contribution Made in US Dollars will effectively have a 20% - 25% Discount at Current Exchange Rates!! 
 Invented By:
     Dave Keehner
"Growing up and later living on and running the family farm taught me a lot about being resourceful and making the most of what you have at hand. If there was ever a problem that needed solving, or something broke down, spending a lot of time and money to have someone else take care of it was rarely an option. You had to be creative to get by and use what you had available to make it work. Usually that meant keeping the solution as simple as possible.... That philosophy is reflected in the simplicity of the ZipSealer®. It's so easy to use and it works GREAT!"
 
1. Hold the bag and pinch one end of the zipper to start.

2. Place the zipper between the ZipSealer® tong ends in the "ZipZone"(between chevrons  >>>|<<<).

3. Gently squeeze the ZipSealer® and slide along keeping the zipper in "ZipZone".

The ZipSealer® was designed and will be manufactured locally by some very talented and experienced people. Keeping things close to home has helped to ensure the highest quality production and a smooth road from concept to marketplace. We have tried to minimize any long distance problems associated when dealing with entities overseas simply for the sake of reducing costs... and usually at the expense of quality. No compromises were made to ensure that the highest standards of design, manufacturing and function were always maintained in creating the ZipSealer®.
 


ZipSealer® Fits Easily Into Sandwich Bag Box For Total Convenience. ​
Embedded Magnet Keeps the ZipSealer® Always Handy on the Fridge. 

Dishwasher Safe.                                                                             
​How You Can Help Us:



The Production Mold Tooling and Design that is needed to manufacture the ZipSealer® is the most critical element to get right, and biggest hurdle to overcome on the way to market. It is also the costliest, by far! That is what this campaign is all about. We have done our homework to get to where we are now. The patents are pending, the design has been tested, evaluated and revised multiple times, manufacturing is lined up, now it's time to get the ZipSealer® into the hands of people everywhere. 

ZipSealer® is going to get to market with your help and support no matter what happens...
We guarantee it! Claim Your Perks Today!
 


How We Can Help You:

ZipSealer® makes a simple, everyday task so much easier for absolutely everybody, you'll see! But it is also a god-send for millions of seniors or those with carpal tunnel syndrome or hand and finger joint pain who find it very difficult, if not impossible to seal zipper lock bags. We are currently working towards getting the endorsement of the Arthritis Society through their "Ease of Use" Program Certification and hope to have it soon.

story:
The finest exquisite, authentic, taste from around the world. Mola Foods is the new Kitchen staple that everyone should Have.

Have you ever had a taste for something different or needed to add some life to your food and just didn't know where to look? Well, then, look no further!  Mola foods Inc. is here to satisfy your craving whether you are looking for familiar favorites or introducing the flavors of culture and cuisine to the next generation. It will certainly become your new kitchen staple!

My Mola Condiments Box is a box for everyone who loves to try  food from around the world and wants to add a depth of flavor to their food. Each box contains a great selection of sauces and condiments. 

 

Our Story: It all started with a friend approaching me with the idea to start a chili sauce company with Cameroonian chilies. At the time I found the idea silly. But later I started to entertain it and with that came the birth of our Chili Relishes. I reached out to my best friend Tiffany pitching the idea to her as me wanting to build a platform for people who love ethnic food and creating condiments from around the world. Not knowing that this has been my best friend dream, she stayed silent on the other end of the phone then said she would like nothing but to venture with me in adding depth into flavors with ancient ethnic recipes from around the world as this has always been her dream. From there our adventure began. The main purpose being to introduce the flavors of culture and cuisine to the next generation by making Mola Foods the new kitchen staple

Click here for more Reviews  and here you can find our Press Release and press Kit

What to use Your Condiments with

 

 

 

Testimonials:

 I'm excited about this seasoning! I can't wait to purchase a few of these Mola seasonings to put in my collection ! Mola seasoning made my dishes taste extra flavorful! yum~Tamara, Atlanta, GA

Got my Mola seasoning in the mail yesterday! Couldn't wait to open the package and try it! I happened to be cooking ground beef so I added my Mola seasoning to it, it was magical! I am not much into eating beef but this time was different. Mola seasoning added a great most delicious texture to my ground beef sauce, I couldn't get enough of it! I added my Mola seasoning to my salmon today! -Nadia, Boston 

What's in The Box?

Each box contains a great selection of sauces and condiments.

story:
A Baker's Dream

Ever since Dionne Christian was little,  she has been dreaming of blending and baking. After years of passionate experimentation and practice, Dionne has personalized her own recipes for everything from focaccia, to pumpernickel sourdough boules, to classic cinnamon rolls - yet all with a twist. Everything she bakes is always 100% gluten-free.  

While Dionne's success as a small business-owner has followed her through her founding of The Teahouse restaurant in Santa Fe, New Mexico, as well as her wildly popular first location of Revolution Bakery, today we need your support to help Dionne dream even bigger.

With your donations, Dionne can open up her second location of Revolution Bakery, coming to Albuquerque, New Mexico. During the especially challenging times of Covid-19, your contribution will directly support both a small-business owner and the community she serves, one loaf at a time. 
 

10,000 Pounds

While mass-produced gluten-free breads often use a starch base such as corn starch, potato starch or tapioca, Revolution Bakery uses ancient grains that are heartier, healthier and much more delicious. Your donations will help Dionne to purchase all the necessary bases she uses to bake 100% gluten free, such as:

  • Buckwheat
  • Millet
  • Quinoa
  • Sorghum
  • Gluten-free oats

In addition to 10,000 pounds of flour, donations will also go toward securing all the equipment necessary for a fully functioning kitchen in the new bakery, including ovens, mixers, refrigeration, tables and racks. 

 

    Funding by the Community, For the Community 

    Through grassroots fundraising, Revolution Bakery will give directly back to the New Mexico community by donating 10% of all proceeds made from this campaign to Pete's Place. Also known as the Interfaith Community Shelter in Santa Fe, ICS offers overnight shelter for individuals facing houselessness, as well as longer-term services such as counseling, legal support, or job search assistance. 

    Learn more about Pete's Place here: https://interfaithsheltersf.org/

    Additionally, in gratitude for your support, any donation of $50, $100, $200, $500 or $1000 will result in a variety of Revolution Bakery goodies, delivered right to your doorstep. See the donation perks on the right-hand side and below to see what your donation could get you.

     

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you are able, please consider donating to this campaign as well as sharing this page on all your social media profiles. Help make sure this phenomenal baker can bring her magic to Albuquerque, New Mexico.

      Thank you so much for your support & we can't wait to see you all at Revolution Bakery's new upcoming location!

story:
Short Summary

Tyler and I have been friends since we were little tots. So good a friend, I risked being fired from Nobu for asking Geddy Lee (Rush) his autograph for Ty, which he obliged. "Chef - Keep on cookin," is what he wrote. I think the world of him as a friend and even more as a chef.

The single most important ingredient to the success of any restaurant is the food, which is why I am certain that we will thrive. Pizzas, sandwiches, salads, juices, smoothies, boozey kegged lemonades, beer and wine served quickly for either dine in or to go.

I am forever grateful to be a part of this concept and to you for your contributions. I look forward to seeing you all in person, hopefully at a time when hugging is permissible! -Sean

GIFT CARDS MAKE GREAT HOLIDAY GIFTS!!!

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise 100K to get Nova Lua up and running. The more the merrier! Your contributions will go to everything from designing the restaurant, to development of the menu, and everything in between. Pick out multiple perks if you please. No contribution is too large or too small. We appreciate any amount that you can contribute.

Our list of perks were designed, as best we could, to bring you into a place that you have helped to create and to show you how incredible plant based food can be so that you will become regulars. We want to see your faces. We want you to feel like you have helped create something positive for the community. We want to show our appreciation for your help!

The Impact

Our intention is to grow Nova Lua to multiple locations. It starts with the first one. If we are gonna to change the world, we're gonna need all the help we can get.

Risks & Challenges

Nobody in the restaurant business has been untouched by Covid. My heart goes out to the hundreds of friends I have worked with over the years and to many more that have lost their jobs and even their restaurants. I do, however believe that in this upheaval a new business model will emerge and I know Nova Lua will be wildly successful. 

As the cost of meat and seafood continue to skyrocket, the cost of vegetables remains reasonable. Our relationships with local farmers allows us to cut cost. The closer the farmer, the better the quality of food and lower carbon footprint.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are aware that not everyone is in a position to help financially. Feel free to mention us to anyone and everyone you please and send us your positive thoughts, and check out our website out at www.novaluavegan.com! A really big hug to Moby for his blessing to use his music and to Andrew Kemler for shooting our video!

story:
The Long and the Short of It

Erica and I ordinarily work as tour guides in the Cinque Terre, particularly with English-speaking clients, especially Americans, but with the Covid travel restrictions we found ourselves basically without a job this year.  But we had a Plan B in our pockets: wine!  We work very closely with winemakers in the Cinque Terre, and Erica is a sommelier-in-training.  Most importantly, we purchased an abandoned vineyard years ago, always hoping that we would have time to transform it.  Well, in this sense, we have to say thank you Coronavirus, because we had nothing but time this year.

In May we started clearing the land, just Erica and me,  Everyone in town, and we mean everyone, thought we were nuts.  The video gives a bit of an idea of how it was: the battle with the thorns, rusty wire (about 3 cubic meters total), and 20 foot pine trees was pretty intense, and the steepness of the hillside was daunting.  So was the heat.  But it's November now, we still have all of our fingers, and the land we need for planting (half an acre for starts) is clear.  They think we're a little less nuts now.

This is where you come in.  We've done everything ourselves up until now, but we need a Bobcat (and a Bobcat driver) to  create a yard-wide path from bottom to top (140 meters!), pull up the roots of everything we cut down, and do the heavy digging needed to start replacing the stone terraces that this region is famous for.

Our short term plan after the Bobcat excavation is to build a fence (for the rampant and pesky wild boars), and planting the grape vines (all 1500 of them!) in Fall 2021.  Our long term goal is to eventually purchase the equipment for a wine cellar so as to be ready for our first vintage in 2025, a necessary time frame since grape vines need on average 4 years between planting and their first usable harvest,  In the meantime, we will be working with local winemaker friends in the fields and in the cellars during the harvests, to get as much practice as possible.

What We Need & What You Get

12,000 dollars would get us a long way through this second phase of our project.  Getting someone and their Bobcat on our field is not going to be cheap, and rightly so: they deserve whatever they are asking for to work on a hillside that looks like a Black Diamond ski slope!  Even if we don't get to our goal, anything that we are able to raise will go toward that budget.  If we pass our goal, the extra money will go into the fences and grape vine seedlings that we mentioned above.

Naturally, we would love to be able to pay you back for your generosity with our own wine, but we think it's asking a lot of you to wait five years for a bottle, no matter how good it is.  So we're offering to reward your faith in our dream by the means we have: free tours in the Cinque Terre for anyone who can get here (there will be a post-Covid era sometime), online wine tasting experiences for those who can't, plus some personal recipes and wine tips for everyone else.  Our exchanges will thus be on an entirely personal level; we hope to meet you in person or online, but no matter what, we will be able t o pass along a bit of ourselves, our passion, and our knowledge about Italy to you. 

The Impact

In case you didn't know, every inch of this coastal area of Italy was once farmed, almost entirely with grapes and olives.  Today, as any of you who has had to good luck to see the Cinque Terre in person, that is no longer so.  And so while you would be helping us personally to rebuild this particular vineyard, in a small way you would be helping to reclaim a bit of the old agricultural traditions and culture.  After all, this area is a UNESCO world heritage site because of its history of terraced farming, not for mass tourism!

Write to us if you have any questions, we'd love to build a real relationship with our potential backers.  Pass the word along to any friends or family who love Italy, the Cinque Terre, or just plain old wine.  And grazie, grazie, grazie!
story_txt:
The Long and the Short of It
Erica and I ordinarily work as tour guides in the Cinque Terre, particularly with English-speaking clients, especially Americans, but with the Covid travel restrictions we found ourselves basically without a job this year.  But we had a Plan B in our pockets: wine!  We work very closely with winemakers in the Cinque Terre, and Erica is a sommelier-in-training.  Most importantly, we purchased an abandoned vineyard years ago, always hoping that we would have time to transform it.  Well, in this sense, we have to say thank you Coronavirus, because we had nothing but time this year.
In May we started clearing the land, just Erica and me,  Everyone in town, and we mean everyone, thought we were nuts.  The video gives a bit of an idea of how it was: the battle with the thorns, rusty wire (about 3 cubic meters total), and 20 foot pine trees was pretty intense, and the steepness of the hillside was daunting.  So was the heat.  But it's November now, we still have all of our fingers, and the land we need for planting (half an acre for starts) is clear.  They think we're a little less nuts now.
This is where you come in.  We've done everything ourselves up until now, but we need a Bobcat (and a Bobcat driver) to  create a yard-wide path from bottom to top (140 meters!), pull up the roots of everything we cut down, and do the heavy digging needed to start replacing the stone terraces that this region is famous for.
Our short term plan after the Bobcat excavation is to build a fence (for the rampant and pesky wild boars), and planting the grape vines (all 1500 of them!) in Fall 2021.  Our long term goal is to eventually purchase the equipment for a wine cellar so as to be ready for our first vintage in 2025, a necessary time frame since grape vines need on average 4 years between planting and their first usable harvest,  In the meantime, we will be working with local winemaker friends in the fields and in the cellars during the harvests, to get as much practice as possible.

What We Need & What You Get
12,000 dollars would get us a long way through this second phase of our project.  Getting someone and their Bobcat on our field is not going to be cheap, and rightly so: they deserve whatever they are asking for to work on a hillside that looks like a Black Diamond ski slope!  Even if we don't get to our goal, anything that we are able to raise will go toward that budget.  If we pass our goal, the extra money will go into the fences and grape vine seedlings that we mentioned above.
Naturally, we would love to be able to pay you back for your generosity with our own wine, but we think it's asking a lot of you to wait five years for a bottle, no matter how good it is.  So we're offering to reward your faith in our dream by the means we have: free tours in the Cinque Terre for anyone who can get here (there will be a post-Covid era sometime), online wine tasting experiences for those who can't, plus some personal recipes and wine tips for everyone else.  Our exchanges will thus be on an entirely personal level; we hope to meet you in person or online, but no matter what, we will be able t o pass along a bit of ourselves, our passion, and our knowledge about Italy to you. 
The Impact

In case you didn't know, every inch of this coastal area of Italy was once farmed, almost entirely with grapes and olives.  Today, as any of you who has had to good luck to see the Cinque Terre in person, that is no longer so.  And so while you would be helping us personally to rebuild this particular vineyard, in a small way you would be helping to reclaim a bit of the old agricultural traditions and culture.  After all, this area is a UNESCO world heritage site because of its history of terraced farming, not for mass tourism!
Write to us if you have any questions, we'd love to build a real relationship with our potential backers.  Pass the word along to any friends or family who love Italy, the Cinque Terre, or just plain old wine.  And grazie, grazie, grazie!

story:
What is Fit Snack?

Fit Snack is a snack subscription company designed to help people maintain a healthy lifestyle in a fun and convenient way. Each Fit Snack box is filled with healthy, indulgent, guilt-free snacks to satisfy every craving. Fit Snack also serves as an educational resource providing health-focused tips, workouts, and nutritional information to help subscribers live healthier lifestyles. 

Since launching in 2014, it has been the mission of Fit Snack to give small, healthy snack brands a platform to launch products and introduce active consumers to a wide array of nutritious snacks. It’s also expanded to include a corporate wellness program for businesses. Run by an all-female, minority team, Fit Snack has created a robust fitness program to encourage its subscribers, and the Colorado community, to make healthy lifestyle choices.

We Need Your Help.

Unfortunately, in January of 2021, Denver-based healthy snack subscription service, Fit Snack, was the victim of a damaging cyber attack that resulted in a massive hit to the company’s bottom line. The cyber attack was carried out on the small business by a card tester, which is a robot designed to test fake credit card numbers. Though the tester was unsuccessful – not a single card number was processed successfully through Fit Snacks website – the company was still saddled with tens of thousands in processing fees and a month of lost revenue. While no customer information or data was breached, the unexpected fees and loss of sales have pushed Fit Snack to the brink of closure. 

The Threat to Small Businesses:

Since the onset of the COVID pandemic, cyber fraud targeting small businesses has increased and the affect of these attacks is often devastating. According to Small Biz Daily, 43% of cyber attacks are targeted to small businesses and the National Security Alliance stated that 60 percent of small businesses close within months of the attack. 

How Small Businesses Can Fight Back:

Fit Snack is sharing its story to encourage other small businesses to enhance cyber security measures in the face of this mounting danger. 

“It is critical for small businesses to take precautions to protect themselves from cyber security threats,” said Rosita Biel, founder. “This often requires a number of security measures to be put in place along with website monitoring and knowing what to do if an attack occurs.”

In the case of Fit Snack, trusted website partners misled the company during the attack, which led to the company losing a month of sales. Since the cyber attack, Fit Snack has fought to stay open and has implemented several additional security measures, such as: 

Strategic fraud detection filters combining smaller limits on transaction velocity coupled with verification points such as matching zip code and security code. 

  • Enhanced features such as Captiva (launching soon)
  • Utilizing merchant processor security services 
  • Creating card processing maximums 
  • Website and transaction monitoring 

Although Fit Snack has upgraded its website with fraud prevention measures multiple times throughout the company’s history, this experience has taught it that small, online retailers must continuously re-evaluate website security and take ongoing action to fight cybercrime. The detriment caused by the fraud attack and Fit Snack’s loss of revenue has been crippling to the business. Still, this all-female, minority-led team is refusing to give up.

"Operating the business through COVID was tough, but we managed to find ways to survive and thrive during this difficult time," Biel said. "We were even able to help others by donating hundreds of snack boxes to organizations like Boys and Girls Club, Denver Health, Denver Feed it Forward, and United Way. We never thought we'd survive a tough time like that only to be hit by this attack."

How Can You Help? 

Support our campaign and buy some boxes!

In an effort to bounce back, Fit Snack has launched this Indiegogo Campaign offering special rates on snack boxes and discounted delivery options. The offer also provides discounts for bulk orders, making it easy for companies looking to add something special to its corporate wellness programs. 

“This is a great opportunity for anyone looking to bring more wellness into their daily life, especially now that COVID restrictions are lifting and summer is right around the corner,” Biel said. “It’s been a hard year, but I believe in the power of small businesses and our local community. I know we’ll get through this together.” 

Perk Sale Details: 

Fit Snack is offering a flat rate of $18 per box.  A perfect gift for corporate offices, remote employees, individuals, and families.  Each box is valued over $40.00.

For all local Denver bulk orders (10 boxes or more), enjoy a huge discount on shipping with $20 deliveries, as Fit Snack is going to hand-deliver!

story:
The Pancakes for the 80-20 Fitness Rule

Did you know that the great fitness goals that you’re pursuing depends on 80% of what you eat and only 20% on what exercise you do? That’s true, and this is one of the main reasons why Major Protein is coming to help you: you need protein-filled healthy food that keeps you strong and balanced, and which also tastes delicious. That’s what Major Protein’s Protein Pancakes and Waffles, Protein Mixes, and Protein Syrups have to offer you – the right kind of food with the right kind of flavor to help your fitness goals be 80% closer to becoming a reality.

Fresh, Local & Balanced

Our markets are flooded with imported food products that are mostly processed and which are not really good for us. Ironically, in my travels through several developing nations, I saw how easy it is for people in these countries to eat fresh food with local excellent ingredients that make a naturally balanced diet that keeps the palate happy. That is one of the reasons why I decided to start Major Protein: to offer you healthy and nutritious protein baked food with fresh, locally sourced and balanced ingredients which are also sustainable.

Pancakes for a Greener Planet

That’s right: Major Protein’s pancake products are also eco-friendly. They’re not only made of sustainable ingredients, but their packaging is fully reusable and recyclable because we’re committed to ending plastic waste in the world. Plus, Major Protein pancakes help to reduce water waste – one pancake alone can help save 650,000 liters of water! Yep, after all, after seeing so much pollution and environmental disasters around the world, and after seeing the tremendous environmental impact that wasteful packages have on our planet, I became committed to creating pancakes that treat you well while also help keep the planet as green as we want and need it to be – for everyone’s sake!

Better than Beef, Stronger than Spinach

Major Protein contains twice as much protein as beef, more iron than spinach, nine essential amino acids, a wealth of omega-3 fatty acids, and more calcium than milk. With the revolutionary cricket protein and with other three strong protein sources that it is based on, Major Protein is also gluten-free, and it comes in six different absurdly delightful flavors.

Major Protein Fighting Sugar Crimes

Having the sweet scent of yummy hot pancakes taking over your home in a way that is healthy and good for you seemed like a dream that would never come true… I know: you thought you’d be forever left on your own to face those irresistible but very nasty guilty pleasures of sugar-loaded snacks that just bring fat, heart problems and diabetes into your life… Well, think again: these yummy healthy pancakes are now a reality that keeps you from being tempted by these nasty snacks. Based on a comic book of healthy and taste-rich recipes for the hero within you, Major Protein is here to help you easily fight sugary temptations, keep those sugar crimes from taking place, and making sure that you don’t fall prey to the sugar addiction that threatens to bring you down.

DYI or On-Demand Freshly Baked Protein Goods

Major Protein is working to offer an even wider range of protein products that taste wonderful. Along with our current product line, with your help, we’ll soon also be offering other protein baking mixes and syrups along with many other baked protein goods. Besides, Major Protein is working to offer you two choices: DYI Protein Pancake Batter that allows you to easily fix your own deliciously addictive pancakes, or freshly baked protein pancakes, waffles that we are planning to make available for you to order via Major Protein franchisee sellers. In both cases, our mission is to put these crazily exquisite pancakes that are good for you right there where you need them.

 

Resellers, Gym Partners & Schools: Major Protein Wants You 

If you’d like to be a reseller and franchisee, this is a great business opportunity, because you have an easy way of using Major Protein’s product to get a piece of the action in the billionaire market niche of healthy food. If you own or run a gym, you have here the chance of adding an extra stream of revenue by selling to your customers nutritious and delicious baked foods that will help them get better fitness results. If you direct a school or university, we’re offering you the chance to provide your student community with the kind of food that they’d go crazy for because it tastes so good, it feeds them so well, and it fits their environmental concerns so perfectly. It’s a win-win situation that you are welcome to better explore by choosing our special rewards for re-sellers or by contacting us directly for that purpose.

One Solution for Many Different Needs

So maybe you are a Health Nut or a Fitness Fanatic… Maybe you just want to go on being a Healthy Student who doesn’t want to sacrifice your health for cheap, easy-to-eat but seriously nasty snacks, or you’re a Busy Professional who is always racing against time to get everything done and want to have really good food that you can rely on to stay healthy while busy… Or you’re an Eco-Warrior who really cares about the impact that what you’re eating has on the planet that we all call home. In any case, you can be sure that Major Protein is the one protein-rich solution for all your needs and preferences…

Which is why we’re inviting you to help us raise the $1,000 that we need to fund the development of Major Protein’s current and future products, namely by:

  • Securing your very special access to these unique pancakes by choosing one of the great rewards that we have on offer

 

  • Securing your chance of becoming a Major Protein Partner or Re-seller by choosing the special rewards we have for that purpose

 

  • Sharing this campaign on social media, as well as with your friends and family members who may also be interested in pancakes that are healthy, tasty and eco-friendly

 

Thank you so much, and we hope to be soon helping you to keep your home perfumed with the scent of Major Protein’s special pancakes and syrups every morning…

story:
Hi! My name is Robin Hofmann. I earned my bachelor’s degree in Psychology and became a Certified Behavior Analyst in 1994 while working with individuals on the autism spectrum. For the past 26 years, I have had the honor of helping individuals, their parents, and the community through classroom teaching, behavior intervention, autism support and autism awareness. When I started this journey there is no way I could have known that eventually I would have my own child who would be diagnosed with an autism spectrum disorder.

10 years ago I was diagnosed with Celiac Disease. I have always had a loving relationship with food and was determined to maintain that relationship by creating delicious gluten-free recipes everyone can enjoy. The idea for Hoffy’s Heart started developing years ago. Seeing the growing need for “safe for celiac” eating establishments as well as the desperate need for employment opportunities for individuals on the spectrum, I decided it was time to make Hoffy’s Heart a reality. With your support, we can open the doors to Hoffy’s Heart and offer so much more than incredible, delicious food. We would be able to make a difference in both the celiac and autism communities by offering the following recurring events:

Community Awareness

Social Groups

Cooking Classes

Parent Nights

Newly Diagnosed Information Sessions

First-Responder Awareness

 

What we will need to get started:

Proof boxes $100.00

Cooling Racks $200.00

Muffin pans $200.00

Baking sheets $300.00

Mixers $1,400.00

Work tables $600.00

Food processor $700.00

Sinks $850.00

Chiller $2,500.00

Refrigerator/Freezers $8,000.00

Oven $15,000.00

Display cases (with refrigeration) $25,000.00

Opening inventory  $20,000.00

 

Our goal is to create a solid business model which can easily be replicated in other cities. This can increase the employment rate for those who may not have had this opportunity and provide delicious and safe options for those with issues with gluten.

We are willing to fight as hard as possible to open the doors to Hoffy’s Heart. We full-heartedly believe we have a winning combination; between the quality of our baked goods and food and our community initiatives, however, we know the reality of how difficult it is for new restaurants to open and stay in business. If it happens to be that we are unable to open Hoffy’s Heart, every penny donated will be equally distributed between the Beyond Celiac and Autism Society organizations.

We absolutely cannot make this happen without your help. Please consider making a donation to Hoffy’s Heart. If you are unable to donate, we completely understand and wish you the best. Please consider helping by sharing our initiative with your friends and family.

Be well.

“To the world you may be one person, but to one person you may be the world.” -Bill Wilson
