(The design is ready!  We just need your help for our 100% sustainable packaging) ABOUT US We create small batches of award winning craft chocolate from our micro factory in Stoke on Trent. UK.Every process, from the moment the cacao beans arrive at our kitchen (from origins such as Peru & West Papua) is overseen by founder & head chocolate maker James Walter.After spending 20 years as an award winning chef in the hotel and restaurant industry, James always held the belief that his passion for fine flavour & food chemistry would one day guide him down a slightly different path.The ultra premium cacao we use to make our chocolate, is sourced directly by us from small farms & cooperatives from around the equator, ensuring the best possible price for the farmers in some of the world's poorest regions.  This is known as direct trade.We operate a zero child slavery policy when sourcing our cacao, unlike many of the larger well known brands.Fair trade isn't necessarily fair when it comes to child slavery in the chocolate industry. You can check here for ethical chocolate makers by clicking here - Food Empowerment Project and Slave Free Chocolate.Our belief in ethically sourcing through direct trade ensures transparency within the whole supply chain.By paying a premium price, this helps the farmers to continue growing cacao (considered a reforestation crop), which in turn helps improves biodiversity, whilst also creating positive social impacts within these farming communities. (We met cacao farmer Luis Mancini in 2017 at the start of our chocolate making journey) RECYCLING FACTS Recycling rates are increasing in the UK, but so is our population. British households create over 26 million tonnes of waste each year. This means that the average person in the UK throws away around 400kg of waste each year; 7 times their body weight.​It takes 70% less energy to recycle paper than it does to make it new from raw materials.​ Recycling everything you could in your kitchen recycling bins could power a TV for six months, plenty of time to binge watch your favourite programme!​​At Seed Chocolate we are very conscious of our responsibility toward the environment.Our new eco packaging is the first step of many.  From reforestation, to running a weather dependent neutral carbon micro factory, we want to grow organically & ethically.So whilst tasting great, It's helping the planet also! (Cacao pods grow on the trunk, unlike other crops around the world) WHAT WE NEED - OUR CAMPAIGN Eco packaging to match our award winning ethical chocolate. Our Indiegogo campaign is for £8,000.  This is needed to invest in: 

100% zero waste & biodegradable packaging.  Recycled cardboard outer.  Compostable inner pouch.  Plant based inks.  No Glue.

Small marketing opportunities.  UK & Staffordshire based.
We are extremely conscious of our carbon footprint.  We currently use FSC certified boxes, and also pop our own popcorn for inner packaging when shipping our chocolate & cocoa products.We are aiming to raise as much as possible, to help us stand toe to toe with our bean to bar competitors.The design is ready.  The COVID-19 pandemic stalled our plans, so now we need a little help to get this project over the line. EVERY £ COUNTS!!! As a small business, this investment really will help the long term future of Seed Chocolate, helping us to grow + scale sustainably. More chocolate = a better world.If we are unfortunate & fail to reach our goal of £8,000 then we aim to invest all of the raised funds into a scaled down version, to help us compete more sustainably. COLLABORATIONS We currently collaborate with some fantastic independent businesses in the UK.

Castletown Distillery, Staffordshire.

The Flintlock Restaurant, Staffordshire.

Simpsons Restaurant, Birmingham.
We are also proud cocoa bean suppliers to award winning Chocao Gin Liqueur.(A mock up of our proposed packaging) OUR INGREDIENTS We pride ourselves on using the finest organic ingredients.  Some are even foraged, fermented, pickled or dehydrated by head chocolate maker James Walter, to show off a range of flavour profiles that work in harmony with fine chocolate. True sustainable ingredients sourced in & around the UK.Our award winning chocolate is 100% FREE FROM soy & palm oil.  AWARDS & RECOGNITION This attention to detail has helped us achieve recognition and numerous awards from the following:The International Chocolate Awards - Silver, European, Africa & Middle East category (2019).The Guild of Fine Food (Great Taste Awards) - 2 stars (2020, 2019), 1 star (2020, 2018).The Academy of Chocolate Awards - Silver (2019), Bronze (2018).Great Taste ClubTaste of Staffordshire Awards (Enjoy Staffordshire) - Winner Specialist Food & Drink Retailer of the Year (2018).  EXCLUSIVE PERKS To help us to achieve our goal, we are offering some amazing perks & exclusive experiences for Indiegogo customers only.  COVID-19 MEASURES WILL BE IMPLEMENTED ON SELECTED CHOCOLATE EXPERIENCES IN ALIGNMENT WITH GOVERNMENT GUIDELINES.Experiences to be held in Newcastle-under-Lyme, Staffordshire.  UK.  SHARE ON SOCIAL MEDIA Other Ways You Can Help We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help: Please help our campaign by sharing with your family and friends.   
You may use the Indiegogo share tools (above & next to the follow icon) to post on Facebook, Twitter or by email. 
 
Shop for our chocolate!  Visit our website www.seedchocolate.com to shop for chocolate & online events. (The design is ready!  We just need your help for our 100% sustainable packaging) WHAT IF WE SURPASS OUR FUNDING GOAL?We have a couple of "stretch" goals/options for our fundraising campaign. 
Improved chocolate making equipment & machinery.

Larger micro factory premises.  We already have the painter & decorator to call on in the family.

Food & drink premises - chocolate cafe by day, fine natural wines by night.  Location - Staffordshire

Product development.  Such as spreads, oils & snacks.

Bulk shipments of new origins of cacao variety for a future chocolate range.  We have the farmers/origins lined up, ready & waiting.
    Thank you for your time & support James  Founder & Chocolate Maker - Seed Chocolate

story:
Why I Am Here:

Pursuing a long-time love of wine, I (Winemaker Bob) started small volume wine making in 2007.  The award-winning Zinpiphany© Zinfandel and Rhone-styled #2red followed.  Passion later changed to purpose following a diagnosis of incurable prostate cancer. Determined to make the best of the situation, I created the Robert and Susan Hollander Foundation, an IRS approved 501c3 non-profit supporting prostate cancer research.  Since then, all proceeds from my wine making efforts at 2redWinery are committed to supporting prostate cancer research through the Foundation.  Your tax-deductible support will allow me to continue to produce great wines for you while supporting prostate cancer research.

Blending the 2017 Zinpiphany - How It Happens In 60 Seconds

 

Award Winning Wines!
Zinpiphany
2007    2012 SF International Wine Competition        Silver Medal
2008    2012 SF International Wine Competition        Double Gold
2008    6th Annual American Fine Wine Competition    Silver Medal
2009    2012 SF International Wine Competition        Silver Medal
2010    2013 SF International Wine Competition        Gold Medal
2010     2014 NY World Wine & Spirits Competition   Silver Medal
2011     2014 SF International Wine Competition        Bronze Medal
2012    2016 SF International Wine Competition        Silver Medal
2013    2016 SF International Wine Competition        Silver Medal
2013    2017 NY World Wine & Spirits Competition    Bronze Medal
2014     2017 NY World Wine & Spirits Competition    Bronze Medal
2014    2018 SF Internal Wine Competition                   Bronze Medal
2015    2018 SF Internal Wine Competition                   Silver Medal
2015    2018 NY World Wine & Spirits Competition    Bronze Medal
2015    2019 NY World Wine & Spirits Competition    Silver Medal
2017    2019 SF Internal Wine Competition                   Silver Medal
2017    2019 NY World Wine & Spirits Competition    Silver Medal

#2red
2007    2012 SF International Wine Competition        Bronze Medal
2008    2012 SF International Wine Competition        Bronze Medal
2009    6th Annual American Fine Wine Competition  Silver Medal
2009    2012 SF International Wine Competition        Bronze Medal
2009     2014 NY World Wine & Spirits Competition  Double Gold/Best of Class
2010    2013 SF International Wine Competition        Gold Medal
2010    2014 NY World Wine & Spirits Competition    Bronze Medal
2011    2014 SF International Wine Competition        Silver Medal
2012    2016 SF International Wine Competition        Gold Medal
2013    2016 SF International Wine Competition        Bronze Medal
2014    2017 SF International Wine Competition        Bronze Medal

The Campaign:
By supporting this campaign with your tax-deductible support, you are rewarded with award-winning wine library while I can continue wine making and supporting prostate cancer research.

The campaign has three parts: Your tax-deductible support.

Red wine rewards for you.

All proceeds pass to the Foundation and prostate cancer research.

About 3 million men are living in America right now with prostate cancer and about 28000 will die this year.   Prostate cancer will affect about 1 in 7 men over their lifetime.  This campaign will allow me to continue the pursuit of something I love while helping someone you may know.

What I Need, What You Get & What I Do
All proceeds above my anticipated barrel cost of $9500 are committed to the Foundation and prostate cancer research.  The Foundation currently operates with an expense rate of 0.0% (I pay the costs.)  You get the wine (see Perks; all are ready to ship in warmer weather).  I get the satisfaction of making wine and doing something useful.  In the five fiscal years the Foundation has been operational, we have made the following annual gifts:

2013-Lance Pagliaro, M.D., Department of Genitourinary Medical Oncology, MD Anderson
2014-Nima Sharifi, M.D., Department of Cancer Biology, Cleveland Clinic
2015-Padmanee Sharma, M.D., Department of Genitourinary Medical Oncology, MD Anderson
2016-Scott Dehm, M.D. Department of Laboratory Medicine and Pathology, Mayo Clinic
2017-Mary-Ellen Taplin, M.D. Department of Medicine, Harvard Medical School
2018-Scott Dehm, Ph.D. Department of Urology, University of Minnesota 
2019-Chris Barbieri, M.D. M.D., Ph.D. Urologic Oncology Division, Weill Cornell Medical College

Back this campaign and reward yourself with great wines while supporting a worthy cause.

WINE for a CAUSE - Prostate Cancer Research
Charitable Drinking - Wine With A Purpose By 2RedWinery

story:
8 Amazing effects and benefits

 

1. Beautiful skin

Teafee contain a variety of nutrients such as vitamin A and C. These are essential for beautiful skin and contain collagen which helps with toning and the firming of skin.

 

2. Helps with swelling and hot flashes 

Many women suffer from swelling and hot flashes during pregnancy.

TeaFee contains potassium which is a diuretic, it can aid in discharging excess water and is effective in eliminating swelling. Drinking TeaFee will also improve breast milk quality.

 

3. Lower blood pressure

Teafee’s diuretic properties helps to expand the capillaries which can lower blood pressure. 

 

4. Improved liver function

Stress, consuming too many sweets, alcohol can be taxing on the liver weakening the natural detoxification functions. TeaFee supports healthy liver function, improving appetite and reduces upset stomach.  It is caffeine free and used in Kampo (a traditional Japanese ingredient); Its effects are safe and trusted worldwide.

 

5. Anemia prevention

Teafee is rich in iron an essential nutrient for the production of hemoglobin in the bloodstream which is key in blood cell structure.

Many people especially women take iron supplements to prevent anemia.

TeaFee will save you money as it can substitute your iron supplement needs.

 

6. Hormone balance

Taraxacine contained in Teafee improves liver function.

Supports healthy estrogen levels, estrogen is beneficial to the skin and lustrous beautiful hair.

This drink is recommended for those who suffer from extreme PMS before and after menstruation, those who want to balance postpartum hormones.

 

7. Diet effect

Inulin contained in Teafee suppresses the absorption of food. As a result, it is said to be effective in dieting regimens because it suppresses the increase in blood sugar levels.

It also contains an ingredient called T-1 extract, and works to improve the circulation of blood, which aids in burning fat and improving body temperature.

 

8. Improved constipation

Teafee also contains a water-soluble dietary fiber that is easily absorbed and promotes smoother stool. Furthermore, inulin has strong properties in the gastrointestinal digestive fluid. Inulin that arrives in the intestine is broken down into fructooligosaccharides, as a result, the good bacteria in the gut flora will increase and the intestinal environment will improve.

 

 

How to make a cup of "teafee"

 

 

 

Why we need your help with funding?

 

80% of the funding will be used to purchase the highest quality ingredients possible from our farmers who supports equal pay for women and the poor. 

20% will be for materials such as packing, seals and tools to make our operations more efficient so we can deliver an attractive and superior product to you.

 

Who is TeaFee?

 

Hello, my name is Jin and I’m the founder of "teafee". I’ve always liked drinking a good cup of tea and as much as I like the taste of sweet milk coffee, however I’m very sensitive to caffeine. Caffeine makes me anxious and I often get upset stomach from it.

Decaf coffee is definitely not an option for someone who is athletic and cares a lot about health.

 

One day I decided to try making my own alternative drink to tea and coffee. After months of trial and error with many different herbal ingredients I finally became satisfied with the smell and taste of my drink. "teafee" ended up as a drink that is neither tea not coffee, it’s a new beverage. It smells nice, is also delicious and healthy which is everything I ever wanted.  I especially love mixing it with some sugar and cream, leaving it in my fridge and enjoy drinking it chilled.

 

A few weeks later I decided to have a party at my home where I decided to serve teafee as a beverage and dessert to my friends and their guests. Not in a million years was I expecting such rave compliments and reactions from them.

 

Many asked if they could take some home.

The next few days I started getting texts and calls from my friends telling me how delicious it is, how it helps them sleep better, and that they feel more calm and less stressed. 

Some even tried to convince me to turn this into a business. At the time I didn’t even know what to call my drink, let alone turn it into a business.

After the overwhelming support and encouragement I finally decided that I’d like to share my creation with as many people as possible. 

But first, I need a name right? It’s not quite tea or coffee so what is it? This is when TeaFee was born.

 

How Does Teafee Compare To Coffee?

 

 

 

Here's What You Get In Every Cup...

 

Here Are The Stars That Make It All Work...

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Recipes

 

Original Teafee Blend Instructions (1 Serving)

 

Simple Teafee Latte (1 Serving)

 

 

Peanut Butter Chocolate Teafee Latte (1 Serving)

 

 

Our Mission

 

TeaFee has helped me avoid caffeine, relieve stress and sleep better. While I’m losing weight I can tell it helps me with my digestion and how my body feels. 

TeaFee was originally made for my personal use, however with my friends’ encouragement they opened my mind that I’d like to share this great new product with as many people as I can so that it can help them like it helps me with my health while still enjoying a healthy drink with great taste.

 

 

Let's Talk

 

If you have any questions about the campaign or teafee,  feel free to contact us.  We will be glad to respond.

teafeebrew@gmail.com

story:
Who am I?

My name is Kendall Gendron and I have had a passion for crafting coffee for 10 years. I grew up in the Puget Sound area in Washington State, so it's easy to understand where my love of espresso came from. I have worked the entire spectrum of the coffee delivery system. From slinging commuter grade drip from a double sided, faced paced drive through stand, to foaming hundred of lattes a day at our favorite commercial giant, and finally at high end boutique cafes where perfect latte art is cultivated and mandatory.

My goal is to bring the best of all worlds to my new home in rural Vermont. What Vermont lacks in convenience, they make up for with beautiful landscapes and tight knit supportive communities. I wish to provide a service to those who value comfort, quality and accessibility.  My campaign is integral to starting my business. The funds I am requesting would be the good faith gesture needed for local financial institutions to provide the rest of my start up capital. Without the up front funds raised, my mentors and myself believe it will be a longer arduous  journey to my grand opening.

With backing from my contributors I will be able to fast track my services to the community. I want to invest in an area that needs a pick me up. Vermont needs small businesses. I want to give back to my wonderful state while simultaneously providing a future for myself I can be proud of building. Owning and operating my truck will be the most challenging and fulfilling adventure. It it my life's ambition to merge my craft into a career, and enrich the lives of my neighbors while I do it.

 

Here's The Deal...

I am hoping and anticipating to raise $15,000 to start my endeavor. The entirely of those funds will be used to purchase the biggest and most important piece of equipment I require: The Truck. I am seeking a modest, preferably used food truck for my business. I anticipate retrofitting all additional equipment myself and do not need to purchase an expensive custom made vehicle. I want to start smart, which means starting small. I am thrifty by nature so I plan on purchasing the majority of my equipment used, which means you can trust me to make the economically sound decisions.

I will be eternally grateful to anyone who chooses  to help support me and my dream career. To show my gratitude for funds raised, I am outlining levels of investment as an incentive to invest in me.

Levels of Investment:

  • $10-$49 given will be a very appreciated donation, and I thank you dearly!
  • $50-$200 given will be considered a much appreciated donation and will receive a gift basket containing a pound of coffee beans and a VITTLES apron.
  • $201-$500 given will be considered a much appreciated donation with perks! If you donate to my start up I will provide you with a monthly package of a pound of coffee beans, and some VITTLES swag for 12 months. Additionally, if you live in the area of my truck you will be provided with a custom card entitling you to a free drink of your choice a week!
  • $501-$3000 will be considered the first level of investment. If you contribute within this bracket of funding I will consider you an investor in my business and I will payback the amount given over the course of 1 year with 8% interest in quarterly payments. As a small added bonus I will also send a monthly package of coffee beans and VITTLES swag.
  • $3001+ will be considered second level of investment. If you contribute more than this amount I will consider you a premier investor in my business and I will payback the amount given over the course of 2 years with 10% interest in quarterly payments. As a small added bonus I will also send a monthly package of coffee beans and VITTLES swag.

Any investor level contributor may request a copy of my business plan for further details about my journey into VITTLES.

Any contribution in ANY amount is appreciated more than you will ever imagine! I am so grateful for the opportunity to prove to my contributors that I will thrive with their help!

If my initial goal is not met I will use the funds to purchase the next largest piece of equipment needed to fulfill my business plan. Equipment includes, but is not limited to: 

  • Espresso machine
  • Coffee roaster
  • Refrigerators
  • Drip coffee machines
  • Blenders

 

Added Community Value

The impact of raising these funds is insurmountable to me personally, but I genuinely believe I can add tremendous value to my neighborhood. I am a firm believer in locally sourced goods, nutritious food, and artfully crafted, delicious coffee. My goal is to provide a convenient way for Vermonters to have access to quality fun and tasty fare.

I want to be a driving force to bring added community value to my rural neck of the woods. I've learned that Vermonters are passionate about supporting local business and artfully crafted food and drink. Gastropubs and specialty food goods starting up in Vermont are dominating our green mountain landscape. I believe I am on the heels of this is rustic culinary renaissance.

 

Risky?

 

I understand that investing in a new restaurant is one of the riskiest business decisions one can make. New restaurants often don't see their two year anniversary. This is usually due to inexperienced management making poor choices. Such as, constantly changing hours, exorbitant overhead costs, and not being able to adapt to their local market.

I have been in many management positions that have given me the necessary experience to confidently make the right choices for my business. However, my time as an hourly worker under poor management styles might be more valuable to me opening up my own business. watching failure in action is a tremendously helpful tool. I have seen countless mistakes that I now know how to effortlessly avoid. For Example:

  • I will listen to my customers input and find the balance between my values and their needs.
  • My hours posted are the hours being met.
  • The whole premise of my business is to keep my overhead low, so I can have quality products sold at a reasonable price.
  • My truck is mobile. I can travel to where the commuters are.
  • I have a mentor through VtSBDC that I have been using extensively for sound advice. I will continue to learn from business owners smarter than myself to make the right decisions and to ensure my success.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you aren't able to contribute financially, that's ok! I would be so grateful if you could forward my message and spread the enthusiasm on my behalf! Please consider posting this campaign to your social media platforms to help me meet my goal!

Please use the indiegogo share tools to spread the word!

Thank you so much for taking the time to read about my goals, and possibly helping me fulfill them!

To Good Food and Great Coffee!

Kendall Gendron
story_txt:
Who am I?
My name is Kendall Gendron and I have had a passion for crafting coffee for 10 years. I grew up in the Puget Sound area in Washington State, so it's easy to understand where my love of espresso came from. I have worked the entire spectrum of the coffee delivery system. From slinging commuter grade drip from a double sided, faced paced drive through stand, to foaming hundred of lattes a day at our favorite commercial giant, and finally at high end boutique cafes where perfect latte art is cultivated and mandatory.
My goal is to bring the best of all worlds to my new home in rural Vermont. What Vermont lacks in convenience, they make up for with beautiful landscapes and tight knit supportive communities. I wish to provide a service to those who value comfort, quality and accessibility.  My campaign is integral to starting my business. The funds I am requesting would be the good faith gesture needed for local financial institutions to provide the rest of my start up capital. Without the up front funds raised, my mentors and myself believe it will be a longer arduous  journey to my grand opening.
With backing from my contributors I will be able to fast track my services to the community. I want to invest in an area that needs a pick me up. Vermont needs small businesses. I want to give back to my wonderful state while simultaneously providing a future for myself I can be proud of building. Owning and operating my truck will be the most challenging and fulfilling adventure. It it my life's ambition to merge my craft into a career, and enrich the lives of my neighbors while I do it.
 

Here's The Deal...
I am hoping and anticipating to raise $15,000 to start my endeavor. The entirely of those funds will be used to purchase the biggest and most important piece of equipment I require: The Truck. I am seeking a modest, preferably used food truck for my business. I anticipate retrofitting all additional equipment myself and do not need to purchase an expensive custom made vehicle. I want to start smart, which means starting small. I am thrifty by nature so I plan on purchasing the majority of my equipment used, which means you can trust me to make the economically sound decisions.
I will be eternally grateful to anyone who chooses  to help support me and my dream career. To show my gratitude for funds raised, I am outlining levels of investment as an incentive to invest in me.
Levels of Investment:

$10-$49 given will be a very appreciated donation, and I thank you dearly!
$50-$200 given will be considered a much appreciated donation and will receive a gift basket containing a pound of coffee beans and a VITTLES apron.
$201-$500 given will be considered a much appreciated donation with perks! If you donate to my start up I will provide you with a monthly package of a pound of coffee beans, and some VITTLES swag for 12 months. Additionally, if you live in the area of my truck you will be provided with a custom card entitling you to a free drink of your choice a week!
$501-$3000 will be considered the first level of investment. If you contribute within this bracket of funding I will consider you an investor in my business and I will payback the amount given over the course of 1 year with 8% interest in quarterly payments. As a small added bonus I will also send a monthly package of coffee beans and VITTLES swag.
$3001+ will be considered second level of investment. If you contribute more than this amount I will consider you a premier investor in my business and I will payback the amount given over the course of 2 years with 10% interest in quarterly payments. As a small added bonus I will also send a monthly package of coffee beans and VITTLES swag.

Any investor level contributor may request a copy of my business plan for further details about my journey into VITTLES.
Any contribution in ANY amount is appreciated more than you will ever imagine! I am so grateful for the opportunity to prove to my contributors that I will thrive with their help!
If my initial goal is not met I will use the funds to purchase the next largest piece of equipment needed to fulfill my business plan. Equipment includes, but is not limited to: 

Espresso machine
Coffee roaster
Refrigerators
Drip coffee machines
Blenders

 

Added Community Value
The impact of raising these funds is insurmountable to me personally, but I genuinely believe I can add tremendous value to my neighborhood. I am a firm believer in locally sourced goods, nutritious food, and artfully crafted, delicious coffee. My goal is to provide a convenient way for Vermonters to have access to quality fun and tasty fare.
I want to be a driving force to bring added community value to my rural neck of the woods. I've learned that Vermonters are passionate about supporting local business and artfully crafted food and drink. Gastropubs and specialty food goods starting up in Vermont are dominating our green mountain landscape. I believe I am on the heels of this is rustic culinary renaissance.
 

Risky?
 
I understand that investing in a new restaurant is one of the riskiest business decisions one can make. New restaurants often don't see their two year anniversary. This is usually due to inexperienced management making poor choices. Such as, constantly changing hours, exorbitant overhead costs, and not being able to adapt to their local market.
I have been in many management positions that have given me the necessary experience to confidently make the right choices for my business. However, my time as an hourly worker under poor management styles might be more valuable to me opening up my own business. watching failure in action is a tremendously helpful tool. I have seen countless mistakes that I now know how to effortlessly avoid. For Example:

I will listen to my customers input and find the balance between my values and their needs.
My hours posted are the hours being met.
The whole premise of my business is to keep my overhead low, so I can have quality products sold at a reasonable price.
My truck is mobile. I can travel to where the commuters are.
I have a mentor through VtSBDC that I have been using extensively for sound advice. I will continue to learn from business owners smarter than myself to make the right decisions and to ensure my success.

 

Other Ways You Can Help
 
If you aren't able to contribute financially, that's ok! I would be so grateful if you could forward my message and spread the enthusiasm on my behalf! Please consider posting this campaign to your social media platforms to help me meet my goal!
Please use the indiegogo share tools to spread the word!
Thank you so much for taking the time to read about my goals, and possibly helping me fulfill them!
To Good Food and Great Coffee!
Kendall Gendron

story:
*** La version française est en bas ;) *** Avec encore plus de photos!

 

WE BELIEVE IN A BETTER WORLD, 
WE BELIEVE IN AWARENESS, 
WE BELIEVE IN CHANGE,
WE BELIEVE IN A WORLD WHERE THE CATERER INDUSTRY WILL NO LONGER POLLUTE LIKE TODAY

 

Our project: 

We work in an ecological way, with local and organic products. We take great care in choosing our suppliers, we meet them, we know their stories, we share our passion and our working methods. We share common values.

We are Hush-Hush, a catering service whose values are respectful of the environment.
An eco-catering service, organic and local, but not only. It is also a place where people can share, where workshops will be held regularly, for example: how to cook by reducing waste, or how to make laundry.

We believe we can help and inspire people to make our world greener. Besides, the restaurant and food service industries are highly polluting, and our goal is to change that.

 

Carrots ready to be roasted.

 

Who we are:

We are Benjamin & Julie, 2 frenchy with 3 passions : COOKING, SUSTAINABILITY & NEW YORK. We live in New York City with our son. 

 

Julie:

I studied law and business management with the idea of creating my own business one day. I used to organize birthday parties for family, and great meals for friends. When I was living in France before moving to NYC, I worked in nightclubs, bars, and restaurants. 

 

 

Benjamin:

While passionate about planes and boats, I left my job as a manager at Roissy Charles de Gaulle airport (Paris), to follow our dream of entrepreneurship. I studied in Britany to become a chef. 

 

Us: 

We met over 12 years ago, and after our son was born, we became much more aware and passionate about environmental issues. 

We love to come up with innovative recipes using the most environmentally friendly ingredients, and with minimal waste. Benjamin makes our own laundry detergent from scratch. She was a speaker at a green conference in NYC where she explained the first steps to a greener home. 

 

 

 

EVERY DOLLAR CAN HELP

 

HOW THE FUNDS WILL BE USED

To finance HUSH-HUSH, we need a total of $150,000. We set a goal of $25,000 so that with our own savings, we could own at least 50% of the company to make sure we could fulfill our core mission and be true to our original project. The remaining balance is to be added by one or more investors.

 

Breakdown of the $150,000 investment :

Security deposit: $60,000

Various equipment such as oven, baking supplies, cold storage: $40,000

Renovation of and construction in the facility: $30,000

Legal fees: $7,000

The remaining $13,000 will be used to cover the Indiegogo fees, and also to buy licenses, permits, and insurance, as well as small equipments such as eco-friendly utensils, plates, and glasses.

We’re hoping the funds we can raise exceed our $25,000 goal because the more we own the project, the truer it will be to what we have envisioned: local and/or organic food freshly served for all of your events, with a French touch and an environmental approach.

Our suppliers are chosen with care, like this one, upstate New York City. 

 

Please talk about and share our project and campaign on social media: this could make a big difference in helping us reach our goal The more exposure our project gets, the more likely it is to succeed!

Please, spread the word!! We are counting on you. THANK YOU!!!!

  

 

 

Challenges : 

The only challenges we could see from this project is getting serious demand, which would just mean we'd need some extra time to make and ship for backers of this Indiegogo campaign.

_______

 

Homeless eat crepes for Thanksgiving. 

 

 

***Version Française ***

 

Qui sommes-nous ?

Nous sommes Benjamin et Julie, deux français avec deux passions: la CUISINE et L’ECOLOGIE. Nous vivons à New York avec notre fils.

 

Julie:

J'ai étudié le droit et le management d'entreprise dans l'idée de créer un jour ma propre entreprise. Passionnée par la gastronomie, j'avais l'habitude d'organiser des fêtes, des anniversaires pour ma famille et des bons repas pour mes amis. Avant de venir à New York, alors que je vivais encore en France, j’ai travaillé dans des discothèques, des bars et des restaurants.

 

Benjamin:

Passionné d'avions et de bateaux, j'ai quitté mon poste de responsable à l'aéroport de Roissy Charles de Gaulle (Paris) pour poursuivre notre rêve d'entreprendre. J'ai étudié en Bretagne pour devenir chef.

 

Nous:

Nous nous sommes rencontrés il y a plus de 12 ans et, après la naissance de notre fils, nous sommes devenus encore plus conscients et passionnés par les questions environnementales.

Nous proposons des recettes innovantes en utilisant des ingrédients respectueux de l'environnement et avec un minimum de déchets. Benjamin fabrique notre propre détergent à lessive.  Elle a été invité à partager son parcours écologique lors d'une conférence à New York, où elle a expliqué son cheminement vers un mode de vie plus responsable et les clés pour se lancer.

Nous pensons pouvoir aider et inspirer les gens à rendre notre monde plus respectueux de la nature. De plus, les industries de la restauration et des services alimentaires sont très polluants et notre objectif est de changer cela.

 

 

Notre projet:

Nous croyons en un monde meilleur, nous croyons aux prises de conscience, nous croyons au changement. Nous croyons à un monde ou la restauration ne polluera plus comme aujourd’hui.

Nous travaillons de manière écologique, avec des produits locaux et biologiques. Nous prenons un grand soin dans le choix de nos fournisseurs, nous les rencontrons, nous connaissons leurs histoires, nous échangeons sur notre passion et sur nos méthodes de travail. Nous partageons des valeurs communes.

Nous sommes un service traiteur dont les valeurs sont respectueuses de l’environnement.
Un service traiteur écolo, bio et local, mais pas que. C’est aussi un lieu d'échange où se tiendront régulièrement des ateliers comme par exemple; comment cuisiner en réduisant ses déchets, ou comment fabriquer sa lessive
.

Un service de restauration, oui, mais plus encore, une COMMUNAUTÉ.

Sucettes de fromage de chèvre au paprika , au romarin et au graines de sésames, prête à être emportées.

 

Pourquoi avoir appeler notre service traiteur ainsi? Parce que nos clients nous demandent de la confidentialité pour leur événement. Et par la suite nous aimerions créer des événements encore plus secrets ;) Mais on vous en dira plus une prochaine fois... 


 

CHAQUE EUROS PEUT AIDER

 

COMMENT LES FONDS SERONT UTILISÉS ?

Pour financer HUSH-HUSH, il nous faut 150 000 dollars au total. Nous avons fixé un objectif de   25 000 dollars, ce qui nous permettrait de détenir au moins 50% de la société avec nos propres économies, afin de pouvoir remplir notre mission principale et d’être fidèle à notre projet initial. Le solde restant est ajouté par un investisseur.


 

 

 

 

 

 

 

     

Répartition de l'investissement de $150 000  :

  • Dépôt de garantie: $60 000 
  • Divers équipements tels qu'un camion, un four, des fournitures, une chambre froide :            $40 000 
  • Rénovation et travaux: $30 000 
  • Frais juridiques: $7 000 
  • Les $13 000  restants serviront à couvrir les honoraires de Indiegogo, ainsi qu’à acheter des licences, des permis et des assurances, ainsi que de petits équipements tels que des ustensiles, des assiettes et des verres...

Nous espérons que les fonds que nous aurons récolté dépasseront notre objectif de               $25 000  car plus nous aurons, plus Hush Hush sera fidèle à ce que nous avons imaginé: des aliments locaux et / ou biologiques fraîchement servis pour tous vos événements, avec une touche française et une approche environnementale.

 

PARLEZ de Nous et de notre campagne sur les réseaux sociaux, PARTAGEZ : cela pourrait énormément nous aider à atteindre notre objectif. Plus notre projet sera exposé, plus il aura de chances de réussir!

 

S'il vous plaît, passez le mot !! Nous comptons sur vous. NOUS VOUS REMERCIONS!!!

Jeunes pousses de tournesols qui nous viennent tout droit d'un fournisseur local, nous les avons reçus pour les goûter. Elles étaient délicieuses!

story:
You probably think of freeze dried food as the stuff that the astronauts and soldiers eat but it is a really great way to preserve many kinds of foods. We found out how amazing it was when we bought our first freeze dryer and it quickly turned into a passion we had to share with the world!

What makes freeze drying so good?

 

   Retains most of the nutrients compared to jarred and pouch foods.

     Super lightweight and easy to take.                                                

     Easy to reconstitute and have fresh fruit or veggie puree! Just add liquid!

 

Freeze drying causes relatively no damage to the nutrition of the food being preserved. Other baby foods that are canned use higher temperatures that can destroy more than half (50%) the food value. Freeze drying first takes the foods to very low temperatures then uses vacuum pressure and gradually warms and evaporates water out of the products. This keeps the closest to fresh flavor and nutrients!

With our freeze-dried baby and everyone food all you have to do is add water, formula, breast milk or other liquid to quickly rehydrate the food. The packets have a long shelf life and don’t need to be refrigerated which make them perfect for on the go parents. We do not add any fillers or additives to our freeze dried food so our product is also awesome to add to smoothies, soups, dips and more! This is not just organic baby food its for everyone! It is a super easy way to sneak in extra fruit and veggies for picky toddlers (or adults)! Be sure to watch our blog and social media for recipes.

Our foods are single ingredients to make introducing solids easy for babies. Many other foods are mixed flavors which makes it difficult to make sure little ones get used to foods one by one. One ingredient foods let your child learn to like veggies without being hidden in other foods. They also help parents filter out any foods your child may be allergic to. In addition, have you ever noticed how many foods have banana/ apple or other fruits mixed in with the veggies? We are working on more vegetable flavors for that reason. Get your littles started on the right track and open them up to savory flavors too!

The vegetables are what we really want to focus on but they are harder to source. By backing our campaign you can help us research and develop more savory flavors!

 

With our products, we aim to help change the way people think about baby food. Babies should eat the same food we do... real foods that don't contain additives or fillers and aren't cooked till they lose valuable nutrients.  We aim also to become a Certified B Corp. We want to give back as much as we can and help others! We hope this product can help solve the problem of wanting to make homemade foods for your babies but not having the time. We also hope that you enjoy these yourself for adding extra nutrients to recipes or for quick and easy smoothies, flavorings and more!

 

We have already hit some challenges and that is why we need your help! Our Avocado and Coconut Mango Banana needs to be packed more often than the other flavors because it doesn't last as long due to its healthy fat content. We already identified this challenge so this part of the process should go well but there could be issues such as below if any of these things happen we will let you know ASAP and keep you updated about your perks.

   Time waiting for USDA certifications

     Time waiting to get on the schedule with our co-packer since we are smaller than most  of their other clients.                                               

     

 

Just want to help without the perks?

We know not everyone can help monetarily.... Here are some other ways you can help:

   Time waiting for USDA certifications
     Time waiting to get on the schedule with our co-packer since we are smaller than most  of their other clients.                                               
     

 



Just want to help without the perks?

We know not everyone can help monetarily.... Here are some other ways you can help:

story:
Here's where it began...the Goodness story!

Hi, my name is Doyin and I was born and raised in South East London, UK! I've always had a knack for creating things that bring wholesomeness to those on the receiving end! Goodness M*lk does exactly that - my new plant-based m*lk range is hand-made with care using all natural ingredients found in your kitchen - so no surprises!

Founded in London from my desire to make my family and friends feel good during the height of the pandemic lockdown just a few months ago, I decided to get the blender out and make some plant-based m*lk beverages. Seeing the positive reaction of the rich flavour, velvety taste and versatility of the m*lk from my family and friends I decided it was time to spread some more Goodness! Goodness M*lk was born the next day, early July 2020 that is! I've been working tirelessly on my new line of plant-based milk, to ensure that my hand-made speciality oat, almond and coconut m*lk is delivered in a safe manner to customers across London, UK.

My goal is to be a positive force in food and drink industry and serve Goodness for All! ...because yes, health and good food choices should not be accessed by a small few...but to all!

 

 

What’s Goodness M*lk all about?

Goodness M*lk is the first range of products under my new Brand, Goodness the Brand Ltd, a brand empowering individuals to find whatever it is that brings 'goodness' to their world. Just as I began my m*lk making journey a few months ago I want us all to use Goodness M*lk as a source of inspiration and newness. Whether that’s by using this new M*lk to make a new morning smoothie or you use it to discover a new baking recipe or even to discover what it is that makes you feel good, I want you to find your thing!

Goodness M*lk is certified organic*, dairy-free and if you have a bit of the sweet tooth (just like me) our sweetened range comes naturally sweetened with dates!

 

 

Goodness M*lk is placed in glass milk bottles for extra nostalgia freshness and delivered straight to your door on the day of production! 

Goodness M*lk is for those that are lactose intolerant, meat eaters, vegans, vegetarians, plant-basers and everyone in between - it's Goodness for all! All our m*lk beverages are hand-made in my kitchen using only the good stuff (all ingredients below)! I pride myself in making great tasting nourishing m*lk! After a decade of consuming m*lk alternative drinks it's safe to say i've finessed all the goodness from over the years and brought it over to Goodness M*lk!

 

Our m*lk bottles are all 100% recyclable and reusable!

Return 9 bottles and you'll get your 10th bottle on us (yes for free)! Our delivery team will take your bottles on delivery so it's a hassle-free transaction bringing back the old school m*lk wo(man), Goodness style!

 

The design is ready! I just need your help for our 100% sustainable packaging and the printing production

 

 

 

 

 

Here's the all natural ingredients:

Oat M*lk: organic oats, filtered water, pinch of sea salt, cashews (allergic to cashews? No worries - you can order the cashew-free option)

Almond M*lk: organic almonds, filtered water, pinch of sea salt

Coconut M*lk: coconuts, filtered water, pinch of sea salt

Our 3 m*lks are available unsweetened and sweetened (we use dates as a natural sweetener!)

 

Goodness M*lk, delivered straight to your door - from my kitchen to your door. Here’s how it'll work: 

 

 

Two delivery methods - bike & car delivery

 

 

 

The Goodness difference - why Goodness M*lk?

 

 

 

So why crowdfunding?

Crowdfunding involves community. With your community support you'll be part of the Goodness journey from the start! This product range will be an incredible addition to our community and this approach to serve you with your support makes all the difference. Your support will help launch one of the first black owned plant-based m*lk products in the UK! This project embodies community and sharing wholesomeness together so I'm really excited to share this journey with you from the get-go!

 

Why I need your support

I’m seeking to raise £5,600 which will spread across parts of the printing and 100% recyclable packaging costs.

100% recyclable glass bottles

100% recyclable biodegradable packaging

This is an exciting journey as a very early start up and by purchasing one of our perks you support our mission to encourage Goodness in the way we eat, drink and build community! As an entrepreneur with a great vision yet minimal resources, your contribution will help me with the production and packaging to offer these new hand-made m*lk products to you...and you!

I am extremely conscious of our carbon footprint as a community and will work as effective as possible to minimise this during production, shipping and delivery process.

The design is ready. The COVID-19 pandemic stalled my plans a little, so now I need a little help to get this project over the line.

Stretch goal - £10,000! If I reach my stretch goal I will be able to purchase 3 exceptionally powerful catering blenders (Santos Kitchen Blender 37A 4Ltr Stainless Steel, £1,149.99) that will allow me to make more Goodness M*lk efficiently, which means we will get Goodness M*lk delivered to you much quicker! The remaining funds will go towards purchasing the Goodness delivery van, we aim to have her by Summer 2021!

 

The perks - how it works

The delivery of your hand-made Goodness M*lk (along with your tote bag and loyalty card rewards) will be arranged a week prior to public launch, i'll reach out to you to select your preferred delivery slot. Standalone tote bag and loyalty card rewards will be shipped in the post a week prior to public launch too!

I'll do my very best despite Covid-19 unknowns to get your rewards to you prior to public launch. Any delays will be updated promptly.

 

 

The Goodness Plan - timeline

23 Sept: Campaign launches on Indiegogo

10 Nov: Printing, packaging and production

24 Nov: M*lk production, deliveries + reward shipping begins

08 Dec: Public launch of Goodness M*lk

 

Risks & Challenges

I truly love that I get to create a brand new fun and exciting plant-based m*lk line and as with any big idea, once executed the doubts flow through! Turning to crowdfunding to launch a plant-based m*lk range is rare in London, so there are some risks there including the great amount of unknown challenges especially during these unprecedented times of the Covid-19 pandemic. The main risk when we get funded is the delay in early production and deliverables due to last minute challenges exacerbated by Covid-19 restrictions and other unforeseen circumstances. But I have no doubt we will succeed in the end, because where there is community there is power to move faster together! I will update my backers on a regular basis and communicate any delays promptly.

If I don’t meet my funding target, I will produce a smaller batch of Goodness M*lk then once I have secured alternative funding I will seek to serve the wider community. I believe that this brand has an exciting journey ahead and with your support we will get there! Thank you for your support!

 

Other ways you can help - spread the word!

The more people we can all get behind this the more chance I'll reach the target, so please help me spread the word by sharing my Indiegogo campaign using the Indiegogo share tools and lets get Goodness M*lk launched! Thank you, your support is much appreciated, most especially during this time!

www.instagram.com/goodnessmilk

www.twitter.com/goodnessmilk

www.facebook.com/goodnessthebrand

story:
NOW SHIPPING! 

  

 

“eto decanter reaches Kickstarter target in 32 hours” - Decanter magazine

“eto: Stylish, Eco-Friendly Decanter - Sign. us. up.” - Huffington Post

"hallmarks of a considered product from a designer with years of experience" - Mold

“The clever gadget set to change the way we drink wine” - Stylist

"We definitely need one of these" - Harpers Bazaar

"we’re adding eto to our wishlists" - Luxury London

"attractively sleek and satisfyingly heavy... there’s no doubt it does an excellent job" - World Travel Guide

"complete with a stunningly modern aesthetic" - Gadget Flow

 "you’ll be more than proud to show off!" - Yanko Design

“the best of both worlds: ... both affordable and effective” - JancisRobinson.com

Find out more:    Facebook   |  Twitter  |   Instagram

 
 

Want to help us?   Share on Facebook   |    Share on Twitter

 

eto is a beautifully designed wine decanter that gives you the freedom to enjoy wine at your own pace, and never waste a drop again. Its innovative, patented preservation system uses an airtight seal to keep wine perfectly fresh for at least 7 days, as proven by blind taste tests carried out with 'Master of Wine' Richard Hemming, and independent laboratory testing at Bangor University.

 

eto is easy to use - its unique design ensures every step is quick, clean and complements the traditional ritual of enjoying wine.

  

Due to its patented preservation system that creates an airtight seal over the wine, eto halts the oxidation process, which in turn preserves the wine’s freshness and taste. 

As we become more health-consciousness, more and more of us are choosing to enjoy just a glass or two rather than several – or even save our wine drinking for the weekend. eto gives us this freedom. 

With eto you can open and savour that treasured bottle over a longer period. 

The long funnel gently oxygenates the wine to release its flavours and the sharp lip ensures drip-free pouring. 

  

  

 

eto’s ability to prevent wine oxidation has been proven by independent tests carried out at Bangor University. The graph shows just how effective eto is compared to other wine preservation products. 

 

 

eto underwent rigorous testing and re-testing over a 12 month period with a variety of red and white wines. The results were indisputable - eto far out-performed competitor products in every tightly-monitored test.  

 

While science proved eto prevented oxidation, blind taste tests with wine experts showed that eto protected the quality of the wine too.  

 

 

'Master of Wine' Richard Hemming – and writer at JancisRobinson.com – took part in two separate blind taste tests, comparing freshly opened wine with its eto 7 day preserved equivalent.  “On the seventh day ... for me, the results were unanimous: there was no perceptible difference between a freshly opened bottle and the eto-stored sample” Read the full article HERE.

 

 

After taking part in a similar blind taste test, Wine Director at Honest Grapes, Tom Harrow, commented “A wine which had been decanted (into eto) seven days beforehand tasted every bit as fresh as a wine which had come from a recently opened bottle. But it also had the added benefits of decanting, in that the wine was breathing ... it was opening up ... it tasted absolutely delicious.” 

 

 

I am Tom Cotton, an award-winning industrial designer with nearly 20 years experience of bringing products from concept to market. I am passionate about protecting the environment, and in 2011 became interested in designing a product that helped to reduce wine wastage.

Wine wastage is a huge environmental problem across the world. In the UK alone, 50 million litres of wine are poured down the sink every year - see WRAP report EVA063. A recent study by Laithwaite’s Wine put the figure down as enough to fill 333 Olympic-sized swimming pools, and also these disturbing statistics: 

 

 

Our inability to preserve wine once the cork has been popped is a major cause of this wine waste. And I quickly discovered that the wine preservation products on the market were either ineffective or hugely expensive. 

My inspiration for eto came after a friend highlighted the method - common amongst wine experts - of transferring leftover wine into a smaller container to minimise the air contact. After experimenting, I found the method of reducing air exposure very effective. I just needed to work on the container… 

 

  

  

After months of exploration I filed a patent for an innovative design in September 2012. At the core of the invention was a new unique valve concept that sealed wine at exactly the right moment, no matter how much wine was left. 

The ‘design for manufacture’ stage brought significant challenges. Not only did the valve require costly ‘proof of concept’ prototyping, experts in the glass industry said the precision required for glass simply couldn’t be achieved within the cost.  

After a highly rigorous and competitive process, I was awarded an Innovate UK government grant to develop eto further. This support proved invaluable, allowing me to build over 60 functioning prototypes, develop a detailed manufacture design and test eto’s effectiveness in the laboratory. 

  

Five years on, we have a product that really works. eto looks beautiful, preserves wine brilliantly and is exceptionally easy to use, store and maintain.  

We have built a strong relationship with our chosen manufacturing partner, and use only the highest quality materials to ensure eto is effective, elegant and durable in the long term. 

All materials are food approved and fully compliant with the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and the German BfR, ensuring they have no effect on the wine’s flavour. All materials are also BPA free. 

  • The glass used in eto is high precision ‘toughened’ borosilicate glass that’s optically clear & ‘seam free’ to optimise the wine colour. The glass has increased heat & shatter resistance, and won't stain or absorb any odours.
  • High grade Stainless steel with anti-corrosion properties and antimicrobial finish.
  • PVD coating creates a tough finish that is approximately ten times harder than stainless steel itself.

eto dissembles into four main parts and these can be individually replaced if damaged. (Although we do not foresee any reason to replace parts due to natural wear & tear.)

As glass specification was one of our major challenges, we undertook extensive research before selecting a glass manufacturer who we were confident could achieve the consistent glass tolerance required for eto without spiralling costs. High standards in worker treatment and environmental impact were also essential.  

We have worked closely with our manufacturing and assembly partner for over two years. They have over 30 years of experience bringing premium houseware products to market, and their skilled quality control team inspect each product before shipping.

eto has taken several years to perfect, as we have built multiple prototypes to improve and simplify its design. We now have a product with minimal parts, precision-engineered seam-free glass, and high grade, anti-corrosion stainless steel that is both durable and aesthetic.

 

 

Back eto and become part of our story. Once the campaign is over, we will be in touch to collect your shipping address details. We will then keep you updated throughout the process, and you will become one of the first people to enjoy using eto. 

 

eto is a unique and innovative product, and would make a great gift for any wine drinker. If you would like to buy eto for someone special, simply download the ‘gift card’ (from the link below) which can be printed, or sent electronically. 

 

 

 CLICK FOR GIFT CARD

 

eto is easy to clean – simply rinse with hot water straight after use and avoid using detergents. Please note, the metal parts of eto are not dishwasher safe. 

To make eto viable, we've already raised £55,000 for our tooling. This diagram shows you how your money will be allocated. Additional funds will be used to increase production. 

  

eto's creator Tom Cotton is an award winning industrial designer with nearly 20 years experience creating 3D product & packaging designs for some of the world’s leading brands. He has a passion for delivering fresh, breakthrough designs that reflect a high-level of consumer and market understanding, and has a strength for balancing design and technology constraints, often working through tough issues until they are resolved.   

Tom is cited as ‘inventor’ on over 18 international patents for consumer products, and has been extensively involved in the development and commercialisation of IP. His enthusiasm for innovation and problem solving is balanced by a detailed understanding of manufacturing, materials, IP & business realities. He’s created structural pack forms and product designs for clients including Gillette, Diageo, Procter & Gamble, Absolute vodka, Bacardi and Nestle.

I am a London based Welshman and, like many of my countrymen, proud of my roots. The word eto means ‘again’ in Welsh, which perfectly sums up the joy of the product. eto allows you to enjoy wine again, and again – without sacrificing either its taste or our planet.

Indiegogo is a proven start-up platform with a community of ‘early adopters’ who help vet, fund and refine new products. For innovative entrepreneurs who want to realise their vision, the pioneering Indiegogo community offers the most supportive platform. We highly value the Indiegogo community and its role in supporting innovation and hope that together we can launch eto. We’re not on Indiegogo to make a big margin; we’re here to build a community of early adopters who can also help us decide what eto will do next.  

Join us in bringing this collaboration to life – we can't do it without you!

  

We couldn’t have created eto without the help and support of friends and family, all of whom who have encouraged us to launch our new product through Crowdfunding. In particular, a big thanks to Shish Patel, Steve Challouma, Ellie MacLeod, Mike Webster, Sarah Clarke-Wareham, Paula Zuccotti, Ed Adamson, Olly Chambers, Mark Armstrong, Ian Webb, Felix Scarlett, Tom Herman, Jon Sleeman, Gareth Thomas, Mark Shickle, Raj Sood, Ben Scales, Henry & Kath Rowe, Rae Stewart, Sine Sorensen, Paul Wilford, Aaron Probyn, Hannah Thomas and Katy Gandon for marketing guidance, and Siwan Jones and Andrei Saltykov from Lacey Saltykov for letting us use their amazing house for the photo-shoot. And finally, a special thanks goes to Adrian Barton for highlighted the method - common amongst wine experts - of transferring leftover wine into a smaller containers.

  

As shipping, handling and other local charges (excluding customs fees) vary from country to country, please select your reward tier to see more information about the shipping details relevant to you. Please be aware that we cannot mark any shipments as gifts due to legality issues.  Customs & Duties - import duties and taxes are not included in our reward levels. These charges vary by country and are completely out of our control, but please be aware that you will be responsible for any charges or taxes that apply to your country.

We can ship to most countries in the world. We are working with a fulfilment company to make shipping as simple as possible. Shipments that could not be delivered due to an inaccurately provided address (including failure to update an old address) will incur additional costs to be reshipped.

Due to the size of your rewards, we cannot ship to PO Boxes.  

Estimated Delivery: Once production is complete on all orders, we will provide updates for shipping dates. International shipping can be subject to unexpected delays that are outside of our control. However, we will do our utmost to ship within the predicted time frame.  

We will be sharing steps of our production journey on social media so follow us to keep up to date with our news. And thank you so much for helping our family start-up bring this beautiful innovation in wine preservation to market. We can't wait to get your new eto to you.  

 

If you like the look of eto, but aren’t quite ready to pledge, you can help us make eto a success by sharing our posts on social media, giving us your feedback and telling your friends and family about eto and our Indiegogo campaign.  

  

 

  

 

  

 

 

When wine is continually exposed to air, the oxygen reacts with certain phenolic compounds in the wine and causes their oxidation, which results in:  

  • Loss of fruit characters
  • Reduced Aroma
  • Increase in bitterness as a result of the development of acetaldehyde
  • Unwanted bacteria and yeast such as Acetobacter aceti, Lactic acid bacteria, and Brettanomyces starting to thrive. 
  • Lower antioxidants - such as quercetin and resveratrol. Research has shown this plays a part in helping to prevent heart disease and cancer

My inspiration for eto came after a friend highlighted the method - common amongst wine experts - of transferring leftover wine into a smaller container to minimise the air contact. After experimenting, I found the method of reducing air exposure very effective. I just needed to work on the container… 
 

  

  

After months of exploration I filed a patent for an innovative design in September 2012. At the core of the invention was a new unique valve concept that sealed wine at exactly the right moment, no matter how much wine was left. 

The ‘design for manufacture’ stage brought significant challenges. Not only did the valve require costly ‘proof of concept’ prototyping, experts in the glass industry said the precision required for glass simply couldn’t be achieved within the cost.  

After a highly rigorous and competitive process, I was awarded an Innovate UK government grant to develop eto further. This support proved invaluable, allowing me to build over 60 functioning prototypes, develop a detailed manufacture design and test eto’s effectiveness in the laboratory. 

  

Five years on, we have a product that really works. eto looks beautiful, preserves wine brilliantly and is exceptionally easy to use, store and maintain.  

We have built a strong relationship with our chosen manufacturing partner, and use only the highest quality materials to ensure eto is effective, elegant and durable in the long term. 

All materials are food approved and fully compliant with the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and the German BfR, ensuring they have no effect on the wine’s flavour. All materials are also BPA free. 

The glass used in eto is high precision ‘toughened’ borosilicate glass that’s optically clear & ‘seam free’ to optimise the wine colour. The glass has increased heat & shatter resistance, and won't stain or absorb any odours.
High grade Stainless steel with anti-corrosion properties and antimicrobial finish.
PVD coating creates a tough finish that is approximately ten times harder than stainless steel itself.

eto dissembles into four main parts and these can be individually replaced if damaged. (Although we do not foresee any reason to replace parts due to natural wear & tear.)

As glass specification was one of our major challenges, we undertook extensive research before selecting a glass manufacturer who we were confident could achieve the consistent glass tolerance required for eto without spiralling costs. High standards in worker treatment and environmental impact were also essential.  
We have worked closely with our manufacturing and assembly partner for over two years. They have over 30 years of experience bringing premium houseware products to market, and their skilled quality control team inspect each product before shipping.
eto has taken several years to perfect, as we have built multiple prototypes to improve and simplify its design. We now have a product with minimal parts, precision-engineered seam-free glass, and high grade, anti-corrosion stainless steel that is both durable and aesthetic.
 

 
 
Back eto and become part of our story. Once the campaign is over, we will be in touch to collect your shipping address details. We will then keep you updated throughout the process, and you will become one of the first people to enjoy using eto. 
 

eto is a unique and innovative product, and would make a great gift for any wine drinker. If you would like to buy eto for someone special, simply download the ‘gift card’ (from the link below) which can be printed, or sent electronically. 
 
 
 
 CLICK FOR GIFT CARD

 

eto is easy to clean – simply rinse with hot water straight after use and avoid using detergents. Please note, the metal parts of eto are not dishwasher safe. 

To make eto viable, we've already raised £55,000 for our tooling. This diagram shows you how your money will be allocated. Additional funds will be used to increase production. 
 
  

eto's creator Tom Cotton is an award winning industrial designer with nearly 20 years experience creating 3D product & packaging designs for some of the world’s leading brands. He has a passion for delivering fresh, breakthrough designs that reflect a high-level of consumer and market understanding, and has a strength for balancing design and technology constraints, often working through tough issues until they are resolved.   

Tom is cited as ‘inventor’ on over 18 international patents for consumer products, and has been extensively involved in the development and commercialisation of IP. His enthusiasm for innovation and problem solving is balanced by a detailed understanding of manufacturing, materials, IP & business realities. He’s created structural pack forms and product designs for clients including Gillette, Diageo, Procter & Gamble, Absolute vodka, Bacardi and Nestle.
 

I am a London based Welshman and, like many of my countrymen, proud of my roots. The word eto means ‘again’ in Welsh, which perfectly sums up the joy of the product. eto allows you to enjoy wine again, and again – without sacrificing either its taste or our planet.

Indiegogo is a proven start-up platform with a community of ‘early adopters’ who help vet, fund and refine new products. For innovative entrepreneurs who want to realise their vision, the pioneering Indiegogo community offers the most supportive platform. We highly value the Indiegogo community and its role in supporting innovation and hope that together we can launch eto. We’re not on Indiegogo to make a big margin; we’re here to build a community of early adopters who can also help us decide what eto will do next.  
Join us in bringing this collaboration to life – we can't do it without you!

  

We couldn’t have created eto without the help and support of friends and family, all of whom who have encouraged us to launch our new product through Crowdfunding. In particular, a big thanks to Shish Patel, Steve Challouma, Ellie MacLeod, Mike Webster, Sarah Clarke-Wareham, Paula Zuccotti, Ed Adamson, Olly Chambers, Mark Armstrong, Ian Webb, Felix Scarlett, Tom Herman, Jon Sleeman, Gareth Thomas, Mark Shickle, Raj Sood, Ben Scales, Henry & Kath Rowe, Rae Stewart, Sine Sorensen, Paul Wilford, Aaron Probyn, Hannah Thomas and Katy Gandon for marketing guidance, and Siwan Jones and Andrei Saltykov from Lacey Saltykov for letting us use their amazing house for the photo-shoot. And finally, a special thanks goes to Adrian Barton for highlighted the method - common amongst wine experts - of transferring leftover wine into a smaller containers.

  

As shipping, handling and other local charges (excluding customs fees) vary from country to country, please select your reward tier to see more information about the shipping details relevant to you. Please be aware that we cannot mark any shipments as gifts due to legality issues.  Customs & Duties - import duties and taxes are not included in our reward levels. These charges vary by country and are completely out of our control, but please be aware that you will be responsible for any charges or taxes that apply to your country.
We can ship to most countries in the world. We are working with a fulfilment company to make shipping as simple as possible. Shipments that could not be delivered due to an inaccurately provided address (including failure to update an old address) will incur additional costs to be reshipped.
Due to the size of your rewards, we cannot ship to PO Boxes.  
Estimated Delivery: Once production is complete on all orders, we will provide updates for shipping dates. International shipping can be subject to unexpected delays that are outside of our control. However, we will do our utmost to ship within the predicted time frame.  

We will be sharing steps of our production journey on social media so follow us to keep up to date with our news. And thank you so much for helping our family start-up bring this beautiful innovation in wine preservation to market. We can't wait to get your new eto to you.  
 

If you like the look of eto, but aren’t quite ready to pledge, you can help us make eto a success by sharing our posts on social media, giving us your feedback and telling your friends and family about eto and our Indiegogo campaign.  
 
  
 
 
  
 
 
  
 
 

When wine is continually exposed to air, the oxygen reacts with certain phenolic compounds in the wine and causes their oxidation, which results in:  

Loss of fruit characters
Reduced Aroma
Increase in bitterness as a result of the development of acetaldehyde
Unwanted bacteria and yeast such as Acetobacter aceti, Lactic acid bacteria, and Brettanomyces starting to thrive. 
Lower antioxidants - such as quercetin and resveratrol. Research has shown this plays a part in helping to prevent heart disease and cancer

story:
Hi World!  We are ShoShoRai Cookie Factory & Small Business.  Our tiny business started in our kitchen and now we are looking to Expand!


What's a ShoShoRai Cookie?

A ShoShoRai Cookie is a Delicious Luxury Cookie that is made of 100% Japanese Green Tea.  It is a very Thin, Crunchy, and Crispy Cookie.   It consists of a special 2nd Layer made of our custom mint cream.  The cookie is a Gluten-Free product and a Great source of Antioxidants.

Currently our tiny business needs more packaging, equipment, and supplies to bring you our Delicious Luxury Cookies! 

We are very excited to share our treat with many people.  We want to spread the joy of our special treat because thats what we do.  That is what is important to us, bringing happiness into the world through cookies.  ShoShoRai Cookies.

What's the Funding For?

Supporters!  You can help by taking us to the next level!  With your Support
we can buy:

- much needed Packaging.  Our boxes need special diecasts for cutting our custom  packaging.

- improved custom bake pans to speed up production of our cookies.

- extra Ovens to increase our baking capacity.

- high quality ingredients.

- other misc. kitchen equipment.

- employee salary and operating costs.

- larger kitchen rental space.

Because our pans are custom made they are very expensive.  Each pan is made up of two parts with custom components.   The amount of money we raise will determine how far we can Expand our business.  If we raise enough we may also be able to increase the number of our working staff so that we can offer more diverse
cookie types.


So Far We Have Completed:

  • A Concise and Finished  Custom Recipe.

  • The Finished Packaging for our Cookies.
    (Part of our Package is Pat. Pending) 

  • Sourced our Ingredients from suppliers that already
    have products in the market.

  • Our website layout design.

Other Ways You Can Help

 - Please share our Campaign with those who you think may be
interested in our Delicious Luxury Cookies.

- Please connect and Introduce us to more people who have
passion for great tea and cookies.

We very much appreciate all of your support in any form.


Thank you So Much for Visiting our Campaign!

story:
My name is David Zinke, hence "Zink's Treats" 

I launched Zink's Treats in 2009 with six flavors.  I now have 24 flavors and eight consecutive "Public's Choice" awards and two "Celebrity Judges" awards for excellence.  

  • Over the counter gift boxes serve me well in my local market but present an obstacle to shipping.  Fudge is fragile. Experience proves mine requires custom packaging to ship safely.
  • With a successful Indegogo campaign, I'll be able to expand my web presence to increase my on line sales because with customised gift boxes, I'll have confidence my products will reach my customers intact and as intended.

 

Manufacture and shipment of 1000 gift boxes

Breaking it down for you:

  • The manufacturer requires a minimum order of 500 units for each size box.  I sell 6 and 12 piece gift boxes. That's a thousand boxes cut out, assembeled and shipped to me. I have the prototypes for each size and they are almost perfect.  The finished boxes will have the lids wrapped in textured brown craft paper, the compartmented base remains white.  I will also have the company print a 1000 new professional logo stickers to dress up the gift boxes.  

My perks/fudges are delicious.  With ten awards in eight years of operations and a growing local clientele, I can assure you, you will love my fudge.  The perks will all ship for pre Christmas arrival at your door.

  • Reaching the goal of $2500 by the end of October will assure delivery of all perks before Christmas.  Falling short of the goal is possible but I might  have to ship perks without the new boxes. 

The Impact of this campaign on my business... 

  • I'm not going to claim that my fudge will save the world, make you more attractive or solve your personal problems.  This is not by any stretch, a health snack.  I've been called the "Spawn of Satan" for promoting the consumption of sugar.  But I can state with confidence that you have never tasted better fudge than mine.  Countless blind taste testers encouraged me by saying, "This ain't yer grannies fudge!" and "This is so good, you could sell it!"
  • This is my first crowd funding attempt and I hope your sweet tooth will loosen your pocketbook a little.

Seriously, my inability to afford custom packaging to date has held me back in promoting on line sales.  The confidence I'll get from having professional gift boxes will boost my on line presence exponentially. Look out Godiva.  he he he

There have been many obstacles in the past eight years that threatened to shut me down.  Car accident, loss of kitchen access, county , state, and local regulations, getting stiffed on a big order.  Nothing can stop me.  I'm a Virgo.   

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand, There are so many wonderful and deserving projects on this site, I can't support them all either. Some people just can't make a cash contributtion, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Pass this information on to all your friends, family, congregations, fraternities, sororities, FaceBook followers, Twitterers, Snapchatters, and so on.  Help me genreate a buzz about my divine fudge and the delicious perks available.  
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • I will be forever in your debt for helping me anyway you can.  
  • Thank You so much  

And that's all there is to it.
