story:
Be A Part of Austin's Food History:  Preserve the Ruby's Original BBQ Pit!

Hello Dear Friend! My name is Chef Demmerick Johnson, and I am the owner of Ladybird's Austin Kitchen.  I have personally worked in most of the top kitchens in Austin.  I've been cooking for over 30 years, with most of that time here in my beloved Austin. Over those years, I've had successful careers in sales, marketing, and insurance. Somehow, I've always found myself back "On the Line!" I came here to Austin in 1990 to study economics, not knowing I would fall in love with creating great food! Weeks before Ruby's was to close, two friends mentioned the final sale over at the restaurant, and needing a few sheet trays I accidentily showed up 4 days early. While looking over the wares, I started talking to Ruby's family members, and decided to come back the next day.  I returned the next day after that, and the next after that. By Friday, I had taken "ownership" of Ruby's BBQ, it somehow had become my family! When family moves on , you cherish or sing their "Legend" in some amazing way!

I wish to save the almost 30 year old Original Heirloom BBQ Pit! As Matthew Odam said," One of the great relics of the Austin BBQ Scene will live on."  This task is GARGANTUAN, DIFFICULT (...I was injured numerous times working by myself), HEAVY, DELICATE, and IMPORTANT to future generations.  Ruby's was more than BBQ, it served as a center for community, family, and Austin culture. It is one of the last examples of  "OLD" Austin.  Thousands and thousands of us have celebrated, cried and laughed around these BBQ Pits. To BBQ afficianados, they are priceless! You can't walk into a store and buy 30 year seasoned BBQ Pits! We don't have to cry "Remember When", by getting involved with the preservation of the Original Ruby's BBQ Pits! Join me, and Be A Part of Austin Food History Today!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Time is our biggest concern. The new tenant of the Ruby's BBQ space must move in soon. We need $15,000: a) To hire additional staff to speed up this entire process.; b) To purchase a higher quality cryovac machine, in order to shrink wrap the bricks in plastic. (NO, we weren't going to put these prized pieces on the floor in someone's garage!); c) Hire a transport company to carefully transport & store the BBQ Pit in a Temperature controlled storage space.; d) Lastly, we will need help reconstructing this beloved treasure "brick by brick".
  • Any amount is welcome! Your willingness to simply stop and listen to our plea, is in some ways homage enough. On the issue of perks, any donation over $100 receives a beautiful commemorative plaque and their family name fashioned above the newly reconstructed BBQ Pit in its new location.  Any donation above $1000 receives a complimentary dinner for four (4) at Ladybird's Austin Kitchen, and ringside access to the actual rebuilding of this piece of BBQ History!

Your Impact

Your help is vital to our success. 99% of such treasures usually go to a dump, erasing decades of hard work, sacrifice, history, and flavor. Austin does not have to change in this one case....TODAY! We can band together, as Austinites did in the beginning, and say, "FOREVER!"

Our Friend, it is okay if you personally are not able to donate financially. You can help in other ways: Tell a friend about our campaign, share your favorite Ruby's BBQ story with a new Austin Resident, or openly welcome someone new to our Beloved Austin & Share "US" freely! You could even come on down to the Ladybird's Austin Kitchen food trailer at 1606 East 6th Street, tell us your favorite story of Austin, debate how long you think it takes to become a "REAL" Austinite (LOL!), or allow us to tell you about a myriad number of wonderful people that have changed our lives over the years. Personally, I loved to thank a few: Patricia Mares, Clifford Antone, Newman Stribling, Will Tanner,  Art Silver, and the Austin Community Project!

story:
OSLO MODERN COOKWARE

Premium quality Cookware at an Honest Price. Fiord technology, professional quality cookware collection is constructed of the High purity aluminum composite. The highest quality of 5-layers non-stick coating each of our pans and pots are reinforced by ceramic scratch proof particles that are able to endure any intense use. Get your kitchen off to a great start with OSLO 5-pc. set of modern cookware. 

OVERVIEW

New OSLO Cookware collection is strong and durable. Perfect culinary equipment for cooks who value uncompromising quality, attractive design, and superior functionality. Premium quality at an honest price. Manufactured in Korea.

 

OUR STORY

OSLO provides a lifetime of great cooking results and dining experiences.  Like quality knives, well-made pots and pans are essential for great cooking. Quality cookware helps produce better, more evenly cooked food, provides more control and versatility in the kitchen, and if well made should last a lifetime. The brand sells kitchen utensils and is focused on creating the best price/quality ratio, promoting its high value standards while selling the products at a very competitive price.

 

THE BEST MATERIAL

All our Pans and Pots are made with a 97% High purity Aluminium Body.  For our coating, Fiord 5-Layers coating offering the highest quality of nonstick coating each of our pans and pots. This assures a long lasting family of products. Our special Aluminium contains high conductivity, allowing the heat to spread evenly throughout the entire surface. This upgrades the cooking experience to a much higher level while giving you more control over your food.

 

KEY FEATURES

 

 

 

QUALITY TEST

 

 

Aerosol cooking spray leaves a gummy residue that is difficult to remove, and that residue will cause food to stick. Instead, use an oil mister filled with olive or vegetable oil, or dab a bit of oil on a paper towel and carefully wipe the interior of the pan. Use the correct heat setting. 

Use low heat for warming, simmering and preparing sauces; use medium heat for frying, grilling, sautéing, searing or stir-frying; use high heat for boiling or reducing liquids. 

Preheat the pan. Nonstick cookware can take a minute or two longer to preheat compared to aluminum or stainless steel cookware. For best results, make sure your nonstick pan is heated to the proper temperature before adding food.

 

PACKAGE CONTENTS

 

OP FUNDING

TIME LINE

story:
Pepper Face Jelly

Last October I decided to start making pepper jelly from peppers that I had been growing in my own yard. As I began to give the jelly to my friends, the feedback was overwhelmingly good! At that point I knew I needed to sell my jelly.

For anyone that has, or has attempted to start a small buisness, you know how daunting and difficult that task may be. From multiple licenses, to liability insurance, and so on. 

Here I am asking for help. A dream is just a dream, until you take action to bring it to fruition! This is me taking action, and asking for help, even if it's just $1. Thank you to all that have pushed me this far to not give up on my dream! Together we can make this happen! SUPPORT SMALL BUSINESS!!

As I began to give the jelly to my friends, the feedback was overwhelmingly good! At that point I knew I needed to sell my jelly.For anyone that has, or has attempted to start a small buisness, you know how daunting and difficult that task may be. From multiple licenses, to liability insurance, and so on. Here I am asking for help. A dream is just a dream, until you take action to bring it to fruition! This is me taking action, and asking for help, even if it's just $1. Thank you to all that have pushed me this far to not give up on my dream! Together we can make this happen! SUPPORT SMALL BUSINESS!!

story:
Welcome to BLD Nation!

Barely Legal Distilling, LLC is comprised of Danny Petersen, Bill Krejci, and Mark Korsakas. As a startup company, we are employing strategies for low cost facilities and equipment to begin our operations. Our initial production size will be determined by the amount and terms of our crowdfunding efforts and we will grow from there. We will be producing beverages flavored with real fruit at two alcohol levels; a 69 proof corn whiskey & 23 proof cider.  We will also produce a 115 proof clear moonshine called “White Tornado” & a premium vodka.  In pursuing this goal, BLD has been looking for a community we can call home.  The rural towns of Exeter and Seward in Southeast Nebraska hold a lot of appeal.  All three of us either grew up in that general area and have family ties there. While spending a lot of time in these rural communities over the years, the prospect of coming back and launching our new business near home is very exciting. It’s incredible how much talent you can find where you grew up and BLD would reap the benefits of that human resource as we grow into the future and help us be a fun & rewarding place to work.

REFERRAL CONTEST

 

  • Must have an Indiegogo account to participate.

For more information on how to participate in our referral contest, please click to link below.

​https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/203660683-How-to-Participate-in-a-Referral-Contest

(From left to right: Mark, Danny, Bill)


The ability to produce a top quality, premium product has taken some time. Danny formed BLD in January of 2014 and started accumulating equipment for a distillery on his family farm west of Cordova, NE.  In the spring of 2014, Mother Nature had other ideas and on Mother’s Day, a tornado destroyed the entire family farm and all traces of BLD’s future distillery.  Danny didn’t give up on BLD and kept developing and perfecting new flavors.  In 2016, he renewed his effort and decided to put together a team that would give BLD a wealth of diverse experience and energy.

Last fall, we began actively testing our flavors at Husker tailgates, concerts, and trips to the Ozarks, Texas, Indiana, Colorado, Oklahoma and many other places giving out thousands of samples while gathering important feedback and ideas from our future customers. We know that we have great tasting recipes that are unique and well liked. It’s now time to go into production.

The micro distillery industry is poised to have a growth explosion just as the microbrewery business has over the last 15 years.  BLD is on course as an early entry into this industry. Federal licensing is very time consuming, but by accomplishing this early, will face less competition and achieve much faster growth.  We are currently looking at buildings in the community of Seward for our micro distillery. This means we can accelerate our time table to initial production and have a retail location in a much shorter time frame. This is very exciting, not only for us, but for you, the BLD Nation who have been patiently waiting for that first taste of our product.

Looking for a potential home for a our cider production has been a challenge but we’ve found a building in Exeter that is currently for sale along with a historic auditorium that was built in the early 1900’s.  In it’s early days the auditorium was used as a theatre. The first "silent picture show" took place in 1908.  Soon thereafter a fire gutted the inside of the building but it was rebuilt quickly with improvements.  Over the years it was used for weddings and current bands of the day and a community event hall.  At one point it was used for grain storage and then as a company warehouse.  It is in disrepair at this time but BLD would like the chance to restore it to its early 1900's glory.

Exeter Nebraska

These buildings would be used as a cider production facility that would include a tasting room. This will indeed be an undertaking but we are positive the local community would be very excited and supportive of bringing the auditorium back to life.

 

               

Seward Nebraska

​Because of our unique tasting products we know that Barely Legal Distilling will become a very successful business and major employer in the years to come.

 

Our products have been tasted and approved by several big name celebrities, including an award winning country music superstar! (Waiting for approval to use their names)

 

We need your help!

To get BLD off the ground running, we need to raise $75,000.  Every penny we raise is going directly to the items in the pie chart below.  

What's in it for you? PERKS!

Check out the different perk levels, ranging from $10 to $10,000 and the *Barely Legal* items included in each level on the right hand side of your screen.

Disclaimer: Bottle vouchers will ONLY be redeemable at our future tasting room. Unfortunately, we are unable to ship our product to you.  If you would prefer a non-voucher option, read directly below.

For those unsure of their ability to come to BLD in the future and claim their bottle voucher, gift cards ranging from $5 to $500 are available depending on the level of contribution.  Starting at the $500 level, in addition to the gift card, you will receive a Custom BLD Tin Whiskey Cup with your name engraved.

  • Personalized BLD Bottle Label
    • ​We'll send you a personalized BLD Bottle Label with your name on it.
    • Bring this label with you when you come to BLD to claim your voucher, and use it to bottle your very own BLD Whiskey!

  • BLD T-Shirt and Snapback Hat Options
    • T-Shirt ​Colors: Black, Red, White
    • T-Shirt Sizes: 
      • Mens: S,M,L,XL,XXL
      • Womens: S,M,L,XL,XXL
    • Snapback Hat Colors: Black, Red
    • Snapback Hat Sizes: One Size Fits All

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

Whether you decide to contribute to our campaign or not, you can help us by spreading the word about our crowdfunding campaign.  Please share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and E-Mail by using the Indiegogo share tools at the top right corner of this page.

Unfortunately, we are unable to ship our product to you.  If you would prefer a non-voucher option, read directly below.For those unsure of their ability to come to BLD in the future and claim their bottle voucher, gift cards ranging from $5 to $500 are available depending on the level of contribution.  Starting at the $500 level, in addition to the gift card, you will receive a Custom BLD Tin Whiskey Cup with your name engraved.
Personalized BLD Bottle Label

​We'll send you a personalized BLD Bottle Label with your name on it.
Bring this label with you when you come to BLD to claim your voucher, and use it to bottle your very own BLD Whiskey!


BLD T-Shirt and Snapback Hat Options
T-Shirt ​Colors: Black, Red, White
T-Shirt Sizes: 
Mens: S,M,L,XL,XXL
Womens: S,M,L,XL,XXL


Snapback Hat Colors: Black, Red
Snapback Hat Sizes: One Size Fits All

 Other Ways You Can Help!Whether you decide to contribute to our campaign or not, you can help us by spreading the word about our crowdfunding campaign.  Please share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and E-Mail by using the Indiegogo share tools at the top right corner of this page.

story:
Why Crowdfunding?

We feel that crowdfunding is a great match for us because we have small market conditions with a diverse global appeal and this way our many supporters can get directly involved in the process of broadening our offerings, increasing safety and efficiency as we grow, and advancing our use of biodegradable and eco-friendly products.

In addition to our service at the bistro, we are developing promotional events and private booking opportunities with aims of developing community contribution, challenging our company’s growth potential, and advancing our core philosophies and brand awareness.

Our unique offering promises to impact the local dialogue immediately and we can maintain that interest by holding to our core principles: “focusing on “home, health, and inclusion” ; “proactive cost awareness”; “approaching food service with novel attitudes and technological solutions and giving preference to nutrition and local sources.

The long-term success of our ambitious project can be ensured by YOUR GENEROUS CONTRIBUTION. As our world becomes ever more connected, it becomes apparent that we are all neighbors and proactive causes like ours, striving to make positive impacts at home, in our local community, are really part of a global fellowship of progress. 

How Will We Spend It?

Your contributions allow us to keep an uncompromising focus on our core values. Biodegradable take-away packaging is more expensive. Even with our network of local growers and distributors, the highest quality ingredients are more expensive. Operating in a smaller country with limited logistical development can make it expensive to obtain the equipment and material we need to maintain our standards. Hiring the best available staff, and providing them the necessary tools for success also has a cost.

We have set our funding goal based on our projected capital needs, but falling a little short wouldn't be a catastrophe because we have already demonstrated our ability to adapt to and anticipate our industry environment.

What's In It For You?

We've been working on two sets of PERKS to show our appreciation for your contribution. If you live in Bulgaria, we're sending you Bulgarian craft beer, decor items modeled after the bistro's atmosphere, and cool 11:11 Bistro swag. International donors are getting selections from the TASTE OF BULGARIA collection, comprised of Bulgarian calendars (the worlds most accurate EVER),  Martenitsi, and products made from Bulgaria's world famous rose oils. And I can barely believe we are lucky enough to offer this, but we have local artist Hristina Georgieva contributing original canvas paintings to reward our donors!

 

Risks & Challenges

We are competing with cheap alternatives and grey economy, sectors where Bulgaria is a continental leader. Our greatest weapon in this fight is “proactive cost awareness”.

We hope to defeat pervasive attitudes towards value with “transparency and facilitating an enriched local dialogue"

Our region is experiencing an emigration trend and stands behind other regions in foreign investment. We want to be part of the solution in this area by creating something new and progressive.  We engage as many skilled and motivated employees and contractors as means allow. We actively support innovators and view ourselves as an inspirational influence.

Our team members have the international experience to conceive a diverse assortment of solutions and the local familiarity to deliver it in a comfortable package.  

An additional way to offer your support for our project(even if you don't contribute money) is to help us spread the word. Tell your friends and neighbors about our exciting vision and click whatever you have to click to digitally share our campaign. 

And even if you don't contribute or tell anyone about us, the most direct justification of everything we do would be for YOU to be INSPIRED to make changes in your own community. Venture something! Bet on OUR FUTURE and help be a part of shaping it. We will support you!

story:
My Story!

 

My name is Ivo and my business venture started over a year ago. I have been working in hospitality since I was young and always dreamt of running my own place. Over a year ago opportunity has arisen to open up a small cafe with the idea to create something special and unique. Delekt cafe/deli offers artisan coffee, freshly baked pastries, cakes and breads at the start of the day. Over the lunch period we serve freshly made salads that change on daily basis, soups and also made to order bagels, bloomers wraps and bagels using creative fillings.  

Since this is my first business I have learnt a lot but had a lot of fun in the process. I have dedicated all my time and hard work from the beginning. By the help of my father we have completely refurbished premises from bottom to the top. I still run business by myself every day.

Now that the first year has passed I have realised that shop needs further improvements and I have few great ideas for Delekt, which would have a great benefit to customers. 

And now I need Your help!!!

 

What Delekt Needs

 

  • Chilled Deli Server over Counter £ 1500

        The fridge we have is too big and old since the shop opened . New fridge will create space      for salad bar.

  • Drinks Display Fridge £500

​At the moment we don't serve cold refreshments due to limited space. The idea is to make some space and install the fridge because summer is just around the corner so people can enjoy cold refreshments together with their food.

  • Smoothie Blender £200

I would like to add some healthy kicks to customers day by offering breakfast/lunchtime energising smoothies. 

  • Salad Bar and materials £400

Once over the counter fridge will be replaced by a smaller one additional space will be used for open salad bar. Customer will then be able to self serve salads and additional toppings. 

  • Seating and tables £500

Long bench that is currently facing the counter will be replaced by 3 poseur tables and 6 bar stools making it more sociable for customer and will also free some space for those waiting for their take away orders.

  • Under-counter Freezer and Fridge £200

Freezer will be used for storing ice for smoothies. Fridge will be needed for storing fresh products.

 

Received funds for improving Delekt will allow me to provide better and faster service, more healthy options for customers and will create better atmosphere in the cafe. Customer will therefore be able to enjoy better seating to have their lunch. Apologies to current and future customer for limited seating as cafe is very small. Open salad bar will benefit customer by bigger variety of options and toppings in order to create a perfect salad.

In addition, for every contribution I will be offering perks which is listed on the right side of the page so don't forget to check it out. 

Every Saturday i will continue to give bread and cakes to the Gowrie Care Home for homeless people. I have been doing this for past year. I am Strong believer in helping to others. Hopefully something little will make there lives bit better by just something small like it.

Other Ways you can help.

It would be fantastic if you could spread the word about Delekt crowdfunding page and help me in my small business journey. Any help is very much appreciated. 

I always have ideas about new ventures so I will keep you updated on my journey.

 


  •

story:
Hi there, I am Nicole - owner of Roots on Tap, a fresh/organic juice bar in Dallas, TX.  Our natural beverages are crafted daily to deliver full-bodied flavor and unmatched nutrients by volume. We mix unique recipes from the freshest and finest fruits and vegetables and serve them up in convenient, ready-to-go glass bottles.

On a personal journey toward better health, I began making daily green smoothies to bring to work. I had no idea at the time that my healthier snack substitute would eventually lead to the creation of Roots on Tap.  

Once I opened Roots on Tap, I never looked back. I won Dallas Observer’s Best Juice Bar in my first year.  Today, I manage the Roots on Tap team in crafting unique, nutritious and convenient beverages that empower healthy lifestyles.  I also enjoy getting to know our amazing customers and I am grateful to serve them.  

Our goal is $20,000. Our team is hardworking and we truly value the opportunity to turn your generosity into something that would make you proud. Your investment will ensure that we continue to prosper in this start up phase of our business.

story:
What Are We About?

My name is Aaron Moma. I am the owner of The River Coffee Company. From an early age my parents taught me to value working with my hands and the craftsmanship that goes into learning a particular skill. This has translated into my passions in working with coffee.  

As a young child my first sips of coffee took place at my grandmas house as family gathered around the dinner table laughing together and carrying on in conversation. These experiences have shaped my desire to share my love for coffee with the world.  Coffee is a global beverage that has participated in bringing people together and building relationships for centuries.

The River Coffee Company seeks to bring this experience to the heart of Decatur. Decatur is a hardworking, growing community and its people are worn and weary. The River Coffee Company seeks to bring rest and restoration back to the people. 

What We Need & What You Get...

Building a coffee shop from the ground up has proven itself challenging and the 100 year old building that we are currently in needs some updates and renovations. We are in need of at least $30,000.  This will help us purchase:

  • New HVAC System- $3,000
  • Electrical- $2,000
  • Flooring- $1,000
  • Bar- $1,000
  • Refrigerator- $2,000
  • Water Warmer- $1,000
  • Espresso Machine- $10,500- $17,000

The Impact

The River coffee company will provide a great space for people of all ages to get together and connect.  For the business man or woman, this will be a quaint space for meetings to take place.  Coffee has been a social beverage for years and Downtown Decatur needs a place to connect or reconnect with friends and family. Relationships are important  and we want to create space that invites social interaction as well as rest.

Because of Decatur's growing community many people throughout the town have unmet needs and The River Coffee Company seeks to help meet those needs by partnering with and supporting the local missions around town.  Our primary focus is the people of Decatur and its surrounding areas, but we are aware of global issues and seek to support foreign missions as well.  Through the help of your support The River Coffee Company will have a global reach that goes well beyond our local community.

Risks & Challenges

Without The River Coffee Company, the needs of Decatur will grow and have a greater potential of remaining unmet. If we do not succeed in this campaign, Downtown Decatur may seemingly stay the same, but it will loose the possibility for another great meeting place. Yet, with the success of this campaign, relationships will blossom, friendships will form, and business deals will be made--all at the River.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please spread the word about our campaign, mission, and coffee shop.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Please pray for our campaign and all who are involved.

Thanks for all the support!

The River coffee company will provide a great space for people of all ages to get together and connect.  For the business man or woman, this will be a quaint space for meetings to take place.  Coffee has been a social beverage for years and Downtown Decatur needs a place to connect or reconnect with friends and family. Relationships are important  and we want to create space that invites social interaction as well as rest.
Because of Decatur's growing community many people throughout the town have unmet needs and The River Coffee Company seeks to help meet those needs by partnering with and supporting the local missions around town.  Our primary focus is the people of Decatur and its surrounding areas, but we are aware of global issues and seek to support foreign missions as well.  Through the help of your support The River Coffee Company will have a global reach that goes well beyond our local community.

Risks & Challenges
Without The River Coffee Company, the needs of Decatur will grow and have a greater potential of remaining unmet. If we do not succeed in this campaign, Downtown Decatur may seemingly stay the same, but it will loose the possibility for another great meeting place. Yet, with the success of this campaign, relationships will blossom, friendships will form, and business deals will be made--all at the River.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute that doesn't mean you can't help:

Please spread the word about our campaign, mission, and coffee shop.
Use the Indiegogo share tools!
Please pray for our campaign and all who are involved.

Thanks for all the support!

story:
Short Summary

Sweet treats for everyone. Daddy's Dough Cookies is a small home-based business. We are looking to expand our business to share our sweet treats with more people. We believe that everyone should be able to enjoy our delicious cookies, so we've  added gluten free and dairy free to our menu. We plan to add sugar free and protein cookies as well. We don't want you to deprive yourself of something that makes you happy just because you're living a healthier lifestyle. Cookies baked fresh for you!

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Everyone deserves cookies, regardless of your dietary restrictions.
  • You will help us get cookies to everyone; including our gluten-free, diary-free, and nut-free clients.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Starting a bakery/restaurant business requires over $100,000. Daddy's Dough is hoping that you can get us started. We believe our unbelievable fan base will do that.
  • There will be free cookies galore for those that contribute.
  • The majority of your funds will help us purchase equipment and go towards research and development of new cookies (protein and sugar free).

Your contribution will help us take our program to the next level:

  • We have excellent reviews. www.daddysdough.com/reviews

  • We will spend extra time in the cookie lab to ensure high quality cookies.

  • We will use funds to purchase additional equipment (mixers, ovens, etc.) to expand the business beyond our kitchen .

Challenges

  • We are a small business looking to our fan base for support.
  • We hope to use your contributions to catapult us into the future.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share our campaign with your friends
  • After you contribute please share this with anyone in your social networks.

story:
Founders' Foreword:

Beer makes us happy, but the craft food and beverage industry keeps us endlessly curious. Craft beer and liquor sales are up, patrons carry pride in eating and drinking local, and disposable incomes continue to rise. The growth in popularity of craft drinks and local fare has provided the industry with an influx of highly talented, passionately driven, and endlessly creative innovators with the hope of satisfying every consumer’s gastrological curiosity.

However, many watching the industry fear certain saturations in the market - especially for breweries. This concern instills hesitation in brewers looking to break into the industry with their own business or experiment with product too broadly. Even further, production breweries struggle to justify using tank space for experimentation or collaboration given the production impact on current offerings.

That’s where we come in.

With careers in music and the arts, Dan and Jordan came up with the idea for Pilot Project after realizing how many other creative industries have dedicated spaces for artists to do their work. Photography studios, recording studios, art lofts, test kitchens -- there's no shortage.

Pilot Project: a “guerrilla” brewery incubator and tasting room accomplishes just that for the beer industry. Designed to provide brewing resources to an industry that demands a $1M+ barrier to entry, we will support upstart businesses and day-dreaming home brewers, encourage small-batch experimentation and collaboration across the industry, and provide consumer market testing in our lovely tasting room. Plus, we all get to drink great beer.

So Why Am I Contributing?

Your contribution to Pilot Project will help support the aspects of our business needed to put our products in front of the public: our bar!

Any Other Ways to Help?

Yes! We need to get the word out. Whether or not you can make a monetary contribution, your support and the support of your friends and family is the biggest contribution. Please follow us on instagram and, where possible, share this campaign to help us reach our goal!

Thank you!

Dan, Jordan & the Pilot Project crew

story:
OUR MISSION

END PLASTIC BOTTLES!   HELP US SAVE OUR PLANET!

I and my supporters are on a mission to help eliminate 80 Billion Plastic Bottles that are thrown into our oceans & landfills, and are choking to death our wildlife, sea mammals and eventually ourselves. 80 Billion Plastic Bottles that contain drinking water and then end up polluting Earth while major multi-national companies reap billions in profits-WHAT A DISGRACE!

IT'S SIMPLE TO SOLVE THIS PROBLEM and WE HAVE STARTED TO DO IT!

Our 100% Plant Based Bottle filled with award winning Canadian Spring Water and 100% Compostable is the answer. Our cap is also compostable .

We accept subscription orders direct on our website and through Shopify and allow students to deliver and pick up empty bottles to compost, completing the circle of life.

A GREAT BUSINESS MODEL!

Water is the most consumed fluid on earth.  Supply Great water in Plant based not Plastic Bottles. Allow students to earn money and assist us in our mission. Give back to Indigenous Canadian communities who lack clean, safe drinking water. What took so long to get here?

What We Need & What You Get!

  • We need $100,000 to be in full production. We need your help! We have successfully obtained 5000 Plant Based Bottles made from corn and filled them with pure Canadian Spring Water-Great tasting , award winning and excellent to hydrate the human body; and we have consumers excited about our non plastic bottle.
  • There are in our research only a handful of companies in the world today on a mission such as ours and we are the only company in Canada trying to end plastic bottle pollution.
  • Contribute $5000 and we will thank you with an original Native Canadian Soapstone Sculpture. Pledge $1000 and we will send you a Lithograph (Limited Edition) drawn by an Indigenous Artist from Northern Canada. Provide $500 and we will gratefully provide you with a case of 24 x 500 ml Plant Based NIBIWATER filled with our award winning pure pristine Canadian Spring Water once each month for 120 days.
  • Our Pledge to you:   If we don't reach our campaign goal by at least 60% we will either refund your pledge 100% or donate all funds received to support Canada's Indigenous Communities who lack clean, safe drinking water.

What will be great about a successful campaign?

We don't have the funds to start up our bottling facility alone! A wonderful idea needs your help!

  • Success would start the process to end single-use Plastic Bottles!
  • Success would help Green the Planet!
  • Success would help students earn income while helping a noble cause!
  • Success would assist us in our commitment to donate pure water to Indigenous Communities.
  • Success would help the fight against having 100,000 marine mammals die every year from ingesting plastic in our oceans.

Risks & Challenges

 We have worked for the past full year to solve numerous problems in getting a 100%  Plant Based Bottle with Pure Canadian Spring Water to the consumer and now we are ready to ramp up production. 

  • The Big Multi-Nationals don't want us to succeed but we believe consumers will accept our offer with glee-Finally a non plastic container!  Compostable  too!
  • We will succeed. The world wants to consume pure water without polluting the planet.
  • Our price per bottle is accepted in the marketplace and the demographic we will reach welcomes such a Vegan Container. Not cardboard. Not Plastic. All Plant.

HELP SPREAD THE WORD!

  • Tell anyone in our immediate delivery area about NIBIWATER.
  • Talk to potential investors or those who wish to donate to help us succeed in our quest to Green the Earth!
  • NIBI is the Ojibway word for water and we are indebted to the nations of people who first inhabited and still occupy the magnificent terrain of the Canadian Shield where our Pristine Spring Water filtered clean by nature bubbles up so we can capture it in our 100% Plant Based bottles, free of oil based plastic that contaminates the world we live in.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Social Media:

Instagram

Website

ATH in the Press 
 

 

"In 3 short years, we have increased our trade from just 88 bags of coffee in 2017 to over 600 bags for the 2019 harvest season. And we are slated to move at least 1,000 bags of specialty and mainstream coffees for 2020."

 

Our STORY

 


Since 2017, Arabica Trading House has sourced specialty and mainstream coffees direct from Africa, the Americas and the Indian-Pacific region. As the first boutique trading company in Istanbul, we have become a force within Turkey’s emerging specialty market and continue to influence the way industry players understand and appreciate coffee.  

Our wholesale division, ATH| Greens, offers an independent and transparent platform for roasters purchasing specialty and mainstream Arabica coffees. With partnerships at origin, we select exclusive micro-lots from smallholder farmers, cooperatives and exporters that are exclusive to our greens catalog; offering a unique coffee experience for roasters and consumers.

In three short years, we have increased our trade from just 88 bags of coffee(averaging 60kg per bag) in 2017 to over 600 bags for the 2019 harvest season.  And we are slated to move at least 1,000 bags of specialty and mainstream coffees for 2020 to our markets in Turkey, Southeast Asia and the Middle East. 

With a local population of over 15 million and tourism averaging 20 million per year to Istanbul, we receive regular foot traffic from locals and tourists alike.  So in 2018,  we introduced a retail space showcasing our local roasting partners. Our objective was to promote producers and roasters while strengthening ATH’s brand as a boutique trading company.  Not only are we proud of our roasting partners, but the coffee community was pleased to have a platform with a direct link to the coffee supply chain. 

We had no idea how successful the retail side of our business would become over the years. Our team quickly learned that Turkey’s coffee market was still in need of a transparent and sustainable platform in which to find not only green coffee but roasted coffee. 

And thus our latest sales division was born:  ATH| RETAIL!


 

"Our retail buildout will include a tasting room, full espresso bar and micro-roastery highlighting Limited Edition and Specialty coffee collections roasted in-house by our team."

 

Our Retail BUILDOUT!

 


This is an opportune time for us to capitalize on growth potential in our respective markets by introducing ATH| Retail as our B2C(business to consumer) platform. Adding a retail space will allow for us to capture a larger part of the market in Turkey as well as neighboring markets along the Black Sea, including Iran. As our business expands further east it will reach markets throughout the Arabian Peninsula( Dubai, Kuwait, Muscat, Riyadh) that are also on the rise.

Our RETAIL BUILDOUT will include a tasting room, full espresso bar and micro-roastery highlighting ATH| Limited and ATH| Specialty coffee collections roasted in-house by our seasoned team. 

Arabica Trading House, Istanbul

 

"As our top tier offering(totaling only 10% of annual purchasing), ATH| Limited coffees are exceptional in cup profile scoring above 88-points out of 100 on the Specialty Coffee Association’s quality scale."

 

Our Retail Coffee Collections 
 

As our top tier offering(totaling only 10% of annual purchasing), ATH| Limited coffees are exceptional in cup profile scoring above 88-points out of 100 on the Specialty Coffee Association’s quality scale.  With exotic flavors and experimental fermentation processing, these coffees will usually be from single-farmer or private estate farms and would be in limited supply(1-10 bags). These micro-lots are catered to our retail customers who understand and appreciate the complexities of these profiles.  

ATH| Limited coffees are sourced from our partners throughout South America(Colombia, Brazil), Central America(Panama), Africa (Ethiopia, Kenya, Burundi) and the Indian-Pacific(Indonesia, Thailand, Yemen).  These exotic micro-lots have exquisite cup profiles full of tropical fruits, winey fermentation, berries and chocolate. Ideal offerings for consumers and enthusiasts looking for a unique coffee experience!

 

 

"With cupping scores between 84 to 88-points out of 100 on the Specialty Coffee Association point scale, ATH| Specialty coffees are the main drivers of business with over 50% of annual purchasing."

 

With cupping scores between 84 to 88-points out of 100 on the Specialty Coffee Association point scale, ATH| Specialty coffees are the main drivers of business with over 50% of annual purchasing.  These micro-lots are staple coffees our retail customers will use for espresso and filter options.  Because of this,  ATH| Greens sources larger quantities of these coffees from its producers to ensure consistency and availability. We will be using these coffees for our standard espressos behind the bar.

A full range of origins, varieties and processes will be available each season with top origins such as Brazil, Ethiopia, Honduras, Indonesia and Kenya procured annually.  Cup profiles are full bodied, with sweet caramel, stone fruits and mild acidity. Quality and consistent profiles produced by our roaster allows for our retail customers to identify these coffees by name; making these selections our retail customers “go-to” coffee throughout the week.

 

 

"Coffee is better enjoyed when the community is a part of that story!"
 

 

Our CAMPAIGN! 

 

Coffee is better enjoyed when the community is a part of that story! 

Indiegogo empowers creators with an alternative to traditional funding. In order to make ATH|Retail a reality, we need the love and support of all of you to make it possible.   

We are lucky that our current space allows for us to BUILDOUT from our basement, adding an additional 55 square meters to our current Ground Floor space of 65 square meters.  No major renovations are needed so our crowdfunding campaign will allow for us to secure a 3-6kg roasting machine and buildout the cafe to include a full espresso bar and new seating area.  


Here is the breakdown of our budget needs:
 

Goal| $60,000

Stretch Goal|  $95,000

Indiegogo funds will be spent on...

Equipment| 3-6kg gas roaster, espresso machine, grinders, coffee brewer, filtration system, refrigerated display case, under counter refrigeration…

Renovations| service counter buildout, electrical work for all equipment/lighting, security system updates, paint, fixtures, signage…

Furniture and lighting

Green coffee inventory

Labor

 

"We're grateful to be in a position that allows us to meet some enthusiastic coffee influencers. Istanbul has become home to not only Turks in the coffee community but North Americans, Europeans and Asians." 

 

Our PEOPLE

 

 

Arabica Trading House prides itself on building a coffee platform that is inclusive to the entire community opening our doors to baristas, roasters and coffee enthusiasts. These principles are no different for the our retail business and the team we will onboard to enhance this experience. Collectively, we have over 25 years of active work experience in the coffee sector across Europe and West Asia. 

the Trader & General Manager

As the greens buyer and GM of ATH, Martell has built relationships throughout coffee producing regions around the world.  A native of Midwest-USA, he has over a decade of experience working in coffee markets throughout Europe and West Asia. Understanding the needs of small and medium-sized roasters in Turkey and the Arabian Peninsula has allowed him to source exceptional coffees in a transparent and sustainable way. We look forward to offering coffees sourced by him and ATH| Greens.  

the Head Roaster

Our Roaster hails from Azerbaijan.  With coffee experience spanning from Baku to Moscow, this offers Arabica Trading House a unique perspective to coffee that will allow us to offer a a full range of roast profiles to meet our customer needs.  Murad's passion for coffee is evident and his attention to detail is appreciated. We look forward to bringing him on board this project and elevating our coffee community. 

the Associates

Istanbul has become home to not only Turks in the coffee community but North Americans, Europeans and Asians.  With such a diverse coffee community, we have a tapped a few coffee influencers to come on-board to manage our cafe and retail space.  Our associates are not just experts behind the espresso bar, but they are seasoned in their ability to evaluate the nuances of coffee taste; specifically the body (the texture or mouthfeel), sweetness, acidity, flavor and aftertaste of our coffees. With Turkish, English, Arabic, Russian and Farsi being spoken between the team; we're confident we'll be able to express our passion for coffee in every way possible. Now that's coffee made by the people...for the people!  

Arabica Trading House, Istanbul 
 

"To show our appreciation, you will receive some of our finest single-origin micro-lots and specialty blends from South America, East Africa and the Indian-Pacific region."

 

PERKS AND REWARDS!  

 

Whether in New York City, London, Dubai or Tokyo; you can make our retail buildout a reality! Global shipping is cost effective and a breeze. So add ATH| Retail coffee to your daily or weekly cup!

Check out our SINGLE, QUARTERLY and EXCLUSIVE perks! 

 

Risk, Challenges and Covid-19:


Market trends throughout Turkey and West Asia are strong. As green coffee traders, we understand what the markets can hold from the Black Sea to the Arabian Gulf. We are confident that our project will move forward with very few hurdles despite the current global situation.

Although we are confident we will still be able to deliver our rewards as promised, circumstances can change quickly. We will provide backers with relevant updates in the event anything is delayed. We anticipate first rewards shipments to be distributed as early as October 2020.
 

We THANK YOU for your support!

We look forward to offering coffees sourced by him and ATH| Greens.  the Head RoasterOur Roaster hails from Azerbaijan.  With coffee experience spanning from Baku to Moscow, this offers Arabica Trading House a unique perspective to coffee that will allow us to offer a a full range of roast profiles to meet our customer needs.  Murad's passion for coffee is evident and his attention to detail is appreciated. We look forward to bringing him on board this project and elevating our coffee community. the AssociatesIstanbul has become home to not only Turks in the coffee community but North Americans, Europeans and Asians.  With such a diverse coffee community, we have a tapped a few coffee influencers to come on-board to manage our cafe and retail space.  Our associates are not just experts behind the espresso bar, but they are seasoned in their ability to evaluate the nuances of coffee taste; specifically the body (the texture or mouthfeel), sweetness, acidity, flavor and aftertaste of our coffees. With Turkish, English, Arabic, Russian and Farsi being spoken between the team; we're confident we'll be able to express our passion for coffee in every way possible. Now that's coffee made by the people...for the people!  Arabica Trading House, Istanbul  "To show our appreciation, you will receive some of our finest single-origin micro-lots and specialty blends from South America, East Africa and the Indian-Pacific region." 
PERKS AND REWARDS!   Whether in New York City, London, Dubai or Tokyo; you can make our retail buildout a reality! Global shipping is cost effective and a breeze. So add ATH| Retail coffee to your daily or weekly cup!Check out our SINGLE, QUARTERLY and EXCLUSIVE perks!  Risk, Challenges and Covid-19:Market trends throughout Turkey and West Asia are strong. As green coffee traders, we understand what the markets can hold from the Black Sea to the Arabian Gulf. We are confident that our project will move forward with very few hurdles despite the current global situation.Although we are confident we will still be able to deliver our rewards as promised, circumstances can change quickly. We will provide backers with relevant updates in the event anything is delayed. We anticipate first rewards shipments to be distributed as early as October 2020. We THANK YOU for your support!

story:
The Punch:
We are starting a brewery because we believe that you have to make the culture you want to be a part of. And for us, here in Jefferson, beer is the perfect way to do that! 

The Gist:
Jefferson Beer Supply will be a brewery and sausage join located in Jefferson, South Dakota. We are proud of where we live and we want to celebrate it. Yup, warts and all. Or maybe corn and all. Corn warts and all…Anyway, beer! 

We take crafting our beer and sausages seriously so the drinking and eating part can stay fun! Hand brewed and sausaged in house, our elevated approach honors longstanding beer and sausage traditions, while paying homage to the ingredients and stories that make South Dakota awesome!

Whether you are looking for a quick bite with your kids, a brewery tour of how beer is made, or a place to watch baseball with your friends, our family oriented space and menu will have something for everyone. We want to show off what makes Jefferson great! 

Our Strengths- Our Family!

We are set up for success because our family has the drive, skill sets, passion, and organizational foresight to make this happen!

Nicki, our director of brewing, has been brewing professionally for 6 years in Colorado, Wisconsin, and South Dakota. She got started brewing when she was hired to be a janitor at a startup craft brewery in 2014. Yup, the janitor/brewing crossover is real. She was a scholarship recipient through the Pink Boots Society, and studied beer and brewing in Bavaria, Germany. Her recipes have been distributed nationally and internationally. Beer and craftsmanship are her passion and she is looking forward to sharing them.

Anthony is an experienced butcher and excited to bring his sausage making experience to Jefferson, as well as extend his other skills to various parts of the business. He actually got is start as a butcher working the meat counter at Jones' in Elk Point! He has since completed his butcher apprentice program and been honing his passion for butchering and sausage making professionally for the past 6 years. Born and raised in Jefferson, he is excited to grow this business in the place he calls home.

If you’ve been to Jefferson, you probably already know Michaeleen. She has been the City Finance officer for the City of Jefferson for over 30 years. She keeps the city running, from managing the utilities like water and garbage to working on the budget, taxes, and infrastructure projects like the lagoon and the playground. She is a school bus driver, volunteer EMT, Days of 59’ coordinator, community center manager, and town’s busiest citizen. She has lived in Jefferson for over 40 years.

Our Progress:
Starting a brewery requires a lot of capital. We want to have what we need to start off right. We have our building in place and are working through renovations, but we still need some equipment and fixtures funded so we can get started making tasty beer! Money from this campaign will be used to pay for essential purchases, like our kegs, draft lines, sausage making equipment, furniture, tasting room renovations, and more. We have the experience to make this business great for the town of Jefferson, we just need the right tools to get the job done! The impact this funding will have on our offerings and ability to get off the ground is huge. We would love nothing more than to be sitting on our patio, sharing a cold one with you next summer! Donate to our campaign and consider yourself RSVP’d. 

What you can do:
Donate to our campaign! Buy some of our merchandise on our website!. Sign up for our newsletter! Share this campaign with your friends! Start practicing drinking beer!

Click the "Back It" button above to donate. Any amount is super helpful! The perks on the side are some extras if you feel like making a bigger gift.

 Link to our online store 

Other stuff:
Ok, if you’ve made it this far, we are done asking for money and just want to tell you more about our plans!

Nicki has brewed literally hundreds of different recipes in her time as a professional brewer- from crisp light lagers and hazy IPA's with fruity hops to dark, roasty high alcohol stouts or balanced fruit sours inspired by pastries. She has learned from world renowned brewers, like those at Left Hand Brewing in Colorado, famous for their award winning Milk Stout and her former employer. Or visiting Weihenstephan in Germany, the oldest brewery in the world, famous for their lagers. Her own recipes for a rose inspired Brut IPA and Orange Creamsicle IPA were canned and distributed nationally and internationally, even making a splash at a beer festival in Budapest!

She has worked on partnerships with other companies to help build recipes inspired by their foods or stories. She has participated in over 40 collaboration brews, gaining more experience from everyone she meets. She has experience with Barrel aging, mixed culture sours, gluten free beers, and all kinds of other fermented goodies. Here is a peak of some of what she has planned. Lots of carefully crafted, delicious drinks that, by the way, tell the story of Jefferson. 

Grasshopper Cross, a hazy IPA. In 1868,  the people of Jefferson were threatened by grasshoppers that had been entirely destroying nearby settlements. The new priest of St. Peter’s and the settlers, many barefoot,  marched a procession of crosses about 6 miles out of town, placing one in all four directions. Grasshoppers were found in the surrounding river banks and fields, but never made it beyond the crosses that year and the crops survived. The landmarks still exist today and act as a wayfinder and connector for many. We hope this beer can do the same. Our thoughtfully picked ingredients similarly showcase the resilience of South Dakota land, crops, and people. 

This beer has a grain bill of barely, oats, malted wheat, and the real star, raw Clark’s Cream wheat, from Belle Valley Ancient Grains Farm in Newell, South Dakota. This wheat has a lengthy history of its own. The wind in South Dakota flattened you, and this ancient grain is no exception. It grows 3 to 5 feet tall, but lays flat while growing. It is what gives this beer its creamy mouthfeel and hazy body to stand up to our awesome hops!

Dakota Challenger hops, grown in Yankton at 6th Meridian Farms right at the base of the reservoir. This hop species is very challenging to grow elsewhere in the United States but has adapted well to the Missouri River Valley. We combine it with other fruit forward hops to make a hazy ipa that is flavorful and balanced.

Michaeleen's Rhubarb Crisp Pastry Sour. This beer is inspired by Michaeleen's recipe for our summer favorite, Rhubarb Crisp. With lots of local rhubarb and top notch vanilla, this sour beer tastes like summer any time of the year. 

Orange Creamsicle Hard Seltzer A bubbly, fun, hard seltzer with milk sugar and vanilla

Lunch Counter Series Exciting rotating flavors, like the hot plate special at a diner. This specific recipe is a yummy sweet porter that mimics the chili and cinnamon roll pairing from our school lunch traditions. 

Man, are you thirsty yet? We didn't even get to the sausages! They will be waiting for you...

story:
The Point

Hello, and welcome!

This is Black Velvet Desserts, your gourmet dessert caterer for ALL occasions! 

I have been in business for over 2 years and am ready to take a leap of faith in growing to become a more sustainable business so that, by the year 2021, it can provide reliable, consistent, and supportive employment to survivors of human trafficking. 

This business has been debt free since the beginning! While that may not always be practical or realistic later on, my hope is to raise enough money to invest in sustainable growth so that we can make an even larger impact in its community...and the world.

Black Velvet Desserts

Black Velvet Desserts provides elevated experiences for all occasions so that we can elevate survivors of human trafficking. 

The goal of Black Velvet Desserts (BVD) is to provide stable and supportive employment to survivors of human trafficking through the production of high quality gourmet desserts. 

Black Velvet Desserts started in 2017 as a gourmet dessert catering company focused on elevating the dessert scene in Columbus, Ohio. But I wanted to be something more than just another bakery in Columbus.
I’m not really sure why I leaned toward helping survivors of human trafficking - it has always broken my heart, so I started learning more about it and it lit a fire inside me.

Ohio is ranked 4TH in the nation for number of human trafficking cases.

I struggle with self worth, esteem, and value but I was fortunate to have certain people in a vulnerable stage of my life to help me realize my worth and value. This doesn’t mean I don’t still struggle with it, but now I am motivated to help others realize the fact that we are ALL beautifully and wonderfully made and have a worthy purpose in this life. 

The Future Plan

My plan is to become more accessible to my community and beyond by creating beautiful dessert gifts for people to send to those they value and appreciate through the convenience of e-commerce.

This correlates to the mission of BVD by elevating the experience of gratitude, love, and kindness which also elevates survivors of human trafficking by allowing them to be a part of creating something beautiful and valuable that is shared by all. 

We would also continue hosting local events and providing gourmet desserts for all occasions, anywhere. 

Right now, my local community is able to order online and pick up on a certain day and time. But, we all know that it would be much more convenient to ship it straight to them. But it isn’t as simple as it sounds.

I am in need of

  • packaging
  • labels 
  • shipping materials
  • trademark rights
  • marketing materials and promotions
  • among other things to make this dream come true. 

I know in my heart that, regardless of how large this goal is, this is my purpose in life - to not only to be a strong mother and wife, but to create a legacy and movement to do MORE to effectively help God's broken children. 

What We Do Now

Currently, BVD hosts local dessert and wine pairing events that sometimes include a speaker from a local organization to educate the public about the effects of human trafficking in Central Ohio. We also cater all special events such as weddings and corporate events. 
We just started hosting pop-ups at a local coffee shop. This has brought in feedback of being more accessible at other local shops, being able to order online, as well as offering corporate/personal gifts! 

 

Why Desserts? 

Desserts are created by multiple ingredients, methods and techniques. The precision, focus, and detail becomes an art that is beautiful, valued, and creates worth. Some desserts look complicated and overwhelming - but when broken down into steps and an understanding of methods used, anyone can create a beautiful dessert.

This same concept can be used to help restore and empower survivors of human trafficking. As a survivor works through her battles, it seems overwhelming. But focusing on one task at a time, with support in understanding the methods, it becomes a much more manageable victory. 

I Need Your Help

This is a terrifying leap for me, but I am blessed with amazing support by not only friends and family, but by many people I have not yet met. People who have seen me grow, slowly but surely, and become loyal supporters and clients! 

I have also seen these same beautiful people become more aware and active in fighting against human trafficking! 

Thank you so much for taking your time to learn about BVD and how it plans to grow. I appreciate any and all contributions whether financial, resources, and even prayer! 

 

BE SURE TO FOLLOW US!

Facebook

Instagram - @bvdesserts

www.blackvelvetdesserts.com

story:
Multiculturalism is an attractive and persuasive notion. It suggests a human being whose identifications and loyalties transcend the boundaries of nationalism and whose commitments are pinned to a larger vision of the global community. That is exactly how I like to describe myself, along with being a ‘potential fulfiller’. I see the world as a place full of unlimited and untapped opportunities for learning.

As an immigrant and being part of the African Diaspora, I have realised that I would be a potent force for Cameroon’s development, my country of origin, not only by filling the inequality gap through remittances to member of my family, but also, most importantly, through promotion of trade, investments, research, innovation, and knowledge and technology transfers.

 

 

After the scandal of child labor and modern slavery in 2000’s, the chocolate lobby convinced angry regulators that the industry could fix the child labor issue by 2005. Certifications, such as Fairtrade, UTZ, and Rainforest Alliance used to be perceived as great initiatives, but over the years they have become more of a marketing tool to bypass certain morals and put the consumer more at ease when in reality, over 20 years later, not much has changed.

 

 

While global GDP has grown by 271% since 1990, the number of people living on less than $5/day has increased by more than 370 million.  Confronting inequality is the only way to end poverty in a climate-constrained world.

Poverty-reduction rely on a fair distribution of our planet resources and not on the prospect of growth and at the expense of our planet.

Bantu Chocolate isn’t about the pursuit of endless industrial growth while chewing through our living planet and threatening our existence but instead Bantu Chocolate is about nurturing our nature.

By cultivating our own Cacao on a land passed down through generations, and producing a tasteful bean-to-bar chocolate, we want to wash away the persistent negative stereotypes surrounding West Africa Cacao and show that there are quality-conscious makers committed to ethically sourced, traceable and high-quality beans.

 

 

Our mission

In 2016 my mother decided to use the land she had inherited from her ancestors to start a farm in Cameroon. We not only planted cacao but opted for a regenerative agriculture approach and have also planted thousands of trees such as bananas, plantains, papaya, avocado, mangoes, shade and environmentally friendly trees to enhance biodiversity, protect and nourish soils.

No country can achieve sustainable economic development without substantial investment in human capital. Education enriches people's understanding of themselves and the world as a whole.
 
That is why at Bantu Chocolate, our farm is located in Cameroon, we make chocolate in London, and work hard to bring all the attention back to Cameroon and Africa as a whole by promoting children’s education and literacy in our village, creating employment opportunities as well as having a positive community impact by paying our collaborators a living wage. This will empower and support local members of the communities to solve their problems by themselves and help to fill in the gaps in basic health, education, income generation, and hygiene improvements.
 

The Education Commission projects that if current trends continue, by 2030 just 4 out of 10 children of school age (1.4 billion children) in low- and middle-income countries will be on track to gain basic secondary-level skills.

 

The education sector is undeniably strategic to economic development.

That is why strengthening education for children will be one of our main focus areas along with paying our collaborators the living wage. The purpose of this specific project is to improve the quality of teaching and learning for teachers and children in our locality, with a focus on:

  • Improvement of school infrastructure, furniture and equipment. The school will receive financial support to build new classrooms, and procure library books and furniture. This will contribute to creating child-friendly, safe and conducive learning environments.
  • Raising awareness of the importance of good hygiene.
  • Strengthening of teachers’ skills - teachers will be trained on new teaching methods, usage of computers as teaching aids, and ways of promoting gender equality within the classrooms. They will also receive refresher training in their areas of teaching (i.e. Maths, English, French etc.)

By investing in job creating SME’s, like Bantu Chocolate, the aim is to create attractive post-education opportunities for young people, which can engender a virtuous cycle of progress in the future.

 

 

Ways you can help

We are looking for initial investment to raise £50K to support the creation of Bantu Chocolate and 5 tasteful chocolate bars recipes.

 

Then in a second phase the goal would be to expand into additional categories of food including honey and coffee trading to high ethical and sustainable standards on our farm.

The investment will allow us to implement a strong marketing support program of social media, press campaigns and strategic events, acquire a factory purchase equipment and pay our staff a fair living wage in Cameroon and London, where we are based, and where we will be producing our chocolate.

The investments breakdown is as follows: 

- 17% for Farming and Social Impact for the Village: planned to be paired with revenue from operations on the long term

- 21% for Chocolate Bean-to-Bar chocolate Making Equipment

- 15% for New Product Development: research, design, travel and chocolate line

- 26% for Marketing Programme: content productions, events, social media, paid social

- 21% for Personnel: Salaries and administrative costs. 

 

Timeline

     

    Rewards Other Ways You Can Help

    Please get our message out there. Cut and past the campaign link and share it on social media.

That is why strengthening education for children will be one of our main focus areas along with paying our collaborators the living wage. The purpose of this specific project is to improve the quality of teaching and learning for teachers and children in our locality, with a focus on:

Improvement of school infrastructure, furniture and equipment. The school will receive financial support to build new classrooms, and procure library books and furniture. This will contribute to creating child-friendly, safe and conducive learning environments.
Raising awareness of the importance of good hygiene.
Strengthening of teachers’ skills - teachers will be trained on new teaching methods, usage of computers as teaching aids, and ways of promoting gender equality within the classrooms. They will also receive refresher training in their areas of teaching (i.e. Maths, English, French etc.)

By investing in job creating SME’s, like Bantu Chocolate, the aim is to create attractive post-education opportunities for young people, which can engender a virtuous cycle of progress in the future.
 
 

Ways you can help
We are looking for initial investment to raise £50K to support the creation of Bantu Chocolate and 5 tasteful chocolate bars recipes.

 


Then in a second phase the goal would be to expand into additional categories of food including honey and coffee trading to high ethical and sustainable standards on our farm.
The investment will allow us to implement a strong marketing support program of social media, press campaigns and strategic events, acquire a factory purchase equipment and pay our staff a fair living wage in Cameroon and London, where we are based, and where we will be producing our chocolate.
The investments breakdown is as follows: 
- 17% for Farming and Social Impact for the Village: planned to be paired with revenue from operations on the long term
- 21% for Chocolate Bean-to-Bar chocolate Making Equipment
- 15% for New Product Development: research, design, travel and chocolate line
- 26% for Marketing Programme: content productions, events, social media, paid social
- 21% for Personnel: Salaries and administrative costs. 
 
Timeline


 
Rewards Other Ways You Can HelpPlease get our message out there. Cut and past the campaign link and share it on social media.

story:
Hi, my name is Milan. I’m one of the Founders here at The Free Spirits Company and I've always loved a great cocktail.

But over the years, alcohol, and whether or not to drink it, has controlled too many decisions in my life. Too many times I skipped social events simply because I wasn't drinking at that time. Or worse, I've lost too many weekends to life-sucking hangovers.

I think I was convinced that, in order to have a good time - to have genuine interactions with people - I had put alcohol in my body. 

And, here’s another thing.  As I look back at each time I drank far too many, it wasn’t necessarily the alcohol I was after.  I wanted a great cocktail.  I wanted something complex and delicious made just for me.  I wanted the night to keep going and to feel a part of it all. But I can’t say I ever really craved the alcohol associated with 6 G&T’s.

The central problem is there simply aren’t enough non alcoholic options that provide the same level of excitement, of complexity, of boldness as their boozy cousins. Which seems kinda crazy, right??

And that’s why we founded The Free Spirits Company located here in Marin County, California where the cool Pacific fog nourishes the giant redwood trees and the hills of gold gently roll into wine country.

And hey, I'm a cocktail guy. But for too long now, I’ve believed that alcohol is the essential ingredient in a cocktail.  

See, we believe that YOU should decide when and how much alcohol you want alcohol in your life. Not some industry, not your friends, not advertising.

The Products:

We're currently in production of three products: The Spirit of Gin, The Spirit of Tequila and The Spirit of Bourbon. We make each one of the Free Spirits in the spirit of some of the greatest spirits in the world. We source real, natural ingredients like American White Oak, Mexican Blue Agave and European Juniper. We extract, decant and distill their essential oils and, through a process called distillate reconstruction, we recreate the nose, flavors and mouthfeel that so many of us have come to love. And instead of a fermentation process that creates alcohol, we simply skip that step and infuse the source liquid with B vitamins and energy to help elevate your mood and the experience. 

Production status and how the funds will be used:

The founders of the Company have funded us all the way through production and we'll be shipping out orders the second week in November! The funds raised through this campaign are 100% slated for marketing activities that generate awareness of our brand and purchase through our website.

Anyone contributing will have a meaningful impact to create a whole new universe of options for people who chose to live alcohol free - whether that be for the round, the month or longer.

About me:

I've worked in the advertising business for close to 25 years and I've contributed to the advertising and marketing of some of the biggest and most loved brands in the world. I've had the great fortune to be president at Grey Advertising, one of the most creative agencies in the world and, before that, I was a Senior Partner at Ogilvy & Mather in NYC and London, UK.

Some of my clients over the years include Anheuser-Busch, Diageo and Procter & Gamble so I know how to market brands in the adult beverage and consumer packaged goods spaces.

I've created the Free Spirits brand to represent freedom of choice, enabling people to break free from social norms that may be contributing to how, when and where we chose to "drink".

Thank you so much for reading this. We'd be beyond grateful to have you onboard as a founding investor. And, even if you're not ready to invest, you can help by sharing our campaign with Indiegogo's share tools.

Thank you and BREAK FREE!

Milan

story:
*After having our last campaign funded on Kickstarter we were going to do it again on Kickstarter. However, Kickstarter changed what they allow and won't allow me to offer gift cards as a reward.

Bone Broth

Our bone broth is made from local pasture raised animals. Currently, we make over 20 flavors using beef, chicken, turkey, pork and duck, with more animal broth and flavors coming in 2021. We cook our bone broth over the course of 2 days to make sure we extract everything out of the bones. This gives us a nutrient and collagen rich broth. It is extremely flavorful and perfect to heat and sip, or to use to make a variety of dishes. It comes frozen so it can be stored safely in your freezer until you are ready to use it. We do ship throughout the country, however, being frozen has presented us with challenges. We ship overnight which is very costly outside of Oregon and Washington. To adjust and reduce cost we have worked on packaging that will extend the delivery time. Shipping smaller quantities at a low rate is still challenging, but we do have 12 packs in both pints and quarts available for shipping anywhere in the USA for a fraction of the normal cost. Are you local? Select a gift card option instead. You can use it at any of our farmers markets booths, www.nomesschef.com, or to pay an emailed invoice . We still offer free local contactless delivery as we have throughout Covid. Here are some of the flavors on the menu:

Beef - Regular (farm from plain), Italian, Rosemary's, Spicy, Ginger, Thai Spicy, What The Pho!

Chicken - Regular, Italian, Spicy, Lemon Ginger, "OTG" Orange Turmeric Ginger, Thai Spicy, What The Pho!

Turkey - Thanksgiving

Pork - Italian, Thai Spicy, Apple Cinnamon

Duck - "OTG" Orange Turmeric Ginger, What The Duck!


 


 


 


 Bone Broth - Liquid Gold

 

 
 



v

 

Ethically raised, having only one bad day, and we are thankful for the sacrifice.



 

 

We are moving into our new production facility in early 2021. Our pain has been being asked "What stores can I purchase your bone broth?" Currently, we operate out of an Oregon Department of Agriculture facility which limits our sales to direct to customer. Our new facility will be USDA inspected kitchen which will give us the ability to wholesale our bone broth. We are currently working with USDA to prepare for the change. We hope to start having our broth available local retailers by early summer 2021.


Bone Broth Benefits


Anti-aging Benefits

⬇️50lbs from bone broth fast.

Locally Pasture Raised

Cooking with bone broth. 
 



 

SOUPor Sauce

Our SOUPor Sauces came from the desire to make the best tomato soup. We originally used our Italian Beef Bone Broth and it quickly became a hit. The problem was most customers said they were using it as pasta sauce. We also decided to take the bone broth out to make it a vegan product. You can always add our bone broth to it to intensify the flavor. The only liquid in the jar comes from the tomatoes and other veggies. Most pasta sauces and all soups using water, and many use sugar as a sweetener. We do not use either. Instead we use organic coconut to add a fatty sweet richness that ties all the flavors together. Use it out of the jar as a sauce or add out bone broth, coconut milk, or water for a delicious tomato soup or as a base for a soup or stew. We currently make 3 flavors of SOUPor Sauce; Tomato, Tomato & RoastedPepper, and Tomato & Butternut Squash with the possibility of more in the future.

Our main goal of this project is to take our SOUPor Sauces to the next level. We would like to purchase a custom box mold so we can ship them in 3 packs. Currently we are only able to ship in 12 pack boxes since we reuse the boxes that our glass jars come in. The mold will allow us to ship safely so the jars do not break. Additionally, we are working with retailers to start wholesaling Spring 2021. Outside of increasing production we need to purchase barcodes as well as design and label the product for retail.

Heirloom Tomatoes


l

Make tomato soup.


Use it as a base.

 

Campaign Goal

Our goal is set at $3,000 which is the minimum needed in order to obtain everything necessary to be able to complete our 3 pack SOUPor Sauce project. However, we hope to raise more money to help with production needs as we move into our new facility. If you are someone that loves our products locally grab a gift card to save on your purchases throughout the year, or purchase as a gift for a friend. If you would like your gift card amount split between multiple cards simply pledge $2 more for each additional card after one. Use it as an opportunity to explore our many products including our sauces without refined sugar which will return Summer 2021. If you live outside of the PNW choose from one of our SOUPor Sauce or Bone Broth shipping options. Shipping options are available for a fraction of the normal shipping cost.

 

For more info follow us on Instagram @NoMessChef and like us on acebook.com/nomesschef . With our move to our new facility and increased production we will be creating more content in 2021. Expect videos, recipes, interviews, collaborations and more!

 

Questions? Please do not hesitate to ask.

 

Thank you for your support!
