story:
Short Summary

We are Hinson Ford Cider & Mead—Dave, Dennis and Mary. We have been making great ciders and meads for our own enjoyment for decades, and it’s finally time to go pro.

We began laying the groundwork for HFCM in 2016, and since then we’ve self-funded the build-out and furnishing of our production facility and tasting room, and we're proud to say we had a successful soft opening the last weekend in September.

We’re psyched about our ciders and meads finally being available to the public. There are still a thousand-and-one little details yet to attend to—most of which have impressive price tags, and we believe there's always room for improvement in what we have already done.

But our vision for Hinson Ford Cider & Mead is not just about selling cider and mead. It’s about helping our neighbors--the apple growers and beekeepers of Rappahannock County--continue to do what they do in the face of increasing obstacles. If we can help maintain a strong market for apples and honey, that's good for the bees and that's good for all of us. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $60,000 in funding. This will allow us to do the following:

  1. Improve the build-out and equipping of our 3,600 sq. ft. production facility:
    1. Onsite laboratory for raw material analysis and process/quality control
    2. Product handling systems
    3. Chiller system build-out
    4. Bottling line build-out
  2. Improve the build out of our Tasting Room:
    1. Interior improvements and upgrades
    2. Security/telecom/internet infrastructure
    3. Visitor amenities
    4. Draft system
  3. Upgrade our exterior amenities:
    1. Improve outdoor seating areas
    2. Improve parking areas
    3. Expand areas with pollinator-friendly plantings

If we do not reach our campaign goal, the list above reflects our priorities for the funding we do receive.

The Impact

We have been making great cider and mead for ourselves and for our loved ones since forever. We are cider and mead evangelists, making converts one tasting at a time. We are passionate about what we make, how we make it and what we make it from.

Yet there’s more to it than that. At one time, our community was a leading apple producer in the leading apple producing state in the country; we used to grow over 200 kinds of apples here; Queen Victoria extolled the virtues of Rappahannock County apples. Now we’re down to a handful of commercial orchards left, and they can’t make a living selling ‘Red Delicious’ a bag at a time over six weekends in the fall. We want to build a viable commercial market for unique apple varieties while they’re still around. Likewise, while we maintain our own apiary, we hope to build a vigorous market for local beekeepers to help encourage them to stick with it through fraught times. We all need the honeybees, and we all need the beekeepers that look after them for us. Mead helps monetize the value beekeepers provide on a scale greater than a bear-shaped squeeze bottle can.

Risks & Challenges

We face many potential challenges as we launch our business.

  • First and foremost, cider and mead are agricultural products, and depend on a reliable and predictable supply of apples and honey. A host of variables can affect the price, availability and quality of our raw materials. In 2017-2018, Virginia beekeepers lost about three of five hives, the greatest losses in state history and about twice the national average. So in addition to the fruit and honey we produce ourselves, we have supplier agreements with a number of local producers to ensure—to the greatest degree possible while remaining locally sourced—reliable access to top quality fruit and honey.
  • While we clearly view cider and mead as essentials, some people may not. Our success is coupled to an overall solid economy, and specifically to regional tourism drawing consumers from the nearby metropolitan areas (Washington. D.C., Richmond and Charlottesville, VA) to our rural community. An economic downturn would reduce this agritourism, as happened in 2008. However, we have recently discovered--much to our delight--an enthusiastic local community eager to enjoy and support the experience we provide.
  • The markets for both cider and mead are dynamic, experiencing dramatic rates of growth in recent years while other segments of the adult beverage industry are flat or dwindling. However, these rates of growth are spectacular in part because the starting point was so small—current information suggests there are about a thousand cideries and between three and four hundred meaderies in the U.S. Recently, the cider market suffered a small ‘flattening.’ But on closer examination, the ‘flattening’ was entirely at the expense of mass-market ciders, while craft ciders and nanocideries still experience strong growth.
  • Both cider and mead are gluten-free, and represent an alternative to grain-based beverages for GF consumers.
  • As seen with cider, the market for mead is experiencing strong growth in the U.S., with a new meadery opening somewhere every three days on average. The potential for continued growth in the mead segment is very strong, as meadmakers move beyond the stereotypical ‘Four-S’ meads quaffed at your local RennFest: Sweet, Strong, Still, Simple.
  • The market for cider and mead is driven by the desire for a unique experience, and we must be keenly receptive and responsive to changing tastes in a fickle and discretionary marketplace.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know cider and mead might not be your jam; you might  not want to toss a nickel in our tip jar at the moment.  But if you support the idea of HFCM, please pass along our information to your friends on social media. We’ve met some amazing people via social media, and some of the best help we’ve received from them couldn’t be bought at any price. Spread the word far and wide, and let’s make this happen!
story_txt:
Short Summary
We are Hinson Ford Cider & Mead—Dave, Dennis and Mary. We have been making great ciders and meads for our own enjoyment for decades, and it’s finally time to go pro.
We began laying the groundwork for HFCM in 2016, and since then we’ve self-funded the build-out and furnishing of our production facility and tasting room, and we're proud to say we had a successful soft opening the last weekend in September.
We’re psyched about our ciders and meads finally being available to the public. There are still a thousand-and-one little details yet to attend to—most of which have impressive price tags, and we believe there's always room for improvement in what we have already done.
But our vision for Hinson Ford Cider & Mead is not just about selling cider and mead. It’s about helping our neighbors--the apple growers and beekeepers of Rappahannock County--continue to do what they do in the face of increasing obstacles. If we can help maintain a strong market for apples and honey, that's good for the bees and that's good for all of us. 

What We Need & What You Get
We are seeking $60,000 in funding. This will allow us to do the following:

Improve the build-out and equipping of our 3,600 sq. ft. production facility:
Onsite laboratory for raw material analysis and process/quality control
Product handling systems
Chiller system build-out
Bottling line build-out


Improve the build out of our Tasting Room:
Interior improvements and upgrades
Security/telecom/internet infrastructure
Visitor amenities
Draft system


Upgrade our exterior amenities:
Improve outdoor seating areas
Improve parking areas
Expand areas with pollinator-friendly plantings



If we do not reach our campaign goal, the list above reflects our priorities for the funding we do receive.

The Impact
We have been making great cider and mead for ourselves and for our loved ones since forever. We are cider and mead evangelists, making converts one tasting at a time. We are passionate about what we make, how we make it and what we make it from.
Yet there’s more to it than that. At one time, our community was a leading apple producer in the leading apple producing state in the country; we used to grow over 200 kinds of apples here; Queen Victoria extolled the virtues of Rappahannock County apples. Now we’re down to a handful of commercial orchards left, and they can’t make a living selling ‘Red Delicious’ a bag at a time over six weekends in the fall. We want to build a viable commercial market for unique apple varieties while they’re still around. Likewise, while we maintain our own apiary, we hope to build a vigorous market for local beekeepers to help encourage them to stick with it through fraught times. We all need the honeybees, and we all need the beekeepers that look after them for us. Mead helps monetize the value beekeepers provide on a scale greater than a bear-shaped squeeze bottle can.

Risks & Challenges
We face many potential challenges as we launch our business.

First and foremost, cider and mead are agricultural products, and depend on a reliable and predictable supply of apples and honey. A host of variables can affect the price, availability and quality of our raw materials. In 2017-2018, Virginia beekeepers lost about three of five hives, the greatest losses in state history and about twice the national average. So in addition to the fruit and honey we produce ourselves, we have supplier agreements with a number of local producers to ensure—to the greatest degree possible while remaining locally sourced—reliable access to top quality fruit and honey.
While we clearly view cider and mead as essentials, some people may not. Our success is coupled to an overall solid economy, and specifically to regional tourism drawing consumers from the nearby metropolitan areas (Washington. D.C., Richmond and Charlottesville, VA) to our rural community. An economic downturn would reduce this agritourism, as happened in 2008. However, we have recently discovered--much to our delight--an enthusiastic local community eager to enjoy and support the experience we provide.
The markets for both cider and mead are dynamic, experiencing dramatic rates of growth in recent years while other segments of the adult beverage industry are flat or dwindling. However, these rates of growth are spectacular in part because the starting point was so small—current information suggests there are about a thousand cideries and between three and four hundred meaderies in the U.S. Recently, the cider market suffered a small ‘flattening.’ But on closer examination, the ‘flattening’ was entirely at the expense of mass-market ciders, while craft ciders and nanocideries still experience strong growth.
Both cider and mead are gluten-free, and represent an alternative to grain-based beverages for GF consumers.
As seen with cider, the market for mead is experiencing strong growth in the U.S., with a new meadery opening somewhere every three days on average. The potential for continued growth in the mead segment is very strong, as meadmakers move beyond the stereotypical ‘Four-S’ meads quaffed at your local RennFest: Sweet, Strong, Still, Simple.
The market for cider and mead is driven by the desire for a unique experience, and we must be keenly receptive and responsive to changing tastes in a fickle and discretionary marketplace.


Other Ways You Can Help
We know cider and mead might not be your jam; you might  not want to toss a nickel in our tip jar at the moment.  But if you support the idea of HFCM, please pass along our information to your friends on social media. We’ve met some amazing people via social media, and some of the best help we’ve received from them couldn’t be bought at any price. Spread the word far and wide, and let’s make this happen!

story:
Hey All! Erin & Tito here. We recently moved to Albuquerque, New Mexico, from Portland, Oregon, and quickly noticed the severe lack of vegan & vegetarian food options available. We absolutely love our new home, but have found most eateries to be completely meat-centric. So, we bought a food truck & decided to bring our veggie-centric meals to the masses! We will be the first Vegan/Vegetarian Food Truck in Albuquerque, and are positive that this is the Healthy outlet that this area desperately needs.

This has been a dream of ours, for years, and we are SO CLOSE to launching PURA VIDA COMIDA! We have purchased the food truck, most of the basic equipment needed to function, just bought a used SUV to tow the truck (and act as our new family car, since we have a baby on the way), and have lined up numerous events to vend at. 

We have found a excellent local resource that will act as our "business mentor" and provide us with a VERY affordable commissary kitchen. The South Valley Economic Development Center offers a incredibly comprehensive Virtual Incubation Program, which we've just been accepted into! This Virtual Incubation Program will guide us through all of the encompassing details such as: Obtaining our Food Permits, Business License, Food Truck Kitchen Inspection & enrollment in any helpful classes we may need. Once all of this is completed, we are open for business! 

Commissary Kitchen Price Range: $125/month

Food Permit: $200

Business License: $50 

 

Another huge detail is covering the hefty, full-coverage insurance package that we have just been quoted. We shopped around at a number of different insurance companies to find the most comprehensive & most affordable commercial business insurance. It covers the towing vehicle, the food truck, the generator, and all of the equipment inside of the food truck. We will be VERY protected! It's a lot more than we originally anticipated, but we are confident that it's the right fit for what we need.

Farmer's Commercial Insurance: $3,737/year ($311.72/month)

 

And lastly, we have researched & reached out to all of the local companies and resources for the cheapest & best startup inventory costs, such as: Fresh organic produce, local specialty foods/drinks, food warmers, small appliances & compostable serving containers, utensils, etc. Our list is completely simplified, and we know exactly what we need.

Inventory Startup Costs: $1,333.72

 

We have our recipes perfected and our menu finalized!  We have worked incredibly hard to get to this point, and put all of our time, effort, love, energy & resources into it-- but unfortunately, we are completely tapped out. We are scheduled to launch on Wednesday, May 23rd at a local brewery, and are determined to have all of our ducks in a row by that time. Your generous contribution would GREATLY help us in our final push to bringing our dream into fruition. We know that Albuquerque has eagerly been anticipating a healthier food scene, and we are excited to deliver! Plus, once we launch, we are completely open to bringing our food truck to a town near you-- after all, every city could use more Vegan & Vegetarian options! If you are hosting a special event (with hundreds of people in attendance), that is in need of our healthy goods, we will happily make the journey to come to you. 

We understand the intrinsic risk of owning a food truck business, however, we are confident that there is a HUGE, untapped need for more Vegan/Vegetarian food options in this area. The food truck industry is very new to Albuquerque, and is not yet oversaturated like other areas of the country (like Portland, Oregon, for example). Based on this fact, alone, we know that our success in serving this demographic is just around the corner :)          

If, for any reason, you are unable to contribute monetarily, we would greatly appreciate it if you could share our funding link and spread the good word FAR & WIDE about our cause. Thank you SO MUCH for taking the time to learn about our project, and contribute in any way that you can. We are here to make the world a healthier, happier place, one veggie-centric meal at a time!

Much Love,

Erin & Tito

PURA VIDA!!

 

Listed below are our unique perks we will offer, depending on the tier that you decide to contribute:  

$20: A free meal Voucher + Sticker pack

$50: A free meal Voucher + Limited Edition Pura Vida Comida T-shirt 

$100: 5 free meal Vouchers + Limited Edition Pura Vida Comida Hoodie

$500: 10 free meal Vouchers + Limited Edition Pura Vida Comida Hoodie & T-shirt

$1,000: Free Meal Vouchers for an Entire Year + Limited Edition clothing + Recipe eBook

story:
Our Story

We're Bees & Co. - artisan, ethical bee farmers based in Lincolnshire on our award-winning organic farm; the world's first certified Carbon Neutral honey farm.

We provide honey for some of the most recognisable brands in the UK, and are proud to be the first resident beekeepers at the Burghley House estate in over 100 years.

We're no stranger to crowdfunding. Our two previous successful campaigns (one in collaboration with rappers Too Many T's for World Bee Day) helped us begin rearing and reintroducing the now rare native British honeybee, and prevent its' decline.

With a successful program now in place, our native honeybees, lovingly cared for here on our honey farm, have been producing 100% British honey for almost two years. Our Wild Countryside honey has won a Great Taste award and true to our artisan ethics, we've been developing a very special product - British mead.

Consumers are drinking differently to how they have done in the past, as demonstrated by the boom in craft beer and gin sales, and with mead sales both in the UK and the US rapidly increasing (30% in the last 3 years**). With English Heritage stating they sell a bottle every 10 minutes**, now is the time to invest in bringing back this 4,000 year old delight.

 

Preserving the Past

Mead is one of the oldest drinks known to humans. In its most traditional form, a simple combination of honey and water allowed to ferment. For the Ancient Egyptians it was considered a drink of the Gods, but then commercial wine making took over and our ancestors began experimenting with other flavours and methods.

A complex product, mead can be still, sparkling, sweet, dry and even spiced - and by connoisseurs is considered, with its almost infinite variety of flavours and tones developed by the plants the bees forage on to make the honey, a much more superior product to wine.

DID YOU KNOW? Steeped in history, mead is believed to be the root for the word “honeymoon”. For centuries, on the eve of their marriage, the father of the bride would raise a glass of mead in celebration, making a toast to the newlywed couple. The toast continued every evening, at moonlight, for one month (an entire lunar cycle) following. Hence, “honeymoon”.

 

Achingly Artisan

Everything about Bees & Co. is focused on an artisan approach. We've been researching the history of mead and how our ancestors made it for many years.

Many of the very finest recipes were considered lost to time, now simply hearsay and legend. But then we stumbled across one part of a recipe considered to be one of the very finest ever made, which gave us a lead. Eventually, through cross-referencing several books, historical archives and interviewing retired beekeepers, we managed to piece together, bit by bit, the pieces of a remarkable puzzle. Our recipe is more than 100 years old, with very specific elements and conditions essential to its success. Sourcing the exact equipment and components required was a painstaking (and expensive) task.

Finally, our journey is almost complete...

We're turning once again to our trusted crowdfunding community to help us recreate this remarkable, traditional drink, produced to traditional artisanal standards. Where others have used honey in what is otherwise a sweet wine and sold it as "mead", or brewed to modern recipes, our Monastic Mead uses 100% British honey; only 2 other all-natural ingredients and a top secret process to achieve the delicate, soft, moorish flavour. 

Using honey produced by our own native British bees and selected honey farmers in Britain, our plan is to produce both a still and sparkling mead with an ABV of around 14.5%, with a short brew (ready in around 6 months) and a matured, aged brew (matured for several years), bottled by hand into beautifully rustic glass 75cl bottles and sealed by dipping into beeswax. A product as beautiful to look at as it is to drink, celebrating British honey.

Just like we did with kickstarting our native honeybee rearing program, we're inviting a group of you to come with us on this important next step of our latest journey, and celebrate and enjoy the very first batch of truly traditional, artisanal mead brewed to a recipe at least a century old.

We’re a small honey farm, and a family-run, independent business. Just as before, our crowdfunding target is invested directly into equipment, which includes very specific barrels for ageing and fermenting the mead found in only one place in the world; the production and careful sourcing of a very specific British floral honey; bottles and ancillary equipment and some support for marketing what we know is a unique product in the modern drink space. 

We’re excited at the prospect of being able to supply you delicious mead, with an achingly artisanal  backstory, for many years to come.

 

Ways You Can Get Involved

Taste the Honey - £10

(Single estate honey is the secret to great mead. Grab a jar of the finest, raw, 100% British honey featuring a personalised label bearing your name. If alcohol isn’t your thing but you’d like to show your support for our ancestral values and help us preserve history, this perk is just for you)

Sponsor A Queen Bee - £15

(The right bees, producing the right type of honey, is just one of a series of very particular, critical components of an amazing mead. Sponsor one of our native queen bees, who head up our honey colonies, and receive an exclusive bee pin badge, adoption certificate and quarterly updates for the next 12 months on your queen)

Reserve A Bottle - £25

(Reserve your bottle, posted directly to your door. Bottled from the second batch, which is set to become our first retail batch)

Reserve A First Batch Bottle (still) - £75

(To celebrate, we’ll be filming the process of bottling the first 50 bottles. While they’ll absolutely be drinkable, we’d suggest keeping this for a special occasion, or as a potential investment piece. To commemorate the exclusivity of these first 50 bottles, we’ll add a personalised label featuring your name written by Master Beekeeper, Jez Rose, who heads up Bees & Co. and is currently producing the mead by hand.

Reserve A First Batch Bottle (sparkling) - £100

(To celebrate, we’ll be filming the process of bottling the first 50 bottles. While they’ll absolutely be drinkable, we’d suggest keeping this for a special occasion, or as a potential investment piece. To commemorate the exclusivity of these first 50 bottles, we’ll add a personalised label featuring your name written by Master Beekeeper, Jez Rose, who heads up Bees & Co. and is currently producing the mead by hand.

Adopt A Cask - £250

(The oak casks used to store and age the mead are such a particular type, size, age and origin, and so key to the beautiful taste, that their exact specification is a closely guarded secret. Adopt a cask and we’ll add an engraved plaque featuring your name, send you an adoption certificate; beautiful photos of your cask and an opportunity to visit to see your cask in action, along with a gift wrapped bottle of mead from our first batch.)

Adopt An Apiary - £1,500

(The bees are where it all begins, and this perk gives you the opportunity to adopt five hives, which will produce the honey used in our mead. Each hive will feature a special plaque bearing your name; you’ll receive an adoption certificate, quarterly updates of your hives and 5 bottles of mead from our first batch, each with personalised labels)

 

What if?

There’s always the risk when crowdfunding that others don’t quite love the idea as much as you do, and the target isn’t achieved.

In the event of that happening, we’ll still be continuing with our journey, just in much smaller steps because of the set up costs. Backers will still receive their mead but, as with our other crowdfunding projects, part of the joy for us is in sharing the journey - which is why we offer you the opportunity to get involved. 

We've put together some FAQs, but if there's a particular question or concern you have, please do ask away.

 

What You’re Doing

Both of our previous crowdfunding campaigns were on the Indiegogo platform and successfully ended with perks delivered on time, achieving what we set out to achieve. In fact, its the native British bees from one of our previous campaigns that are now producing the beautiful, award-winning honey on the farm.

So we’re back with this very different opportunity.

We are small, independent producers. At the very centre of our business is the beating heart of artisan methods and thinking. We care deeply and passionately about quality, seeking traditional methods that are true to the ancient craft of beekeeping and monastic meaderies.

The drinks industry, much like so many others, is dominated by large business; the art and craft - the attention to detail and the seekers of deeper knowledge - are largely lost. Careful consideration; a gentle and timely approach and a genuine passion can all be seen, felt and tasted in the end product of true artisans. Backing our campaign supports British farming; the British wildlife and environment; small business and perhaps most importantly of all, helps us preserve truly artisanal methods, and the delicious results.

 

Risks & Challenges

Beekeeping is a seasonal activity and largely weather dependent. Without the right weather combination, the bees produce less surplus honey and there is, therefore, the risk that we may have to scale back our mead production.

However, we’re experienced and well-versed in our bees and their honey production, so we’ve developed a tight contingency plan, which involves both expanding our own bee stocks (more bee hives is a good safety net for producing more honey), and continuing to develop good relationships with other independent, bee farmers in Britain, who we can call on should we need to supplement honey stocks. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

COVID-19 has created a remarkably strange climate all over the world. On the farm we lost almost 90% of our income, which at this time of the year comes from people visiting for workshops and experience days.

Fortunately, we were still able to tend to our bees and the ‘time off’ provided us with the final weeks we needed to complete our research and put things into place to bring you this campaign.

We completely understand if you’re not able to contribute, but please do consider helping us by:

  1. Sharing our campaign on social media (don't forget to tag us @ThatJezRose)
  2. Emailing your friends, colleagues and family to let them know
  3. Telling local businesses and press (newspapers, radio stations and magazines) to help us spread the word

 

*https://www.pymnts.com/news/retail/2019/4000-ye...

**https://www.theguardian.com/society/2018/nov/29...

(To celebrate, we’ll be filming the process of bottling the first 50 bottles. While they’ll absolutely be drinkable, we’d suggest keeping this for a special occasion, or as a potential investment piece. To commemorate the exclusivity of these first 50 bottles, we’ll add a personalised label featuring your name written by Master Beekeeper, Jez Rose, who heads up Bees & Co. and is currently producing the mead by hand.
Reserve A First Batch Bottle (sparkling) - £100
(To celebrate, we’ll be filming the process of bottling the first 50 bottles. While they’ll absolutely be drinkable, we’d suggest keeping this for a special occasion, or as a potential investment piece. To commemorate the exclusivity of these first 50 bottles, we’ll add a personalised label featuring your name written by Master Beekeeper, Jez Rose, who heads up Bees & Co. and is currently producing the mead by hand.
Adopt A Cask - £250
(The oak casks used to store and age the mead are such a particular type, size, age and origin, and so key to the beautiful taste, that their exact specification is a closely guarded secret. Adopt a cask and we’ll add an engraved plaque featuring your name, send you an adoption certificate; beautiful photos of your cask and an opportunity to visit to see your cask in action, along with a gift wrapped bottle of mead from our first batch.)
Adopt An Apiary - £1,500
(The bees are where it all begins, and this perk gives you the opportunity to adopt five hives, which will produce the honey used in our mead. Each hive will feature a special plaque bearing your name; you’ll receive an adoption certificate, quarterly updates of your hives and 5 bottles of mead from our first batch, each with personalised labels)
 
What if?
There’s always the risk when crowdfunding that others don’t quite love the idea as much as you do, and the target isn’t achieved.
In the event of that happening, we’ll still be continuing with our journey, just in much smaller steps because of the set up costs. Backers will still receive their mead but, as with our other crowdfunding projects, part of the joy for us is in sharing the journey - which is why we offer you the opportunity to get involved. 
We've put together some FAQs, but if there's a particular question or concern you have, please do ask away.
 
What You’re Doing
Both of our previous crowdfunding campaigns were on the Indiegogo platform and successfully ended with perks delivered on time, achieving what we set out to achieve. In fact, its the native British bees from one of our previous campaigns that are now producing the beautiful, award-winning honey on the farm.
So we’re back with this very different opportunity.
We are small, independent producers. At the very centre of our business is the beating heart of artisan methods and thinking. We care deeply and passionately about quality, seeking traditional methods that are true to the ancient craft of beekeeping and monastic meaderies.
The drinks industry, much like so many others, is dominated by large business; the art and craft - the attention to detail and the seekers of deeper knowledge - are largely lost. Careful consideration; a gentle and timely approach and a genuine passion can all be seen, felt and tasted in the end product of true artisans. Backing our campaign supports British farming; the British wildlife and environment; small business and perhaps most importantly of all, helps us preserve truly artisanal methods, and the delicious results.
 
Risks & Challenges
Beekeeping is a seasonal activity and largely weather dependent. Without the right weather combination, the bees produce less surplus honey and there is, therefore, the risk that we may have to scale back our mead production.
However, we’re experienced and well-versed in our bees and their honey production, so we’ve developed a tight contingency plan, which involves both expanding our own bee stocks (more bee hives is a good safety net for producing more honey), and continuing to develop good relationships with other independent, bee farmers in Britain, who we can call on should we need to supplement honey stocks. 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
COVID-19 has created a remarkably strange climate all over the world. On the farm we lost almost 90% of our income, which at this time of the year comes from people visiting for workshops and experience days.
Fortunately, we were still able to tend to our bees and the ‘time off’ provided us with the final weeks we needed to complete our research and put things into place to bring you this campaign.
We completely understand if you’re not able to contribute, but please do consider helping us by:

Sharing our campaign on social media (don't forget to tag us @ThatJezRose)
Emailing your friends, colleagues and family to let them know
Telling local businesses and press (newspapers, radio stations and magazines) to help us spread the word

 
*https://www.pymnts.com/news/retail/2019/4000-ye...
**https://www.theguardian.com/society/2018/nov/29...

story:
FINALLY, A BALANCED KETO DRINK MIX MADE WITH HIGH-QUALITY MCT's AND NATURAL CAFFEINE THAT NOT ONLY ENERGIZES YOU BUT NOURISHES YOUR BODY

 

 

 

✅ NO ARTIFICIAL FLAVOURS - Great-Tasting and refreshing taste sweetened with Stevia leaf + Erythritol; no artificial flavors or chemicals slowing down your metabolism, you get all the taste and energy through natural caffeine; without the crash or jitters.

✅ BALANCED ELECTROLYTES - K-Slim Energy is perfectly balanced with Sodium, Magnesium, and potassium to meet your daily hydration needs, for your everyday lifestyle. Whether you're doing yoga, working out, or just keeping up with the kids!

✅ 8 VITAMINS - Each serving delivers a release of 4 B-Vitamins, 4-Essential Vitamins, and minerals, to help support your immune system. Ingredients chosen specifically based on the vitamins we lack on the keto diet. 

✅ HIGH-QUALITY MCT'S - With added MCT powder + B12 providing a boost in energy and performance, helps you feel fuller for longer while supporting mental clarity and promoting fat burning.

✅ KETO-FRIENDLY - Full of healthy vitamins, electrolytes, caffeine with added MCT powder to help start your day. With less than 0.5g of sugar and low-carbs, it's the perfect keto drink to help you beat the keto flu. 

 

 

✅ Improve Focus -  Hydration improves Focus.

Hydration is very curial for your health and body, yet 75% of people are dehydrated! When you're dehydrated it can be harder for you to concentrate as you can feel dizzy and fatigued. 

✅ Decrease fatigue - Hydration decreases fatigue.

One of the symptoms of dehydration is Fatigue, K-Slim Energy has balanced electrolytes to meet your hydration needs and keep you energized for hours.

✅ Feel Fuller Longer - MCT makes you feel fuller longer.

MCT has been shown to increase the release of two hormones that promote the feeling of fullness in the body, peptide YY, and leptin (2). [1]

✅ Beat the Keto Flu - Hydration is Key in avoiding the Keto flu.

Staying hydrated is especially important because when you cut out carbs you retain less water and sodium, which in turn can lead to the keto flu. That's why it's important to not only drink water but electrolytes as well! 

 

 

 

 

 

 

STRETCH GOAL:

If we can raise $20,000 we can immediately start work on the next product and increase distribution! When this project reaches that amount, we will let everyone that backed this project vote on which of the following products they want us to create.

It would be one of the following:

  • Another Drink Mix Flavour

  • Caffeine-Free Drink Mix

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Please share this project & video on social media! 

 

CREDITS

 

Scriptwriter, Videographer & Video editor - Howard Lo

 

Actors:

Amy - Alana Malanga 

 

Roomate/Spokespearson - Beàta Nicole Imre

-----------

Source:

[1] 7 Science-Based Benefits of MCT Oil: https://www.healthline.com/nutrition/mct-oil-be...

---------

(Outside of Canada & USA)

International Shipments:

Please note that we are not responsible for any customs fees or taxes. Packages that are delayed due to customs are out of our control.

story:
Hi! My name is Jennifer Utegg. I am currently working on a small business opportunity – a juice and smoothie shop - (The Juice Shop) to be located on Center Street in downtown Corry, PA!

For quite some time now, I have envisioned opening a space to the public that would not only help to nourish the physical body, but also the spiritual and mental. My goal is to offer organic fresh-pressed juices, smoothies, handcrafted organic coffees and teas, and herbal supplements,  as well as some whole-food, unprocessed food options in a calming, peaceful atmosphere. I believe we are called to be “restorers of the streets to dwell in” in our communities and I hope to do so with the opening of The Juice Shop. Our communities and our people need to find real connection, health, hope and peace. 

I am now in the final phases of preparing to open my doors to the public, and that is where you can have an opportunity to sow into my endeavor either by  purchasing a prepaid “gift card” or by making a donation to get me to the finish line! With your support, I will be able to purchase a point of sale system, the supplies to adhere to the Covid-related requirements by the Health Department, and also the final licenses and legal fees. 

With your investment, I hope to raise a minimum of $2500.00 for these purchases to get my business up and running in the next few weeks. With your help, we can make a positive contribution to the city of Corry and the surrounding communities!

Thank you for supporting this endeavor. Together we can make a difference in our community!

Blessings,

Jennifer

story:
The Littlest Bake Shop

The Littlest Bake Shop is a cupcake endeavor by baker, cookbook author and chef, Iris Green. As a gluten free vegan herself, Iris not only loves to bake compassionately crafted treats but also understands the importance of baking gluten free in a dedicated kitchen. 

After months of collaborating on pop-ups with chef, Zaid C. S.  the pair has decided to make it a more permanent arrangement. Starting in May of 2019 645 E. 59th St. will open its doors again as a cupcakery and coffee shop featuring a variety of gluten free and vegan cupcakes alongside artisan crafted coffee and tea beverages. 

In addition the pair will be hosting special gluten free and vegan dinner events and curating a Meatless Mondays with guest chefs.   

What We Need & What You Get

As the space has already been in operation as a cafe and coffee shop the work that will need to be done to the space in order to open in May is minimal and will include design and rebranding the shop,  painting and decor, as well as new and expanded seating. 

The space will require an addition of a commercial mixer and a professional convection oven, and additional power outlets run to accommodate the new demands. 

Fortunately, we need only a little support from the community to truly make this space sing! 

Your support can make the redesign and kitchen build out possible, helping to make a space for safe gluten free baking and the expansion of vegan accessibility in Kansas City. 

In return we are offering incentives for those who are local and those supporters who are far away. We also have incentives for all levels of contribution ranging from signed cookbooks and thank you cards to getting to design and name your own cupcake that will be featured in the shop!

All incentives that include joining us for the opening night party are for you and a guest. Perks that include cupcakes are local pick up only. You can also choose to make a contribution without a perk. 

The Impact

The Kansas City Metropolitan area presently offers no options for an exclusively gluten free and vegan bakery or eatery.

The Littlest Bake Shop, therefore, provides a much needed addition to the marketplace.

The Littlest Bake Shop is more than a cupcakery-- it is the opportunity for everyone from children to the young at heart, to enjoy the special feeling that a cupcake brings to every holiday, celebration or weekend, in spite of dietary restrictions either personal or medical.

According to the US Census Bureau, in 2017 Kansas City, Missouri had approximately half a million people. Celiac disease is considered the most prevalent disease in the Western Society with more than 1 in every 100 people having medical reasons to be gluten free.*  Additionally, many people avoid gluten due to inflammation, digestive needs, or personal choice.

*  American Gastroenterological Association (AGA) Institute technical review on the diagnosis and management of celiac disease.

Rostom A, Murray JA, Kagnoff MF, Gastroenterology. 2006 Dec; 131(6):1981-2002.

The Littlest Bake Shop offers unique baked goods that meets the needs of those with a gluten free diet and those who are vegan, while welcoming those who simply enjoy a good cupcake. The Littlest Bake Shop does not JUST offer delicious cupcakes, we also take particular care in the decoration of each small cake, using artisan decorating techniques and natural vegetable pigments instead of artificial colors.

Founder, Iris Green is a gluten free and plant based chef, cookbook author, and nutrition activist, and Graduate of the T. Colin Campbell Center for Nutrition Studies at Cornell University.

Iris founded the Vegan Underground Supper Club and Green's Center in Los Angeles, California, has written three cookbooks, and taught early childhood education, as well as plant based cooking classes. She presently calls Kansas City, Missouri home where she continues to champion intersectional veganism. Her cupcake business has already seen great success in Kansas City with pop-ups selling out within hours!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge we have is time and money. Our goal is to open in May of 2019, the more support we receive the faster the remodeling and kitchen expansion can occur. This is why we are seeking additional support from the community in funding this endeavor. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are very fortunate to have a lot of community support but we can always use more. Here are a few ways that you can help us with our launch: 

1) Share this fundraiser!

2) Follow us on social media and attend our pop-ups!

Instagram: @plantbasededu 

Facebook: GreensCenter

3) Contact us to help with painting or building if you are local!

4) Have some awesome equipment or furniture laying around that you'd love to donate? Contact us to see if it's something we can use!

story:
​Local/Vegan/Artisanal/ Natural

Misfit Doughnuts and Treats opened on May 13, 2017.  We were Rochester's NY first 100% vegan bakery and doughnut shop. In early 2019 we started an expansion to double the size of our kitchen and seating. We were planning on offering an extended savory menu. We were 95% done with the renovations when on March 27, 2019 a five alarm happened in the building where our bakery is located as a result of arson.  

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need to purchase all new equipment including a new ovens, commercial refrigerators, a new mixer, freezers, and fryers
  • We need to renovate our new location at 133 Gregory St. We need to replace the floors, paint, do some renovations, and update the ansul system. 
  •  

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • We believe that re-opening our 100% all vegan  bakery and doughnut shop is important.
  • We love being part of the community 
  • We utilized Indiegogo to launch Misfit and with your help and support we can can relaunch and be even bigger and better 

Risks & Challenges

Owning and small business is a risk especially a food based business but we were very successful in our past location.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Embracing Community Through Tea

After what seems a lifetime of experiences in the hospitality industry, and a lesser time in legal, and agriculture, and earning my MFA in Fiction and Creative Nonfiction, my passions and dreams have remained the same. Yes, I love to write, but more than anything I wanted a life in Tea.  I love tea, I love the experience, the texture and the depth.  Tea embraces us with a familiarity. We have a history of tea. It has been woven into our 'fabric of life' - our DNA -  so to speak, through the centuries. And, the deeper I go into Tea, the more I am grateful for the experiences of my life, not just the many years in hospitality, but also those years in Agriculture and in Law Offices. The combination of the three has definitely helped me over the hurdles one finds in any business, including Tea.  I have a very deep understanding of farming practices, organics, etc, and my experience in law helps with about any venture.

Hi, I'm Susan Nunn. Although my love of tea goes back to my childhood, the idea of tea as a business, that of Thunder Mountain Tea, grew from my blending tea at the big dining room table at the guest ranch I managed years ago in Arizona. After years of nurturing that idea, it has now grown into where I am today.  Nothing happens overnight, at least not in my world. 

Blending my own teas seemed to be a natural extension of my love for cooking and my love for people. I feel tea brings a sense of belonging to everyone who partakes in a cup of tea, not only with our familes, friends and neighbors, but also it can give us a deep connection to those who have passed before us. Tea has been shared across centuries and now I want to expand on this and share tea across our country, our world.  Yes, tea was meant to be shared. Having a business is great, but at the same time, there is a need for a deeper sense of purpose. My heart leads me to want to reach out to others, share these delicious loose-leaf teas with people who may not have even given 'the comfort of tea' a thought. And, in the process, dispel the myths that shroud the 'art of tea.'

Embracing Community Through Tea.  With all the discord and chaos in our country I feel the need to share some 'calmness' in some way.  I've been asking myself for months, how could I, being just one person and one small company, make a difference in this world? 

At one point, I decided to get a new perspective on all of this, as you can tell in my yoga picture. That, and being in nature always brings me into my center. 

I've been donating tea to different events that tugged at my heartstrings, and giving to people who just need a bit of kindness shown to them, but I wanted to reach out to others in our communities across the country, others I would never be able to reach on my own. 

You see I believe tea to be universal, it crosses cultures, and weaves us all together into community. I also believe that building strong bonds in our neighborhoods and communities is where the strength of our Nation lies. I've always been a 'giver' and for months I played around with this idea, as everything around us has been spiraling into chaos, all I wanted to do was bring a smile to someone's face, letting them know someone cares.  

And, so it began. I started by 'gifting' a bag of delicious loose-leaf tea to each of my customers who spent $30 or more.  All I asked them to do was 'gift' that extra bag of tea to another.  Maybe a family member or friend who was having a bad day - or maybe a neighbor to whom they have never spoken, a work mate, just anyone they wanted to give something to, something that would bring some joy into another's life. It has truly been a success!  The recipients of these 'gifts' have been so overwhelmed with gratitude, and those who receive the 'gift bag' in with their orders are very grateful, and even before it arrives, they say they already know who they will give it to. 

Some businesses just want to build a customer list, but for me it is about building a 'caring community.' As you can tell with the Rewards Program I have set up, I am calling the donors Ambassadors. I send tea for their own use, and then 'gift' them bags of teas to 'gift' to others. 'Ambassador' is a perfect word, trusting others to carry the torch forward, to catapult this Initiative into Orbit.

Can you help me?  Please donate what you can, and I will send you the teas you sign up for, and please forward this project out to your social communities.  Let's see how far we can spread this.  I have made the commitment to do this for a minimum of one year, and then we will re-evaluate it and see where it can go next.  I know we can 'rock with compassion' and the teas and the 'gift of giving' will make us all a tighter knit community. 

What We Need & What You Get

With the launch of this project, no longer will this be an 'I' project, it will instantly become a 'We' project. There is a proverb -  'It takes a village to raise a child,' and it also 'takes a village' to boost any 'caring' idea into orbit.

I have been working with advertisers and some different packaging companies, and looking at shipping costs (which I will share the cost) to see what my fundraising goal should be for this campaign. One thing for sure, the tea that is gifted will have a label all their own and the tea will always remain of the highest standards.  All 'gifted' teas will be the very same teas I ship to tea lovers on a daily basis.  I waited to make sure this project was catching hold, and now after 'gifting' teas for the past few months, and seeing that it is an idea that people really are getting excited about, I am now designing the new labels for these.

I am asking for you all to kick in and help me.  This is the first funding request to catapult this project into orbit!  After we deem this project a success, then we may launch a second in the fall with a different objective, that of reaching more specific groups of our population.

Amount needed to fund this project:  $10,000.00  Below are only estimates as the costs will change with the amount of response we get. 

  1. Advertising and printed material - $4500
  2. Labels (Designing and printing) - $1500
  3. Products, Packaging, personnel, misc. - $4000

What I will do to move this forward:  Being a writer is helpful in times like this.  I will set up talks about the project and will write articles about it, sharing as far and wide as I can get it, submitting to magazines, newspapers, and many online as well. We will develop a strong presence on all aspects of Social Media. And, I will advertise in different magazines and am looking into NPR.

What is in it for you? 

I have some exciting perks, especially if you are a tea lover, and a lover of peace and strength in our communities.  Such as, beautiful Tea Presses, both small and large, Teapots, Tea Cozies and tea wallets, and, of course, delicious teas delivered to your home and bags of these same delicious teas to 'gift' to others.     

If we don't reach our goal, the project will continue at a slower pace, but it will continue. I am committed to this for at least one full year. 

The Impact

I understand that asking the donors to 'gift' the teas I send them is asking them to do something more so than their financial gift.  I admit this is unusual for these platforms, but I have a purpose in designing this in this way.  In order to spread goodwill, each of us has to take responsibility to get the 'gifted' teas out to others. That is the only way it will work. These delicious teas, which we know can help center us and give us a connection, combined with the spreading of goodwill which will 'lift' the people we reach out to, will, in the process, help build strong and caring communities across our nation. 

This past year, I have worked the Capital City Public Market in downtown Boise every Saturday.  What I discovered is:

  •  Although there are many people who were thrilled to have loose leaf tea and to taste all the different teas, there are many who have never tried them.  They are extremely curious about the loose leaf teas, and would probably love them, but are intimidated - thinking they need a whole different knowledge base before they can try them.
  • From college kids to the elderly, many say they don't have extra income for such, thinking loose leaf tea is a luxury, but would love to try them.
  • People from all walks of life flock to the tea booth for samples. They are surprised at the wonderful and earthy blends Thunder Mountain Tea is becoming known for.
  • Tea builds community.  It is a powerful tool for our fractured society.  It is joyful to just watch the people of different cultures, the different age groups, all gathered and laughing and discussing the different teas.  
  • There are lots of tea companies out there in this world.  Each has their own business plan, their own vision - and I have mine. After years of managing hotels, lodges and guest ranches, and a lot of years in kitchens, I came to realize  that most don't serve the best teas.  I spend hours at a time sourcing the best teas and botanicals at the best prices, and I move those prices forward to the consumers. 
  • By contributing, you will become a 'Tea Ambassador for Goodwill' and as you 'gift' the teas I 'gift' to you to others who may be struggling or to a neighbor you have never spoken to, or a friend who's having a bad day, you will reap the rewards of 'giving' and making someone a little happier.  Tea, as I have said, is universal, and it can be the 'thread' that brings our communities across the country together. As if we needed a reason to speak to others - the tea is reason enough.
  • Those who receive the teas will know that someone cares.  This is huge.

Challenges

As I stated above, I have a lifetime of experiences in hospitality, agriculture and the legal field.  I have coordinated large conferences in remote settings (which means one has to be very organized) and have hosted several workshops and retreats. Taking care of people is what I have always done.  I love tea, and I have two wonderful employees to help me with this project. 

I feel I have in some way mastered the blending of teas.  I say in some way as I don't believe there will ever be a time when i am not learning more each day, but, I feel I have a good understanding of the business, and of the teas, and I have two good employees, so I don't foresee too many obstacles in this year-long project. After several years of being in the tea business, my supply chain appears to be in good working order.  My way has always been - if I run into an obstacle, I just find a way around it. I never let things upset me, knowing I can work my way through any challenge.

Other Ways You Can Help

I want you all to know how much I appreciate you.  If you can't contribute funds, don't worry about it.  You would be doing this Initiative a huge service by just sharing this on your social media and getting it out, further and further into the social media macrocosm.  Using the Indiegogo share tools works beautifully.  Thank you and wishing you peace, Susan
story_txt:
Embracing Community Through Tea
After what seems a lifetime of experiences in the hospitality industry, and a lesser time in legal, and agriculture, and earning my MFA in Fiction and Creative Nonfiction, my passions and dreams have remained the same. Yes, I love to write, but more than anything I wanted a life in Tea.  I love tea, I love the experience, the texture and the depth.  Tea embraces us with a familiarity. We have a history of tea. It has been woven into our 'fabric of life' - our DNA -  so to speak, through the centuries. And, the deeper I go into Tea, the more I am grateful for the experiences of my life, not just the many years in hospitality, but also those years in Agriculture and in Law Offices. The combination of the three has definitely helped me over the hurdles one finds in any business, including Tea.  I have a very deep understanding of farming practices, organics, etc, and my experience in law helps with about any venture.
Hi, I'm Susan Nunn. Although my love of tea goes back to my childhood, the idea of tea as a business, that of Thunder Mountain Tea, grew from my blending tea at the big dining room table at the guest ranch I managed years ago in Arizona. After years of nurturing that idea, it has now grown into where I am today.  Nothing happens overnight, at least not in my world. 

Blending my own teas seemed to be a natural extension of my love for cooking and my love for people. I feel tea brings a sense of belonging to everyone who partakes in a cup of tea, not only with our familes, friends and neighbors, but also it can give us a deep connection to those who have passed before us. Tea has been shared across centuries and now I want to expand on this and share tea across our country, our world.  Yes, tea was meant to be shared. Having a business is great, but at the same time, there is a need for a deeper sense of purpose. My heart leads me to want to reach out to others, share these delicious loose-leaf teas with people who may not have even given 'the comfort of tea' a thought. And, in the process, dispel the myths that shroud the 'art of tea.'
Embracing Community Through Tea.  With all the discord and chaos in our country I feel the need to share some 'calmness' in some way.  I've been asking myself for months, how could I, being just one person and one small company, make a difference in this world? 

At one point, I decided to get a new perspective on all of this, as you can tell in my yoga picture. That, and being in nature always brings me into my center. 
I've been donating tea to different events that tugged at my heartstrings, and giving to people who just need a bit of kindness shown to them, but I wanted to reach out to others in our communities across the country, others I would never be able to reach on my own. 
You see I believe tea to be universal, it crosses cultures, and weaves us all together into community. I also believe that building strong bonds in our neighborhoods and communities is where the strength of our Nation lies. I've always been a 'giver' and for months I played around with this idea, as everything around us has been spiraling into chaos, all I wanted to do was bring a smile to someone's face, letting them know someone cares.  
And, so it began. I started by 'gifting' a bag of delicious loose-leaf tea to each of my customers who spent $30 or more.  All I asked them to do was 'gift' that extra bag of tea to another.  Maybe a family member or friend who was having a bad day - or maybe a neighbor to whom they have never spoken, a work mate, just anyone they wanted to give something to, something that would bring some joy into another's life. It has truly been a success!  The recipients of these 'gifts' have been so overwhelmed with gratitude, and those who receive the 'gift bag' in with their orders are very grateful, and even before it arrives, they say they already know who they will give it to. 
Some businesses just want to build a customer list, but for me it is about building a 'caring community.' As you can tell with the Rewards Program I have set up, I am calling the donors Ambassadors. I send tea for their own use, and then 'gift' them bags of teas to 'gift' to others. 'Ambassador' is a perfect word, trusting others to carry the torch forward, to catapult this Initiative into Orbit.

Can you help me?  Please donate what you can, and I will send you the teas you sign up for, and please forward this project out to your social communities.  Let's see how far we can spread this.  I have made the commitment to do this for a minimum of one year, and then we will re-evaluate it and see where it can go next.  I know we can 'rock with compassion' and the teas and the 'gift of giving' will make us all a tighter knit community. 
What We Need & What You Get

With the launch of this project, no longer will this be an 'I' project, it will instantly become a 'We' project. There is a proverb -  'It takes a village to raise a child,' and it also 'takes a village' to boost any 'caring' idea into orbit.
I have been working with advertisers and some different packaging companies, and looking at shipping costs (which I will share the cost) to see what my fundraising goal should be for this campaign. One thing for sure, the tea that is gifted will have a label all their own and the tea will always remain of the highest standards.  All 'gifted' teas will be the very same teas I ship to tea lovers on a daily basis.  I waited to make sure this project was catching hold, and now after 'gifting' teas for the past few months, and seeing that it is an idea that people really are getting excited about, I am now designing the new labels for these.
I am asking for you all to kick in and help me.  This is the first funding request to catapult this project into orbit!  After we deem this project a success, then we may launch a second in the fall with a different objective, that of reaching more specific groups of our population.
Amount needed to fund this project:  $10,000.00  Below are only estimates as the costs will change with the amount of response we get. 

Advertising and printed material - $4500
Labels (Designing and printing) - $1500
Products, Packaging, personnel, misc. - $4000

What I will do to move this forward:  Being a writer is helpful in times like this.  I will set up talks about the project and will write articles about it, sharing as far and wide as I can get it, submitting to magazines, newspapers, and many online as well. We will develop a strong presence on all aspects of Social Media. And, I will advertise in different magazines and am looking into NPR.
What is in it for you?  
I have some exciting perks, especially if you are a tea lover, and a lover of peace and strength in our communities.  Such as, beautiful Tea Presses, both small and large, Teapots, Tea Cozies and tea wallets, and, of course, delicious teas delivered to your home and bags of these same delicious teas to 'gift' to others.     

If we don't reach our goal, the project will continue at a slower pace, but it will continue. I am committed to this for at least one full year. 

The Impact

That is the only way it will work. These delicious teas, which we know can help center us and give us a connection, combined with the spreading of goodwill which will 'lift' the people we reach out to, will, in the process, help build strong and caring communities across our nation. 
This past year, I have worked the Capital City Public Market in downtown Boise every Saturday.  What I discovered is:


 Although there are many people who were thrilled to have loose leaf tea and to taste all the different teas, there are many who have never tried them.  They are extremely curious about the loose leaf teas, and would probably love them, but are intimidated - thinking they need a whole different knowledge base before they can try them.
From college kids to the elderly, many say they don't have extra income for such, thinking loose leaf tea is a luxury, but would love to try them.
People from all walks of life flock to the tea booth for samples. They are surprised at the wonderful and earthy blends Thunder Mountain Tea is becoming known for.

As if we needed a reason to speak to others - the tea is reason enough.

Taking care of people is what I have always done.  I love tea, and I have two wonderful employees to help me with this project. 

I feel I have in some way mastered the blending of teas.  I say in some way as I don't believe there will ever be a time when i am not learning more each day, but, I feel I have a good understanding of the business, and of the teas, and I have two good employees, so I don't foresee too many obstacles in this year-long project. I never let things upset me, knowing I can work my way through any challenge.

I want you all to know how much I appreciate you.  If you can't contribute funds, don't worry about it.  You would be doing this Initiative a huge service by just sharing this on your social media and getting it out, further and further into the social media macrocosm.  Using the Indiegogo share tools works beautifully.  Thank you and wishing you peace, Susan

story:
Short Summary

After inheriting a family farmhouse picnic table and relishing in the love of friends & family gathering around delicious food, Fig + Goat came to fruition.  Fig + Goat provides you with the best at-home happy hour you've ever had.  After choosing your membership subscription, each month a box will arrive on your front porch and come loaded with artisan meats, cheeses, nuts and other hand-selected accompaniments.  Fig + Goat is known for it's unique food pairing combinations and is very keen on providing high-quality and delicious food.  We take the utmost care when we are creating your beautiful charcuterie boards for your parties, weddings, showers, events and other gatherings! 

Our Meats:  We source our meats from makers who partner with small family farms who practice natural and humane techniques which include: 

No factory farms

No use of antibiotics

No GMO’s

No unethical practices

Only vegetarian diets

These farms do not use gestation pens but rather provide space for the animals to live naturally and move around which shows respect for the animals’ social instincts and natural behaviors.  These makers use old-fashioned techniques and traditions that have been passed down for generations.  Only quality ingredients are used in their products and it’s noticed in the taste and presentation of these hand-crafted meats. 

Our Cheeses: One of the main goals of one of the Creamery’s, where we source our cheeses, is to just make Wonderful Organic Cheese!  By using certified organic milk and fine ingredients such as native grass and cool ocean air as the base of their cheese making techniques, these makers create seasonal cheeses that are flavorful and delicious.  

It’s not a surprise that we source cheese from makers who have won numerous awards and accolades!  These farmers just let their cows be cows, roam freely and eat grass, the way nature intended. Our cheesemakers are not just producing cheese, they are following their purpose and are dedicated to producing the highest-quality, and most delicious cheeses. They truly love making people happy.

 I feel that not only providing you with a beautiful board, but a board where you can taste the quality of the food is what makes Fig + Goat different than every other meat and cheese tray. Thank you for appreciating the food like we do!  We’re looking forward to delivering a Fig + Goat Board to your door soon!  :) 

Besides all this delicious food, every box also comes with a pairings menu so you know exactly what to pair with that blue cheese bite! 

Fig + Goat is a happy hour in a box waiting for you after a long week at work. It's the perfect way to spend an evening with girlfriends. It's the perfect accompaniment to any at-home date night. It's an anniversary gift. it's for anyone, anytime!  

Fig + Goat boxes are meant to be quickly assembled in a natural way.  The goal of a box is to make it effortless to start enjoying your evening.  Are cherries in season in your part of the country? Did you just pick up some fresh figs or dried chili mangos from your local farmers market over the weekend?  Add them to your board!  Fig + Goat Board Boxes provides an easy illustration guide on how to assemble a board, but we want to spark creativity and enjoyment when preparing your own Fig + Goat board.  Food is fun and we almost guarantee that if you prepare a Fig + Goat Board for your next get together it will most definitely be the best at-home happy hour you've ever had!  

What We Need & What You Get

  • When starting a business like this you have many costs. When ordering things like packaging, our boards and inventory the minimum order quantities are often higher than we with they were, along with the price per unit. We're raising capital to help cover the high startup costs and ease the upfront burden. 
  • In order to achieve this we're offering a discount on the board boxes we'll ship out our opening month as well as offering a few unique Fig + Goat Private Party options. You're going to fall in love with the Fig + Goat Gathering Boards and I'm pretty sure we'll all have an amazing time at the private parties as well, if you're lucky enough to snag one of them. :)
  • If we don't reach our goal we will still be launching the Fig + Goat Board Boxes. Maybe not as big as we want, but we're bringing Fig + Goat to you across the country either way! 

The Impact

Fig + Goat has been a successful Dallas based catering company to-date.  Each Fig + Goat gathering board is hand-crafted and artfully displayed, making it the perfect pairing for any bridal or wedding shower, house-warming gift, party or event.  Fig + Goat has been highly received as THE catering company to provide boards for Cocktail Wedding Receptions in the Dallas - Ft. Worth area.  

After wanting more from our customers, who would request the option of being able to send a Fig + Goat board as a gift across the country, we have now added the Fig + Goat Board Box.  Now, you will be able to send the gift of Fig + Goat to anyone, anywhere!  

Since the excitement and demand for the Fig + Goat catering side continues to grow, we will soon be launching franchising options to people who have a love for food, community and creativity to run their own Fig + Goat Gathering Board business in their own local market.  

Risks & Challenges

Starting a business with this many moving parts can be a challenge, but we've been hard at work for months. From food selections and pairings to our refrigerated fulfillment center and recyclable packaging, to our new website and this campaign, we've worked through many challenges and have developed a solid team.  Here's a couple additional challenges we anticipate working through as we grow. 

  • Capital requirements to support projected inventory and packaging requirements. 
  • Scaling up our operations, staff, and fulfillment center while maintaining the close knit culture we value.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate you reading and learning more about Fig + Goat.  If you are captivated and ready to have the best at-home happy hour you've ever had, we hope you can take advantage of our pre-sale and order a board or two at a discounted rate.  Thank you for sharing our campaign with your friends and for helping us spread the word about Fig + Goat!

story:
We firmly believe in leading a healthy and natural lifestyle; that being said we also believe that there are times when a cup of coffee just doesn't get the job done. That is why we created Vito. We were tired of all the chemicals and the frankly unhealthy amount of caffeine in the energy drinks available on the market today, so we took them out entirely. Vito uses roots and herbs that generations have trusted to deliver a product that goes beyond just a temporary kick. It is not just a product, it's a lifestyle.

Ingredients 

 

  • Ginseng and Gingko: Improve blood flow, increase cognitive activity and energy levels.
  • Magnolia Berry: “Adaptogen”, prevents stress while increasing energy.
  • Rhodiola rosea: Reduces fatigue and stress.
  • Centella asiatica: Improves mental clarity and memory.
  • Green Tea: Concentration boosting ingredient and energiser.
  • Hoodia: Strong stimulant that raises energy levels and suppresses appetite.

 

The beverage will be lemon-flavoured since the acidity of the fruit helps mask the taste of the other ingredients, and the negatively charged ions in the lemon help increase the flow of oxygen to the brain, increase alertness and decrease drowsiness. 

The team and why we're here

Being students, we lack the financial means to get the product out of our laptops and into supermarkets. That is why we need you! We will use 100% of the money raised in this Indiegogo campaign and invest it into Vito. We hope that a success here will give us the funds needed to further develop the product, get it manufactured and into your hands as soon as possible. Of course, we are confident that you'll fall in love with the product from your first sip onwards. That is why we will be pushing to get the product into a supermarket near you, just to save you from the blues. 

Timeline

We currently require funding to finish stage two. Pending a successful campaign, Vito should be ready to drink by March 2018

As we all know, supermarkets are notoriously hard to get into, but with your help, we will show them that people care about their health, about taste, and about quality.

Manufacturing

We have partnered with a turn-key beverage manufacturer in order to further develop the recipe and to ensure that there are no delays in delivery. Upon the ending of the campaign, we will work with our partners to ensure a speedy delivery to all those who have supported us.

Share 

We know that some of us can't live without caffeine so this product might not be for you. Still, help us get the word out! Share the campaign with everyone: your friends, your brother, your sister, even your dog!
