As we all know, supermarkets are notoriously hard to get into, but with your help, we will show them that people care about their health, about taste, and about quality.
Manufacturing
We have partnered with a turn-key beverage manufacturer in order to further develop the recipe and to ensure that there are no delays in delivery. Upon the ending of the campaign, we will work with our partners to ensure a speedy delivery to all those who have supported us.
Share 
We know that some of us can't live without caffeine so this product might not be for you. Still, help us get the word out! Share the campaign with everyone: your friends, your brother, your sister, even your dog!

story:
Overview

Martina's Vinegar is the first project of this kind in the world. It aims at taking balsamic vinegar to a whole new level. As a female vinegar maker from Modena, Italy (the land of balsamic), my goal is to make the world of balsamic vinegar a little more female-friendly and also to spread knowledge about a still underrated and misunderstood product.

I honor the century-old tradition as I grow and hand-harvest the grapes myself from my estate vineyard, and I follow the traditional process passed on to me by my ancestors. Martina's vinegar is about continuing this tradition by growing my family production into a structured business as one of the few female entrepreneurs in the field, and do this in an innovative way to change the way people see and use balsamic vinegar: my goal is to spread a new understanding around this legendary product and make people see its real value thanks to the experience it can provide. 

The journey started around 1940, when my family set up the first barrels. According to family records, the vinegar that we now have has aged in wood barrels for over 50 years. This vinegar is a piece of  history that I want to share with you. ​

 

Why Modena on the Entire Planet

The original balsamic is exclusively produced in Modena. The moist and humid weather, the winds, the soil give a very special taste to the grape juice. The huge temperature excursion between summer and winter that characterizes the area allow for a unique aging process. And only a few indigenous grape varieties are good for balsamic vinegar. All things you cannot replicate anywhere else.  If you add to all this the secret ingredient of time, with the vinegar that ages for decades in different woods, you’ll see why this is a unique culinary world heritage.

 

A Treasure from Ancestors, a 50-year aged Vinegar

Since I was a little girl, I used to see my family make balsamic vinegar at home, continuing the tradition started by my great-grandparents at the beginning of 1900, boiling down the grape must in a bonfire in the fresh September air and let it age in our vinegar loft with care, passion and dedication, for decades. The vinegar that we have today is the result of this miracle: it has aged for over 50 years. Decades of patiently waiting for a unique product. The long aging process in wood barrels added over time a completely unexpected feature to this vinegar. 

 

My Dream 

This project is about growing as female vinegar maker to give continuity to a long tradition, as well as to educate people about the way in which, we, Italians from Modena, see and experience balsamic vinegar. Let me explain. 

1. The Ultimate Food Luxury. Balsamic vinegar is everything but salad dressing. My goal is to make people see this because this opens up to endless experiences. My balsamic vinegar is rich, smooth, with a syrupy texture, deep brown in color, and has a complex flavor that balances the natural sweet and sour elements of the cooked grape juice with hints of wood. It has a lively acidity combined with rounded sweetness. All flavors are exceptionally concentrated. 

It allows for simple but impressive food pairings, as well as easy and fancy drinks, cocktails and classy shrubs. It pairs perfectly with meat, cheeses, and fried food. It is also delicious with risotto, or fish, ice-cream and fruit. Most people do not know that you can easily make sophisticated dishes or drinks with some drops of balsamic and share them with family, friends and neighbors to truly impress them and give them an unprecedented palatal experience.

2. Conceiving Time Differently Teaches you how to Appreciate Life More. Balsamic vinegar is not just food, it is part of a sophisticated and meditative lifestyle made of quality time, family, friends and love. It is integral part of the Italian way of life. Traditionally, when a child is born, grandparents used to give the child a series of barrels to the grandchild. In this way, the vinegar ages as the child grows and this is an incredible way to transcend time.

3. Balsamic Vinegar as Asset Class. Balsamic Vinegar is, and increasingly will be, an asset class. It is not yet as obvious as wine, but there are a few factors that show why it is so:

  • It is scarce in supply. Supply is also tightly controlled and also really impossible to replicate anywhere else in the world.
  • High prices have been paid in auctions (up to $95,000/gallon) and prices are on the rise despite the moment of crisis.
  • Authenticity can be ascertained and verified.
  • Its quality and value increases over time and do not degrade (it allows for the type of stable and improving quality an appreciating asset requires). 
  • It is not any more difficult to understand than wine, maybe easier to understand.

4. An Endangered Tradition. There aren’t many young producers, and definitely very very few female balsamic vinegar makers. Most people that now produce balsamic vinegar here in the area of Modena are over 70 or 80. And women are almost non-existent in this industry. I do not want this century-old tradition to go lost with newer generations, but mostly I want to assert the value of women's work in an area of entrepreneurship, such as agriculture and food, where women are still underrepresented. 

 

I Need your Help

My goal is to save my production, grow, and improve processes to turn this into a real business. With the funds from your donations, I would like to:

  • Repair my ancient barrels. Some barrels are almost a century old. Some were originally used for liqueurs or beer brought by WWII soldiers and they were washed and cleaned so that they could be used for balsamic vinegar aging. Some others are more recent, and I need support to continue production.
  • Buy new barrels to increase production, add additional and special productions, as well as new equipment to improve processes.
  • As a young and female producer, I need support in spreading this innovative concept of a product that originates from a long tradition but that is also modern, cool, sophisticated and moves with the times.

 

What You Get

Martina's Vinegar is a limited edition balsamic vinegar. Elegant bottles, individually numbered and dated, contain a special vinegar obtained from cooked and fermented grape must aged in oak, cherry, juniper wood barrels. Every year I only bottle 10% of my whole production, to give continuity to the aging process. 

As a sign of gratitude, this year I want to share it with you. With my personal reserve I can only create 30 boxes. I have created 2 types of boxes that you can choose from:

Luxury Box:

  • 2 bottles of vinegar (100ml/3.38 fl oz each) aged 15 years, in barrels that are almost a century old. 

Dream box:

  • One bottle of vinegar (100ml/3.38 fl oz) aged 15 years. 
  • One bottle of vinegar (100ml/3.38 fl oz) aged over 30 years. 

All vinegar is aged in barrels that are almost a century old. 

In addition to the 2 bottles of vinegar, both Luxury and Dream boxes also include: 

  • Vinegar tasting kit that includes a pipette and the traditional ceramic spoon
  • Access to food pairing suggestions, as well as drinks and elegant shrubs with instruction on how to make them at home
  • Discounted prices on purchased quantities for the next 5 years!

 

Packaging is hand-made in Italy. The boxes are crafted individually by expert Italian tailor hands.

Additionally, I have created other perks as a thank you for your help. 

 

Finally, as an add-on, you can get the Vinegar Tasting online course. The course covers:

  • Play with your senses and discover new sensations
  • Learn the basics of balsamic vinegar making
  • Assess authenticity: differentiate between good and less good balsamic vinegar
  • Play with food and drinks to create unique tasting experiences for family and friends
  • Learn to properly invest in balsamic vinegar as asset class.

You are in good hands: l train regularly at tasting sessions, I will be soon a sort of a vinegar sommelier.

The boxes are also a great and unforgettable holiday present! 

If I don’t reach the entire goal, I will ship all the perks anyway to anyone that adopted a barrel! There is no risk for you of not getting your perk.

 

The Impact

Your contribution means supporting me and my family in our effort to craft and share the most authentic balsamic vinegar and take it to the world with an innovative concept. Your contribution inspires community, which we hope is found around every bottle of my vinegar. You contribute in saving a tradition that is now less and less known among younger generations, and you will help a young female producer make the difference in the challenging world of food production, agriculture and business.

I thank you from the bottom of my heart for considering of participating into this ambitious project. I hope you will join me in this adventure!

Select a Perk and show your support! Help spread the word via Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, and E-mail.  Find me on IG @martinas_vinegar

 

Note: perks are displayed in Euro currency because I am based  in Italy, Europe. Please consider the exchange rate when donating.
